Reviews.Title: “Average, Clean - - Ok”
Reviews.Author: K-Davis2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since it was near our office in London. For a hotel that is more geared to business travelers, I was surprised that it lacked Wi-Fi in the rooms. You could only get it in the lobby, but after a long day, it was not worth the time to go down stairs. It was a clean, aesthecially pleasing room and fairly spacious relative to European hotels. Easily accessible to two different Tube stations,but not near any major tourist sites within walking distance,so you will need to take the Tube. Another odd thing was how you took the elevator as you had to press a kiosk that would tell you which elevator bank to use.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: Suzie A
Reviews.Content: Nice clean aesthetic. It has a clean and "new" feeling while still have character. Simple, tasteful design choices (not clunky or frumpy, as some such London establishments are). Delicious breakfast. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A night on the town!”
Reviews.Author: AlysonSillett
Reviews.Content: Close to Regents park, across the road from Great Portland Street Tube Station, Melia White House offers a very warm welcome, with clean and comfortable rooms, if a little small. Breakfast is not included in room rate and VERY expensive so we didn't partake and can't say if it was good or not! On departure we were offered a MAS card which would have made it much cheaper, but too late for us by then! Would go again if we needed to be in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: KimEvridge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Melia White House on the recommendation of son and daughter who stayed there a couple of years before and we were not disappointed. The front desk people were so nice and helpful. Room service/food/prices were great. A nice feature in our room the ability to swing open the windows and let nice fresh cool air in. But best of all was the "Conseguir's" , we could not have found our way around London/Paris without there help. We will definitely stay here next time we are in London.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore London”
Reviews.Author: Trumph
Reviews.Content: We chose the Melia Whitehouse to clock up points on the Mas Melia loyalty programme and it was a sound decision. Bus and tube access is outstanding. Get an Oyster card and save time and money on travel. The London Busmapper APP was excellent - honest. Try it for yourself. Melia Hotels have never failed us and this experience was no different. We were on a mission to showcase London to our son so we didn't spend much time in the hotel but we did notice the buzz humming from the main bar. Residents who booked "The Level" enjoyed access to a smaller, more intimate dining room for breakfast and were invited to the same room in the evening for complimentary drinks and snacks - all very nice. I intend to use it again next time I'm in London, even though the view from the hotel is quite sterile.

Reviews.Title: “A good location for a choice of tube stations and spotlessly clean.”
Reviews.Author: Scouser-Sue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a two night stay. Booked online through Melia MaS rewards our room was only Â£98 per night (room only) but we were also given a Â£30 per day voucher which although it could not be used to pay for Breakfast could be used against Room service orders or lunch/dinner in either of the Restaurants. The hotel lobby, lifts, corridors and our room were spotlessly clean. We had arrived at Euston at 9.15am and the walk only took 15 minutes but we were able to check in straightaway - a great start and a warm welcome. Having Great Portland St tube station only 2 mins away and Regent Park station 5 mins away we were soon in many other areas of the city. On our day of departure we had 10am tickets to the Royal Academy and were not sure we could be back at the hotel to check out by noon, no problem. we could extend our checkout . The staff are so welcoming, the floral arrangements everywhere so lovely, and everything worked out great, including a Â£30 bottle of wine each evening , delivered to our room paid with our vouchers, we thought our Â£98 room rate was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JBicrs
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience with this hotel. It is a beautiful hotel. I booked the "classic" room (the lower-priced option) and got a great King bed, and nice sized room overall by London standards. The bathrooms appear to be newly renovated and when I get a chance I'll post a couple of pictures. I agree with the other reviews- its proximity to the Great Portland tube station is outstanding. I also had a meeting at the Royal College of Physicians, which is just on the edge of Regent's Park. If you have a meeting there, use the nearest gate into the park, and it is less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I was on a tight budget so I didn't have breakfast in the hotel which I believe was 21 pounds. The only criticism that I have is the cleanliness of the room. When I moved the drapes, the wall behind the desk had visible mildew on the wallpaper. Not sure why. The bathroom was reasonably clean but there appeared to be dust on top of the amenities. And when I opened my computer when I came back to the office, a lot of dust had setllted on the keyboard, which I have never had happen. The sheets and bedding (the important part to me) and towels were immaculate, as was the tub/shower. However if you are super-fussy about cleanliness, you wouldn't have liked my room. I would stay again but would have someone accompany me to the room when I first check in. Staff was excellent- helpful and friendly, and always available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for me.”
Reviews.Author: filly21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night, ideal location for a wedding I was attending but I'd think pretty perfect for any tourist visiting London. Huge hotel part of a big Spanish chain, nice reception, I booked online and paid Â£120 for one room for one night but that included Â£15 per person voucher for food or room service (not mini bar or breakfast) which was a nice bonus. Didn't use any facilities other than the business centre which was well kitted out with computers/printers/copying etc. My room was small (they did admit the classic rooms were on the small side and offer to upgrade me but the extra Â£25 didnt seem worth it for a night) and maybe a little noisy and tired if I was being picky but perfect for my needs and very well equipped with the usual trouser press, nice bathroom toiletries, hair dryer and mini bar (charges automatically so don't move anything!). The room was clean and tidy and the hitel in general was sparkling, however the bath was hairy which is yukky hence my 4 stars! All in all a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming White Melia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bish007
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, very clean good choice of breakfast and the staff were friendly and helpfull.The White melia is a ideal base for Sightseeing trip as many of the London Atrractions are within walking distance,there are also two underground stations close by.We were able to leave our bags safe and secure at the hotel even after we had checked out,this was most helpfull as it enabled us to continue sightseeing and we returned for our bags later.Make sure that you leave yourself plenty of time to check in as this took ages.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in London.”
Reviews.Author: Matt R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a number of family members to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. From the moment we arrived we were looked after, catered for, welcomed, and made to feel like we were the only people staying there. The hotel is in a great position just two-minute's walk from Great Portland tube station. Oxford Circus and Regent's Park are both close also. The hotel is stunningly decorated; clean & modern yet with a combination of new and old art adorning the walls and tables. There is a calm, relaxed atmosphere the moment you walk in and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Our executive bedroom was fantastic; spacious, clean, modern, well-appointed with TV, mini-bar, tea & coffee making facilities, and a lavish bathroom with all sorts of soaps, shampoo's & lotions. The bed was huge and comfy and there was no noise from outside, despite roads being pretty close. There is a wonderful bar that serves afternoon tea as well as the usual beers, wines and cocktails in the evening but perhaps the highlight is the magnificent breakfast. Everything you could wish for is on offer, freshly-cooked, tasty, and lots of Spanish influence (but you still have the traditional English if that's what you're after). The waiters and waitresses couldn't be more helpful and courteous and, throughout, we were made to feel special and valued as a customer. This hotel is highly recommended and one of the best I've stayed in whilst travelling in London.

Reviews.Title: “Breathe in!”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a mixed experience. Let's start with the good. The breakfast choice and service was very extensive and nicely executed with cheery staff. Now the less good.The check in took ages, not because there was a queue but the check in agent struggled to get my booking identified at the rate I had prepaid - this was 15 mins! The room (upgraded apparently) was on the top floor and was, at first appearances nice. However the reality was the bathroom was tiny and one had to manouvre round to open the door; the room and bathroom needed a good dust; the room was showing signs of high wear; the towels had an aire of dry cleaning solvent;there was significant noise from the services on the roof above (extractor/lift machine room I assume).

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but feel short changed.”
Reviews.Author: AggyGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a classic double room on the 5th floor having booked direct through the Melia hotels website. The room was in the main clean and tidy however there were small areas of mould growth around the bath edge under the shower. The room we stayed in was compact. There was not much room to navigate around the bed. The bed was advertised as a king size bed which it was but it was two mattresses together which meant a small gap down the middle which I hate. The bathroom was small and getting into and out of the bath/over shower was an art. The bath was deep so some agility was required getting in and out whilst remaining upright! The check in and out process went well. The staff were fine and the reception and communal areas of the hotel were excellent. The location is good just away from the main road so traffic noise is minimised. 3 underground stations are nearby - we mainly used Warren Street (10 mins walk) and Great Portland St (5 mins walk) which enabled quick access to most of the city. Buses run on the main road near the hotel. We used room service - food was fine and promptly delivered. We ate once in one of the restaurants and the service was slow and the food quality was hit and miss. Some good and some not so good. Overall the stay was fine but somehow felt short changed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and communal facilities”
Reviews.Author: Tinsley_S_D
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is superb for anyone coming in from the north of England on the train and won't be too much trouble for those coming in from abroad. It's an ideal place to explore much of the tourist areas north of the river and was easy on the tube to the likes of Greenwich. The reception, bar and restaurant were grand, as is the exterior, and hark back to a 30s style. On arriving the check in wasn't smooth as some rooms weren't ready but the cocktails in the bar were refreshing and the mellow atmosphere in there meant the delay didn't cause any stress. The rooms are very cosy (maybe a bit tight for some), but at the end of the day I was in London and there are much better things to do than hang around a hotel room! The secondary glasing kept out enough of the traffic noise despite our room facing Grt Portland Stn and so there was no sleep disruption even for a light sleeper. Breakfast is a substantial buffet with cava if you can get to it but at over Â£20 a pop it's not worth the money, even for the hungry. Best bet is walk over to the little cafe by the station which does decent coffee and breakfast stuff. Service at the reception and at breakfast wasn't as good as I had expected from a 4* but wasn't bad. A good experience overall though.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Rooms Lovely Common Areas”
Reviews.Author: uxonion
Reviews.Content: This used to be my favourite London hotel by beautiful Regents Park. However the rooms are now a little dated. The breakfast is ludicrously expensive but OK if you are on expenses. Service is good. Well served be the tube. You can walk into Oxford St but don't miss the park in spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Central London.”
Reviews.Author: gpcck
Reviews.Content: This is right next to Great Portland ST Tube. You can walk to the west end in 15 mins & it`s a 10 min stroll from Euston Station. The rooms are quite small but you expect this with London hotels. You do get some road noise as the rooms have secondary glazing. The breakfast is great & the bar is a great place for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “fluff and no substance”
Reviews.Author: seajay1111
Reviews.Content: The reception hall is impressive, but sadly not matched by the standard of the hotel. The reception staff denied all knowledge of prepayment by the agent depite my written confirmation - it took phone calls from the agent to sort it out. The room was a suprior room and was a little like a stage set - painted wood etc but ok, bed was comfotablle, but the bath had mould growing inthe corner and previous occupants hair on the side. Breakfast was pretty disappointing other than for the freshly cooked omelettes - considering this is a hotel with Spanish influences, the orange jiuce was frankly undrinkable. the lift system is interesting, and rather confusing and to be honest, no more efficient than any other. On the plus side you do get one free hour of internet with which to check your e mail . I was there for a meeting, and the luchtime food was worse than disappointing - sweaty sliced cheese with a slice of tomato on sliced white bread, even if this was a budget menu, it showed severe lack of imagination and execution. I don't know what this hotel is trying to be, but whatever it is, it's not succeeding

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: rooms were in very good condition but a little on the small side compaired to American hotels. I never ate in the hotel resturants or bar, too expensive. But there were plenty of resturants surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strange reviews?”
Reviews.Author: PaulioStottio
Reviews.Content: Bad reviews? I question bad reviews when on visiting Melia White Hotel I found everything was to both mine and my wife's satisfaction. On arrival the front of house staff were quite superb. There were no problems @ check in and on arriving sooner than our check in time the staff were responsive in saying we could leave our baggage safely whilst we popped off to see the sights. Our room was a standard double and was more than comfortable with a huge bed, working TV, plumbing fine, decor up to the mark, clean and tidy, quiet, even though we had a 'roadside' allocation etc etc. We didn't take breakfast or dine at the hotel as I found it a little on the expensive side. There are places to breakfast on Warren street close bye - one of note being an Italian run place which had free wifi unlike the hotel. No free wifi was a bit of a downer at the hotel as in these times I feel it should come as an attractive bonus to your stay? All in all I would definitely stay here again and cannot understand the negative feedback, but then I didn't stay in every room in the hotel? Other bonus's would be the close proximity of three tube stations. I found this handy for planning trips out and about. Regents park was also about 10 minutes walk away form the hotel. Thanks Melia White House for helping me make my Valentines weekend a success. Oh and by the way - this is a genuine unbiased account!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no soundproofing in rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrsT251
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from one night at the Melia White House. The hotel is in an excellent location and the public areas are lovely. The rooms are well-equipped and clean but the standard double we were allocated was very small and dark. Our stay was ruined however by the complete lack of soundproofing between the rooms. There was an interconnecting door (locked!) between us and the room on one side and you could hear everything through it. On the other side of us there was no interconnecting door, just a thin wall. The people in this room for some reason had their T.V on till the early hours and then started talking at about 5am - they weren't doing anything wrong just low-level chat but you could still hear it from our room. As a result we got virtually no sleep all night. We asked to be moved and were offered a room on the 8th floor but this was overlooking a busy road and the noise was incredible. In fact I thought at first that someone had left a window open it was so loud. We won't be going back!

Reviews.Title: “very high standard and friendly”
Reviews.Author: northwestkildare
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Melia White House having stayed there previously on a number of occasions. The hotel has undergone a revamp and is looking very well. The renovations have given the hotel a fresh new look and it still maintains it's homely atmosphere. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the MAS points system gives value for money. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kally B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great value. It's walking distance from Euston and the West End, so we walked everywhere and didn't have to use public transport once. We loved the super kingsize beds and the shower was lovely. Would definately choose Melia for our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornwallOnTour
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on business, superb location, excellent service and excellent quality. Gave me a space of tranquility amongst the hustle and bustle of London I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Classic”
Reviews.Author: JonesRon
Reviews.Content: The Melia White House is all you could expect of a 4* hotel as are the other Melia hotels I have stayed at. It is beautifully furnished and the attention to detail is to be commended. The staff are very helpful and professional. There are two really good restaurants with meals at reasonably priced for the quality. Even better if you like Spanish cooking. The bar is very relaxing with a piano player for entertainment. The hotel also has a fitness suite. It is well postioned for getting about as there is a choice of 3 tube stations for trips into other ares of London. I could not fault ithe stay and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Whitley”
Reviews.Author: Joyce W
Reviews.Content: Well, it is 34 years since I last stayed at the White House when my daughter was a little girl BUT it will NOT be another 34 years before I book in again. I have just stayed, with my daughter, for three nights 3-6 Feb 2012 and it was faultless. We arrived early at 2pm, were welcomed warmly and allocated a superior room with everything explained very fully to us. Our bags had been taken from us on arrival and were brought to our room just a couple of minutes after we arrived. The room was great (No 290), didnâ€™t want for anything and after a few minutes there was a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine delivered, in an ice bucket, as our stay was to celebrate my daughterâ€™s birthday. A very nice and much appreciated gesture! The room, as with the rest of the hotel, was absolutely spotless. Individual heating control was a great bonus as I am recovering from a serious illness and feel the cold very quickly. The buffet breakfast choice was second to none and I defy anyone to say they needed lunch after that! Longfordâ€™s bar was very pleasant and the food and service there matched everything else. Buffet evening meal in the Place has to be experienced to be believed, again phenomenal choice of dishes with attentive staff. Sadly, we had to leave to return home and check-out was as friendly, quick and efficient as check-in. All in all, a memorable weekend and I will not stay in Mayfair again; the White House is the one for us.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel... part of a Spanish group”
Reviews.Author: Pepper22_12
Reviews.Content: Staff and service brilliant. A small but well appointed room. Room service 24/7 was good value and fast to arrive (3am!). Very well located for a weekend in central London.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference 2 years makes!”
Reviews.Author: Bobs_head
Reviews.Content: I last reviewed this hotel 2 years ago - with a positive outcome. 2 years later, and the rooms are tired and in need of refurbishment. My room was freezing cold, very small and of very strange proportions, being the room at the end of the corridor. Upon entering the bathroom, the reason for the cold became clear. Single glazed windows that didn't shut properly, so I could see through the frames directly to the outside! And in the middle of January! It was late when I arrived and feeling too exhausted to request a room change, I turned the heating up and got in to bed. Bedding & towels were clean, bathroom was relatively clean. The TV needs replacing - it was huge (non LCD) with terrible reception & sound. Was woken numerous times in the night by what I can only describe as running water. I checked my bathroom 3 times, and the only source of the noise I could seem to find was the air con / heating unit. It woke me up so much that I barely slept. The bathroom situation was interesting in the morning, as it was dark outside, so I needed the light on. No blinds or any kind of privacy in this room - you are basically on show for everyone outside. I'm not shy, but it was too much! It was so cold, it was like taking a shower outside. Go to the Cumberland at Marble Arch instead - they have had a refit, rooms are airy, lovely & modern. But if you do go - avoid room 340.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: petersimons
Reviews.Content: if you can get this at the right price this is a very nice hotel in a good location its very clean and the staff seem to be very friendly the only issue was the line at checkout in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, okay service, great location. Only if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Melia White House holtel on a number of occassions. The location of the hotel is perfect for anyone wanting to enjoy what London has to offer - close to the bars, shops, restaurants and theatres of the West End, convenient for the City, and yet tucked away from the manic hustle and bustle of the city. The rooms are very small, but are also very comfortable. The beds are very comfy. The bathrooms have high end fittings, but are quite cramped. The showers are often in alcoves and are quite dark, while last time I had to manoeuvre sideways to use the toilet. Not a big deal, but irritating. I would say they were ideal for a single person, or a couple, who intended to spend most of their time out and about. They are probably not great for a family, The rest of the hotel is very plush and high end. The lifts are bizarre (you have to specify your floor in the lobby and get allocated to a lift), but in terms of a review that is neither here nor there. The only big criticism I have of the hotel is the price, and not just of the rooms. When paying for a room in a top end hotel, I find it frustrating when they charge an additional amount for things like internet access, and there was no wi-fi in the rooms. The staff have always been courteous, but not particularly friendly or efficient. All in all, this is a hotel I would recommend if you can get a deal on the price, or if your company is paying. I would not consider staying here if I had to pay the full price. I just don't think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, good service!”
Reviews.Author: xq22
Reviews.Content: Went there for attending a conference in the last week of Jan. Boy, were the rooms small!!! After the very impressive lobby and fancy, albeit slight confusing centralised elevators.. The room size was a bit of a letdown. Guess that's a European thing! That aside, the hotel had a lot of positives. Well located (a minutes walk from great Portland street station) and about a pleasant 10 minute walk from Oxford street, this hotel makes a lot of sense if the primary purpose is to shop and relax at Regents Park next door. The service was excellent, both at the restuarants as well as the front desk. Concierge was helpful While the rooms were small, they were clean and well furnished. The answering machine system was a little tricky to use as well...but guess thats not the end of the world. All in all, this place is tiny, well located, offers good service. Value for money wise there might be better deals elsewhere.( for instance the holiday inn on finchley rd near O2 mall or the hilton metropole on edge ware road, which certainly are better sized properties)

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Central London”
Reviews.Author: Cazski
Reviews.Content: I found this to be an excellent value hotel in Central London: - The hotel is well situated on the London tube network; walking distance to Great Portland Street & Warren Street, and therefore just a couple of stops from Euston (for connections across the UK) and Paddington (for Heathrow). Itâ€™s a longer walk to the tourist attractions, but the tube connections are good. - The service is good; a very helpful concierge and also reception proactively approaching people in the queue to offer early check out in the morning to save you waiting â€“ much appreciated! - The hotel is a beautiful old art deco front building, and given itâ€™s age still a very good state in both public areas and rooms. The beds were comfy, and the size of the rooms about average for London. Being an old London building, it is double glazed, but there is a little street noise still coming through due to how the window mechanism works, but nothing too bad. The only other thing they should consider (perhaps a theme for many hotels!) is the hairdryers!!! Why is it a hotel hairdryer is completely different to one youâ€™d ever buy yourself I donâ€™t know â€“ but in this case it was one of those tube affairs, which chucks out a lot of noise, but not a lot of heat. So bring your own if you want your hair dried in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Reeds85
Reviews.Content: Good value if booked late.Very clean.Good location would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value weekend deal”
Reviews.Author: ElisabethBSC
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a bargain junior suite through late rooms for 2 nights at the weekend. Were able to use the Level lounge and included breakfast. Third stay here. Good well located hotel (2 tube stations very nearby) service standard varies.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, let down by a couple of things”
Reviews.Author: MartinPh
Reviews.Content: Booked through a lastminute secret deal, and although its not as 'close to Oxford Circus' as I expected (for whcih I blame lastminute not the hotel), I was very happy with the selection. The lobby is impressive, the staff friendly & helpful, the room was larger than I expected & well appointed. The bathroom was perhaps a litle on the small side, which might bother some. Only downside is that the hotel is behind the times technology wise: the TV signal was fuzzy & there was no wi-fi. In 2012, a high-quality hotel should offer wi-fi. I was able to connect my Mac by cable for 30mins free access, but the speed was so plainfully slow that I gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DerbyhireHappycamper
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, definately worth upgrading to the Level. Rooms not huge but meets all the required needs and is kept very clean.Stff very friendly. Beware when using the hotel restaurant (Albufera) that the drinks are expensive - so when offered a Cava to start be wary of the cost (Â£10 each glass). The hotel is at the top of Great Portland Street and a 5 minute walk to Regents Park (London Zoo). Its 5 minute walk to Oxford Street, but take longer with some great old fashioned London pubs down the side streets to make it more interesting - better than the tube !

Reviews.Title: “Very Nearly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: arundelmews
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip this hotel, For just a few days of Shopping and Shows. Because of my ( Mas Card ) We were room upgraded for a small amount of money and a service called The Level. Which gave us access to a smaller and more intermate dining room + hot & cold drinks and snacks until 10.30 pm.When I booked this was the only London hotel that offered a full English breakfast included in the price, I could find fault with some of the breakfast buffet hanging around too long, this could be put right by having a chef cooking to order. and the bar service when its busy, is not good enough. The room we had was Light, Clean, and perfectly serviced. The beds are very comfortable We liked the decor. its elegant and maybe to some people who like a minimalist look it would not be to there taste. But I say do your homework and look on line before you book. Its a great positition with Regents park at the side of you. All staff from reception to cleaners were so friendly and charming. Its very rarely that you find everything that you want in a Hotel, But this one hits most of the marks.

Reviews.Title: “A sad, sad experience.”
Reviews.Author: Karlswife
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this to anyone. This was just a sad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not really up to the Marketing Hype”
Reviews.Author: Rex D
Reviews.Content: Advertised as Elegant and Luxurious and I am sure it was in the 80s, but very much in need of room renovation and the rooms they currently have are not really clean. Hotel charges for Internet GBP16 per day!!, Rooms need a through clean, although bedding was ok. If you really are looking for an Elegant and Luxurious stay, close to Oxford Circus, this is not the hotel to book, its not elegant, not luxurious and certainly not that close to Oxford Circus as advertised on Lastminute.com top Secret.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: martin d
Reviews.Content: an excellent hotel in an excellent location ,we only stayed one night but the sevice from the staff was top class when needed ,great comfortable room i would recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: Despite having been past the White House many times over the years, I have never paid it any attention, but my wife had stayed last year and recommended it when we had to make a last minute trip to London. We found an excellent rate (that still makes me smile) via an online hotel agency that I thought would probably leave us in a small windowless room. Luckily I was wrong. We were given a warm welcome at check in and assigned a superior room that had plenty of space in the main body, although some may find the bathroom a little on the small side (it has a good shower though). The double bed was very large and had a proper mattress (not two singles pushed together). Generally we had a very quiet night, but there were occasional noises from neighbouring rooms, plus the curtains and doorway did let in some excess light (so for those that need total darkness to sleep be aware). We treated ourselves to a late-night drink in the bar which is a good size and very comfortable, although a couple more staff to speed up the service would be a benefit. The lack of car parking is a problem, although you can park on the street close by, you just have to watch out for when and where you need to pay. Although there are London hotels in a more central location, Great Portland Street tube is just across the road, Oxford St and Regent St are less than a ten minute walk and there are plenty of places to eat and drink less than five minutes from the lobby. Even if you are paying the normal rate for this hotel it is well worth considering. Would be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great Location”
Reviews.Author: redforpluck
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via travel republic and got a really good deal, bed and English breakfast Â£118 for two of us. The hotel itself is very smart with a definite Spanish flavour to the decor -lots of marble,wood panelling and pale gold wallpaper with some really nice and unusual prints on the walls.It's definitely a level up from the usual generic corporate type hotels.Our room was small but nicely decorated, clean and comfortable with an enormous bed and everything you need (including tea and coffee making facilities).The staff were all really friendly and helpful and let us check in early and leave late . The breakfast also was until 11 am so we could have a nice lie in on Sunday morning.It was the location of the hotel though that was really good, Regent's Park is literally over the road i9f you fancy a stroll or a picnic and it was lovely to come back to such a peaceful base after the hustle and bustle of London. There are two tube stations very close so getting to most of the major sights is easy. The restaurant looked fantastic and we shall definitely be trying this on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of luxury and good location”
Reviews.Author: paula h
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband and my brother and sister inlaw . great hotel with comfortable rooms and great location for seeing london , its a good walk but nice on a good day and camden is within walking distance and well worth a trip lovely relaxed athmosphere. if you dont want to walk there is a tube station right across the road > small bar but cosy .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Yellowpandamonkey
Reviews.Content: Booked as a top secret hotel on last minute...certainly not disappointed with any aspect of the hotel. Very helpful staff, complimentary room upgrade on arrival. Hotel and rooms very clean and well maintained. Only minor niggles that the towel radiator didn't work and the service in the hotel bar was really slow. But don't let those bits put you off. Location is great...book it!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, many pleasant experiences.”
Reviews.Author: LMouse
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here I think 10-12 times now and most times I have been really impressed. The only bad thing I could say is the smokers...yes, I know you can't smoke in there, but the number of guests leaning out of windows smoking is a disgrace. On 2 occassions I have had rooms that have clearly been occupied previously by smokers - ash and ciggy ends on the window ledge and room stinks. Last time I went I had a fresh smelling room (hurray) only to have a smoker next door who seemed to chain smoke and I like an open window in my room, but I was nearly smoked out. A real shame. Smoke alarms right by the windows please Melia White House! Only other gripe is breakfast starting too late! For a huge central London hotel this is poor. I always check out before breakfast starts and have to find somewhere else to eat :( But I must finish on a high note. The reception staff are so friendly and accommodating, the restaurant staff helpful (although a couple struggle with English). The rooms are generally great and I have always managed to get good deals which make it superb value. The bathroom products are good and beds usually very comfy. Have just booked my next stay, looking forward to another relaxing night.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, friendly & well furnished”
Reviews.Author: RossMcA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business, arriving late on the Wednesday night around 11pm. It is literally 200 yards from Great Portland Street tube station so quite easy to reach from Heathrow Airport. Check in was a little slow but friendly and helpful. I had a junior suite which was nicely furnished with separate seating area and additional TV. The bathroom had a really good range of toiletries and extra provisions like a shaving kit, etc that you rarely find complimentary. I had a cooked breakfast in the morning which was fresh and tasty and a good healthy lunch, there was loads of choice at both breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly excellent hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: helene123Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia through UnitedVacations.com December 26 to January 2. It was a really nice place. It was a very quiet location but convenient to a few tube stops and the Regent's Park bus stop. We decided to upgrade to the "level" accommodations which included the English breakfast buffet and evening tapas and drinks. This turned out to be really worthwhile. The breakfast was great....all you could eat of English bacon and fried or scrambled eggs as well as smoked salmon and fruit and lots of other things. We had the evening tapas buffet just about every night. A couple of nights we had the tapas buffet and didn't need dinner. Also, there was wine and cocktails every night with the buffet. The room was really huge so we could leave the suitcase open and we were very comfortable. Two reasons why I didn't give this 5 stars. First, lack of free internet in this day and age. Only half an hour of free wired internet. Free wireless down in the lounge, but this really didn't suffice. Secondly, the television was really outdated. We got lots of great channels (although no American channels!), but the television reception was really not good. I definitely recommend this hotel. Being Christmas, there were lots of families, and the lobby was pretty crowded, but overall it is definitely a 4-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Eam77
Reviews.Content: Very happy to recommend this hotel. Very convenient, excellent staff and service. Tube across the road taxi's always available outside. Beside Regents Park for a relaxing walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: cupcakeBangkok
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the fancy foyer and the abundance of staff standing around waiting to help. Scratch a little deeper and you'll find a poorly managed, unprofessional and overpriced motel. Broken heating, no internet (although included in room rate apparently), no TV reception, pushed together single beds, extremely small room, door did not latch... I could go on. Second room assigned was the same except I had internet connection, had to wire the TV in to the wall myself. Front desk not receptive at all. Breakfast buffet was good, but won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in the middle of London”
Reviews.Author: 21Lily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia White House hotel mid-December 2011, while on business trip. I booked it last minute not really knowing what to expect as I'd never heard of this chain before and did not get time to check Trip Advisor reviews. Anyway, what a fantastic surprise! For once a great hotel, which doesn't just pretend to be! The staff was courteous and efficient. The standard room, which might qualify as superior in some other place, was clean, spacious and confortable. And you get 30mn free internet, which was plenty enough for checking emails. Most importantly the hotel was quiet - no disturbance by noise from the outside or inside the hotel! There are two restaurants - I tried the buffet one. As the hotel is part of a Spanish chain, the buffet was a wonder of tapas, paella, Sanish hams and cheeses. It is an understatment to say I enjoyed it. I did not try the more formal restaurant, but judging by the buffet one, it can only be great. The breakfast was not included but I highly recommend to get it - you can get everything you want from cooked breakfast English style, cold meats, fresh fruits, cereals, nice selection of breads and pastries, even pancakes! If I have the chance I will definitely stay there again and I definitely recommend it to everybody, whether you go for a business trip, or seek a romantic city break.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL.....dangerous small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: richslugger
Reviews.Content: SMALL DANGEROUS BATHROOM we have recently stayed at the hotel and whilst the hotel was very nice and clean..the rooms spacious..the food was excellent and the service was fine... the down side to this was the room bathroom...we requested a bath in our booking as my wife requires one...the access to the bath and shower was narrow and high to stride over the edge. i myself am a athletic build with large shoulders and really struggle to gain access through the space and found it even more difficult as it was high to stride over the bath. what was more worrying was my wife slipped and hurt her self as she got out of the bath because it just wasnt a workable space to get in and out. we complained and requested a move but to no avail as this was over the new year period such a let down and i wish i would have took the matter further as it was an anniversary trip and seemed to spoil the weekend shame as it is a nice hotel .....

Reviews.Title: “Overall, good room”
Reviews.Author: RogueReviewer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great area. Very nice and walkable. The room was small but clean and nicely appointed. The coffee service was a nice treat after a day of serious shopping. Thought it's been almost a year since we stayed here, I still remember one drawback. The concierge was an absolute nightmare. Though the hop-on-hop-off bus stop was no more than 50 feet away from the hotel entrance (no exaggeration), the concierge had never heard of such a thing. When pressed, he suggested we go to the Marble Arch by taxi and inquire at the tourist office there. Thankfully my Lonely Planet app was more helpful then the concierge. I never had to ask for assistance or a recommendation thankfully, I can only image what he would have said. While delicious, stay away from the breakfast. The cost seems astronomical when compared with establishments in the area that offer breakfast. Overall, very nice with only 1 or 2 inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....sneaky small print.”
Reviews.Author: Skitiludrop
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel.Great location for Central London attractions...But.......Everything has an "extras" charge.....our Hotel Voucher had so many exclusions it was as good as useless...Beware.We used it in good faith only to be told it was valid for room service but not for breakfast room service.....I ask you.....customer service response post checking out has been unhelpful and reminds me of dealing with an insurance company......squirm,wriggle,exclusion clause...blah blah.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and comfy in central London”
Reviews.Author: ulf_11
Reviews.Content: calm and comfy rooms with very good access to London city. Nice bar to relax after shopping or business. Good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Incredible improvement”
Reviews.Author: alanwm
Reviews.Content: Some time since I stayed in this hote but I must say that my most recent visit proved to be a truly welcome surprise. The only issue I had was with the length of time it took to check-in. On this occasion I stayed in an Executive room on the 5th floor and it was both comfortable and well maintained. The service in the 'Level' club room was exceptional, where it really was service with a smile. This visit has certainly made me change my mind about the hotel and I will not hesitate to stay again (but only if it's in an Executive room).

Reviews.Title: “Best value for business in London”
Reviews.Author: SuroAB
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at the Melia White House in London, as I think it is one of the best room/locations/services you can get for less than 150 pounds/night. The location is awasome, within walking distance of Euston Station, and right in front of Great Portland tube. Also it is a 10 mins walk to Oxford Circus, and even 20 mins to Camdem Market. As for the rooms, I have only stayed on the executives rooms (which they call "The Level"). This rooms cost around 30 pounds more than regular rooms, but it is worth every cent. The rooms are extra big (for London) and quite well appointed (though it is not my taste). "The level" includes free internet, breakfast and access to a lounge with free drinks and appetizers. Overall It is a very good experience. The only con, is that the lifts are quite strange and not the easiest to operate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good sleep”
Reviews.Author: Gibbo077
Reviews.Content: The Melia white house has a nice lobby and bar area. Check-in was a little slow, perhaps due to staff trying to sell us extras and upgrades which we found really annoying. The room was a little dated, cheap TV and really old school hairdryer 'box' in the bathroom. The biggest disappointment was the bed and pillows, really not comfortable at all and by the third night I longed for my own bed. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Room and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: fenoris
Reviews.Content: We booked in for Saturday the 17th of December - 2 Executive Rooms on Level 4. The rooms were very cold and despite calls to maintenance and hotel staff it was not resolved - we had to sleep in our clothes - To make things worse 2 days after our stay we found out that the hotel had charged us 4 times for our stay and it would take 7 days until the money was returned. The manager and staff were most unhelpful I have stayed at this hotel over 30 times - will never stay again

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: emma258
Reviews.Content: The room was fine but small. We were offered vouchers to spend which seemed a good deal, but it was not made at all clear to us where we could spend them in the hotel. We understood we could not use them for breakfast or for drinks at the bar. We were certainly not told that we couldn't use them for food in the bar. When we came to check out they said we had to pay - so we missed out on the vouchers and had to pay for the food we thought would be covered by the vouchers. (Â£60). They were very unbending and did not seem to think there was anything wrong with their miscommunication. It spoilt the last morning of our trip and made for an expensive stay. A real rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable rooms”
Reviews.Author: jimbo1683
Reviews.Content: This is our company's preferred hotel and I used to like it, but it's become drab and dreary. I've stayed about 3 times in the last 9 months. The building looks great and the lobby is promising. Every room seems to be a different size. I've only ever stayed in standard rooms but the first time I stayed I had a lovely large room, the second time it was a smaller room and this time it was a cupboard. The room was so tiny it felt like a cave, it was dark and had a long dark corridor from the door to the main room past the bathroom, separate toilet and wardrobe. I couldn't squeeze past the end of the bed to get to the desk. I called down to ask for a different room and the receptionist first denied that it was a small room and said all 'Classic' rooms are quite small (I know that's not the case because of having larger rooms before). She then asked me to pay for an ugrade. No way! I said. I did get moved to a slightly larger room at the end of the corridor. The rooms were obviously once elegant, now they're dated, walls are scuff marked, the colour scheme is Spanish c.1990. For a central London, expensive, supposedly high end business hotel I'm amazed this place doesn't have wifi. The LAN cable doesn't stretch to the bed so you are forced to sit at the desk to use a laptop. There's hardly any plug sockets in the room, none by the bed, only 1 at the desk and 1 on the opposite side of the room. It's so badly thought out - how am I supposed to plug my lap top in and charge my phone and work productively with this set up? All in all this is just a dissappointing hotel which is content to cash in on business travelers without making any efforts to update or move with the times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'Harley Street' accomodation”
Reviews.Author: MCBDurham
Reviews.Content: I booked a Junior Suite at the Melia for the period 14th November to 18th November 2011, having arranged for Laser eye surgery at the London Vision Clinic. I travelled into Kings Cross station on the 0920 from Durham, arriving in London a little after noon. Taxi fare to the hotel was only Â£6.00 and the journey took under ten minutes. Having never stayed at the Melia before, I proceeded to the front check-in area, where I was promptly dealt with by a courteous member of staff. I was informed that as a 'Level' guest, all formalities would be dealt with at an exclusive check-in area at the rear of the lobby, where I would be given my room key and an introduction to the inclusive facilities associated with the 'Level'. My cases were carried from the front lobby to a waiting area at the rear, and then onto my room. It is important to remember that whist the 'Level' costs a little more than a standard room, the use of the lounge, afternoon drinks and fully inclusive breakfast make it a very persuasive option. The afternoon cakes and late afternoon canapes etc simply add to the experience. The room itself was on the 4th floor of the hotel, and provided two sided views of the surrounding area. The purpose for booking a suite, was that my wife would have a comfortable environment in which to rest, watch TV etc during my evaluation/assesment time at the clinic, and this proved to be particularly worthwhile. The room was large and airy, though the bathroom was a little smaller than usual, albeit very well appointed. The only downside from our viewpooint, was the absence of a pillow top on the bed, which is something that we have grown to expect in most mid to upper end establishments, especially in the USA. The hotel is situated a mere 5mins walk from Harley Street, and is adjacent to Regents Park. Eateries are plentifull within walking distance, and there are a number of convelience stores across the road at the top of Portland St. Having undergone surgery on the Thursday morning, we returned to the hotel where the staff made every effort to afford that extra bit of consideration, particularly given my desire for low lighting and additional tissues and towels. The maid was particularly helpful, as were the staff in the lounge, where we sat in candlelight throughout the evening. On the Friday morning, check-out was prompt and efficient, and concluded a pleasant stay at the Melia, which we hope to visit again in the not too distant future. Many thanks to all. CMB

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: L M
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here on 26 November for one night and we really wished we had stayed longer, the hotel, staff, hotel bar and room were all fantastic. The location was amazing, 5-10 minutes to Oxford Street and New Bond Street etc. The staff in particular on Reception were so nice, friendly and helpful. Our room was 610, it was a great size and had the most comfortable bed! We cannot wait to return to this wonderful hotel, hopefully sometime in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Melia White House”
Reviews.Author: Almontonians
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia White House in mid-September. We loved everything about the hotel. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet. It has a very large selection of food which is all delicious and fresh. There is even champaign! Our room was quite clean and well-appointed and up-to-date. The hotel is elegant and has an attractive decor. The service we got was excellent. In fact, when we arrived from Canada at about 8 am. We asked if it was possible to get our room. The front desk told us to come back at around 10 am and the room was ready. This was a godsend for us. We were able to take a 3 hour nap and reset our body clocks. Then we got up and caught the london sightseeing bus which stops right outside the hotel. The hotel is within easy walking distance of at least 4 tube stops on different lines. It is right beside Regent's Park which is beautiful. Yet it is one block away from the main thoroughfare so it is quite quiet. We definitely recommend this hotel and we will stay here again the next time we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Whitehouse London”
Reviews.Author: Desertsaffron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for our wedding anniversary, pleased we did.It is a lovely hotel, central with great transport connection. I'm not too sure what the reviewer who said it wasn't was thinking, all I can assume if they don't know London. Staff were friendly, Didat (I think that was his name, a young man) in reception was very helpful and after our room wasn't available the second time we enquired (4 hours between), he upgraded us. We can't comment on the food as ate out. The only reason I haven't given it 5 out of 5 is due to leaving at 10.30 in the morning and when returning at 4.20pm the room had still not been cleaned/refreshed and then 5 ladies turned up to do it ten minutes later and we just wanted to chill, have a shower before going out in the evening. I don't know when it was cleaned the following day as we did not return until late evening. would recommend the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - one major problem and several minors”
Reviews.Author: DavidJBLevine
Reviews.Content: The Meila White House hotel is a well-positioned and well-appointed hotel in Central London. The nearest tube station is Great Portland St which is 2 minutes away. A lot of love and attention has gone on the entire guest experience - from the way the staff interact with you and to the appointment of the furnishings and the room. However, there is a one major issue that would prevent me from staying there again and several minor ones which are merely annoyances. The major issue is the internet. I have no problem paying for the internet but the performance was absolutely shocking. For a business user who travels extensively a high-speed internet connection is an absolute must. The fact that they don't have WiFi in the rooms ensured I had to go to the Apple store to buy a USB-network adapter for my MacBook Air but that was nothing in comparison to the poor speed. The minor annoyances are in the way of the ergonomics. The big heavy workdesk is positioned in such a way as you have to push the table to be able to plug your laptop in - and it's heavy! In addition the iron and ironing board in the room is a great touch but positioning the bed and other furniture in the room as to make it almost impossible to iron a shirt is a minus. In summary - a hotel I would love to stay in again but unless they get the internet sorted I'm afraid I won't be returning. A big shame.

Reviews.Title: “Good central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kseager
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel which has a wonderful relaxing Bar/lounge. The rooms are confortable and well appointed although a little small, which is normal for London. The hotel is conveniently located for Great Portland Street Tube line and is not far from Oxford Street, Victoria (for the Appollo) and most major innercity attractions. The rooms are quite expensive however on arrival if you sign up for their free loyalty card you get breakfast half price and a free night on your birthday. The breakfast was great with loads of choice for everyone. The food in the bar was good too and because this hotel is a Spanish hotel all the main food dishes are on a spanish theme. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to spend the night in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good public areas but little sleep”
Reviews.Author: JobiFA
Reviews.Content: Good location for this hotel which had good public areas. Busy and cosmopolitan but the bathroom was tiny, the tv picture quality was poor, the heating was very effective but very, very noisy. Luckily at 2am when I was woken for at least an hour by the sound of the chap next door snoring then I finally realised I could switch on the very noisy heating to drown him out. I also spent a bit of time mooching about in the dark when my lights fused. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, expensive & NOT customer focussed”
Reviews.Author: gribblewok
Reviews.Content: OK, here are the good bits: the hotel has a good location off Great Portland St, it is spotlessly clean and comfortable and has an excellent, if expensive, Spanish restaurant. The not so good bits: the room sizes are too small for the price you pay, car parking is hopeless, breakfast is average. The bad bits: you queue forever to check in and out, the staff seem to fail to grasp that the interests of guests should supersede the shortcomings of the hotel's bureaucracy. I stayed there for 1 night and witnessed 2 positively heated arguments between guests and staff about matters which could have been easily resolved with a little flexibility. I queued for 10 minutes at "The Levels" checkout for an internet access code, I asked a passing staff member if she would mind opening the drawer next to the receptionist to get a a pre-printed slip of paper with an access code on it as I had been queuing for 10 minutes and there were still 3 people in front of me. The answer? "No, you have to wait". Thanks for nothing, it would have taken her less than 10 seconds to do this. The reason this hotel gets 3 stars instead of 2 is because of the quality of the "L'Albufera" Restaurant. It's very good, but very expensive. Get your staff to focus on the needs of their guests more than the "computer says no" attitude of the hotel's bureaucracy and you'll stop snatching defeat from the jaws of victory.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: SC1214
Reviews.Content: Myself and four colleagues stayed on a Saturday evening. Arriving from out of London we were really pleased with the close proximity to Euston station and Regent's Park just round the corner. Rate was Â£115 per room booked directly via their website. Rooms were nice and clean, comfy beds, as per other reviews not huge but fine for what we needed. Had the buffet in the Place which was fantastic, and used the free Â£15 voucher per person that came with our online booking. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: PottsPotts
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times for business and pleasure. The rooms are well appointed and somewhat "different", but I like that. Some of the rooms are quite small, but one tends to expect that in central London. The staff are always extremely helpful and courteous and the breakfast is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Regents Park hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrmarklar
Reviews.Content: Melia White is on the south-east corner of Regents Park, close to the Regents Park underground. I stayed in a "classic" room and classic means that there is room for a queen size bed and not so much more. The breakfast has all the standard stuff including the guy making pancakes and omelettes. ItÂ´s a busy place, grab a coffe&toast and away. If you follow Marylebone High Str, there are plenty of breakfast places that offer more for less than the 15Â£ you pay at the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Pink136
Reviews.Content: Hotel was shocking. !! Didn't relies it was extra Â£25 each for breakfast . Then I was charged twice for my stay which I feel is a lot of money as could of had a decent hotel for what I have paid out . Very hard to understand what they are charging you for cause I didn't understand there accent's. Never ever again now I have to wait up to 2 weeks for my money back that was taken out twice so I would not stay there not joking either !!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, stylish Spanish owned hotel, with friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: SophieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Melia when I booked a "top secret" hotel deal via Lastminute.com and I was extremely pleased with what I got, as you don't get to know your hotel name until it's all paid for and confirmed. As Melia is a Spanish owned hotel group, most of the staff here are Spanish and were all very friendly and helpful during my stay. The only downside was arriving in the lobby to see a couple of rather long queues of people waiting to check in and out, but they speeded up the process and I was seen to quickly. The lobby decor is lovely, very stylish and trendy. I stayed during Halloween weekend and they had balloons with Halloween theme and pumpkins lit up on the tables in the bar and it looked really good. My room was actually upgraded to a better room up from just a standard room, which was a relief, because I've heard that the standard rooms here are very small. My room had a comfortable double bed, large working desk area, but a tiny bathroom, which was the only downside. Housekeeping staff provide almost every needed item for free of extra charge. Toothbrushes, razors, sewing kits, cotton wool make-up removing pads, etc. Tea and coffee is free in the rooms. I also got a small fridge for my food, because you can't put your own items in the mini bar. The hotel is located just across the road from Great Portland Street tube station and close to a lot of bus stops, plus Warren Street and Euston are easy walking distance away. There are various cafes nearby, Starbucks, Pret A Manger and a sushi and noodles place, but be aware that these cater for all the office workers in Regent's Place and are closed during weekends. It's best to go across to Great Portland Street station and there is a Tesco Direct a 24 hour supermarket/convenience store and a few cafes there that are open at weekends. The bar at the Melia services really good cocktails and is open until very late (I think they told me until 1.30am). It was very busy on a Friday night. I didn't have breakfast or eat in the restaurant, so no idea what the food is like. I would definitely stay here again, got a great deal and would recommend it. 24 hour No. 27 bus from Camden town stops across the road, too, which was ideal for me as I had to be at an event in Camden until late.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: snurton123
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Melia on a Saturday night in November and were impressed with the fantastic location of the hotel, minutes walk from Regents Park, and the price (Â£115 a night). The lobby is big and impressive, lots of marble and filled with fresh lilies so the scent was lovely. The rooms were well appointed and a decent size with good amenities. The bar area was nice and a good place for a pre-dinner drink. They had live guitar music so the atmosphere was nice. We ate at their restaurant, The Place, the Mediterranean buffet, where we had a Â£15 voucher for booking online so this only cost us Â£9 a head. The food was fantastic and much better than expected, a 4 course buffet consisting of canapes, cheese, cold meats, salads, lamb, fish, vegetables, rice as well as an extensive array of desserts. Very very impressed! Would stay here again when in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent complimentary breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: florapeter
Reviews.Content: Our party of 8 stayed at the Melia White House in Oct of this year for four nights while we waited for our transatlantic cruise to commence from Southhampton. It was the first time in London for most of our group and we sure appreciated the central location of this hotel. It's within walking distance of many historical sites but is also only a block away from the Tube. You can go anywhere in central London in minutes by travelling on the Tube. The hotel had a complimentary buffet-style breakfast which was excellent and had everything you would want for your morning meal. We all ate a hearty breakfast each day and lasted until supper for our next meal. As well, the Hotel had a free 1/ 2 hour of internet service each day which isn't advertised but also came in handy. When we head back to London in the future we'll certainly be staying at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst”
Reviews.Author: alimarie1502
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Melia White House with my husband - we had intended to stay 6 but checked out early as it was one of the most awful hotels we have ever stayed at. The lobby looks lovely but don't be fooled - the rooms were small and cramped, and poorly designed for such a tiny space. Our bathroom smelled horrific - mould and mildew. In fact, the whole hotel smelled stale. Comments about it being in need of a refurb were incorrect. Lots of noise from the hallways and room next door. Honestly, we tried to stay out all day in order to avoid going back. I will give credit where credit is due to friendly staff. But although our rate was cheap, it was really awful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: mobile_mackem
Reviews.Content: We had previous used this Hotel some years ago,if I recall there was some exam stress at home and a couple of days away were the prefect antidote. As we are infrequent visitors to London, it was a simple decision to select a hotel we had used previously. Located a couple of minutes walk from Euston Road and Great Portland Street tube station, it a reasonable choice to access London's transport network. We spent two night here in a level room, there was a lounge for "level" guests where breakfast, refreshments and early evening drinks could be taken. All of which were included in the room rate. I do concur with others reviewers, there was an element of crocodile service, it was a tad snappy mostly during breakfast. Otherwise we never really experienced any issues. The lift system did take some getting used to, the look of bemusement on some customer's faces did bring a wrye smile, I did get frustrated myself! The room was comfortable and well appointed with a King sized bed, I can't get exicted about hotel rooms, as the room was on a higher floor, there was a decent view of the London skyline. We did use the restaurant during our stay,I'll review seperately, there was also a bar with a pianist which offered a table drinks service and a service charge. I really get the hump when drinks cost the earth and they have the nerve to charge for service, rant over. I could vote with my feet. We enjoyed a pleasant stay, with only minor niggles and as we have stayed here a couple of times,albeit some years apart. The White House is a comfortable choice.

Reviews.Title: “It's the inside the counts”
Reviews.Author: Jason K
Reviews.Content: We were given a superior double room which had a very nice decor. From the exterior of the hotel you would not believe it could be so nice inside. The staff were very friendly and dealt with our requests quickly and smoothly. On a lighter note, they state the rooms are sound proof which is true from 'room to room' but you may hear noises of the night as you walk through the corridors!

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in London and going back to it it's a safe bet for a successful 4 days city break. Very friendly staff and clean rooms,although they're starting to look pretty tired. We usually stay in their superior rooms but this time had to settle for a deluxe one. Still a very good room but a bit cramped. You will get a king size bed anyway,that's what most important for me. One negative note : there is no WIFI in the room,not even for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Dated ultra- small rooms with terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: CaesarSpain
Reviews.Content: DonÂ´t go this hotel: nice entrance and marbles but the rooms are tiny with a tasteless decoration and very uncomortable cheap beds

Reviews.Title: “Shopping weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: Josef V
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and good location (near tube station and walking distance to shopping streets). Good service. Barmusik much too loud for any conversation. The room on the 8th floor was not so big and there were two seats and a small table which made it almost impossible to move around. In the bathroom the toilet had no light. Overall the people working there made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel room, excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Trish083
Reviews.Content: This is ok for a one night stay, but would not reccomend for longer periods in a classic room, especially if you have lots of luggage and or babies/children. The spacious lobby and hallways are misleading as the rooms themselves are rather small and cramped. This is more 3* than 4*. We bought it as a secret hotel, so were relieved that we did not pay the full price for the rooms.The curtains in our room did not go across the windows, so the light was a problem. The bathroom was dusty and there were coffee marks on the wall next to the bed. The rooms need a bit of tlc and a more thorough rather than superficial clean. That said, the room was very quiet considering it was London and we had an wonderful meal in the restaurant, L'Albufeira; top notch food, excellent service and fantastic Iranian (singing in Spanish) guitarist. Location was also good, very near Great Portland St/Regents Park metros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Good location, But ???”
Reviews.Author: Diskdr
Reviews.Content: This was our third and final stay at the Melia White house, and was prompted by an offer of a free upgrade when a manager red my last review. Room 799 a junior suite, has a comfortable bed, and is a nice room, but with a bit of thought could be stunning. Itâ€™s the small things that add up. The bath room bath is half size, no light on the shower and the single sink cluttered. The sitting room, would seat 6 easily, so why not reduce it and upgrade the bathroom. The walk in closet is long, yet the rails are on the shortest wall. The safe is small â€“ and will not take a laptop, and the tea tray is found here and every day makes its way back. There is no power point so each day you walk it back to the table. The lighting switches and dÃ©cor (and most of the staff) are Spanish. The staff are attentive. The Level is not anything to write home about, the sofas and lay out are unwelcoming. Breakfast in the level is less of a crush, but there is a single toaster and if you get behind the lady doing 18 pieces, eat bread. The food is good, but the service is overly brisk, for instance trying to remove the plates, before you have finished eating â€“ or when you go back for your toast. In ten minutes three staff all had designs on my plate, but my wife fended them off. The restaurant is FANTASTIC. I have not tried Spanish food before and had invited 4 friends to meet for evening meal. We all had different course, which were the best food I have eaten in a hotel. The wine was good value and excellent. Service was perfect. The only small down side was the live Spanish Guitarist, he sang and played beautifully, but was only 6 foot away, making conversation difficult. The bar area, the room is beautiful. So why our last time, London is a big place, and at the prices they charge, there is better and a change is as good as a rest. PS if the shower tray blocks, forget the hotel maintenance man who leaves a card (and fails to fix it) , clean out the trap and plunge the shower tray drain the slurping sound as th drain unblocks it satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Chinese fire drills but in Spanish!”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This a four star hotel located opposite Greater Portland Tube station near Euston Rd. The building is well laid out and maintained. The entrance is interesting with about 8 steps down to reception within the lobby - that coupled with the people smoking outside the front door, must drive the bell boys crazy. Upon arrival, I confirmed that my room, breakfast and taxes would be from a central account with extras on me. After checking in, our bags beat us to our room although admittedly we slowed by the anachronistic lift system in use. The room is compact but well laid out with quality fitting but an old small TV. I ordered room service, which was efficient with a very good basic menu. I was told to leave the tray outside the room for pick up. Next morning - woken by housekeeping at 7.05am, wanting to do the room .... please come back ... 8am knock knock housekeeping! .... I left to go and get breakfast, tripped over the tray from the night before which had not been removed. I found the housekeeping staff on the floor and asked for the room to be done while I was at breakfast and for the tray to move. I was told tray was "not their responsibility". Went to breakfast - seated on a high traffic corner near the toaster, which is malfunctioning on the morning in question. Coffee takes 20 minutes to arrive and no one seems to be my server. Its buffet self serve so not too matter ... I set about getting what I need from a well appointed selection. As I am to leave, there is a long discussion about whether my breakfast is included in the rate or not. No one knows what is going on. I return to my room after a little over an hour - the tray is gone but the room is not made up. I head out for middle of day and early evening business. On return to hotel, I check that my bill will be split correctly at early check out the next day. 7am check out - given bill for total including room, breakfast and tax - told no record of payment from a central account. After calling around and 20 mins delay they find card to bill room to. The hotel is nice and well positioned. I will not stay again because it is basically disorganized. Its a pity because the staff are actually very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, but try to upgrade your room”
Reviews.Author: goosegirlBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in September with husband and friends. We all loved the hotel's public spaces, hotel staff very helpful and friendly, great bar service - with good evening entertainment and extras such as nibbles with your drink. Were asked if wanted to upgrade from standard to superior room on arrival, but decided we would be out most of the time and didn't bother. Soon regretted this, as the standard rooms we had were VERY small. They were clean, and well appointed but just too small - and the bath is only a half-bath which was disappointing for me as nothing better to ease the muscles after a long day sightseeing, than to take a soak in the tub. On a more serious note, I would highly recommend anyone with difficulties with mobility definitely upgrade, since you need to be quite mobile to get in and out of the shower/bath (I know my elderly father and mother would never have been able to manage it had they been with us). Other than this though, I loved this hotel...have stayed in lots of 3* and 4* hotels in London for business and can say this one is one of the best. Would recommend and will definitely be back (just not to a standard room!).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel a little bit out of the centre lot london”
Reviews.Author: jeans-r-us
Reviews.Content: this a large hotel and on the 3 times i have stayed here all has been ok the location is close to warren street and euston station a little bit out of the main hub of london the price of the rooms vary dramatically from one day to another

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Good location - Not so good service”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, expect good accommodations and amenities though some rooms have a lot of street noise. For business travelers, Internet is a bit pricey and wireless is not available. The breakfast buffet is worth including in the price it is extensive and has healthy offerings. The lounge is a pleasant place to meet and it is a bit dark. Do not expect good service. I arrived laround ten - no concierge. I left at 7.30am - no concierge. There was a misunderstanding with my bill and the charges my company was paying I was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “bEAUTIFULL”
Reviews.Author: mboliyams
Reviews.Content: eVERYTHING was perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the room was clean, the staff helpful and the thing i loved the most was the decoration. I would definetely go back n back n back. I Loved everything abt it.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: mebooandbeags
Reviews.Content: We have both stayed here many times on business and have had a consistently positive experience. Staying in the level gives you access to a nice quiet area with free tapas, drinks and wi fi. The rooms are always clean, well kept and we have often been upgraded to suites...which is a bonus. The food is great and it is definitely worth getting the breakfast. The hotel seems to be very popular with Spanish tourists and has a real Spanish feel through and through. The hotel bar is comfortable and often has a good live singer, a nice reliable stay in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Week end stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Aubaispully
Reviews.Content: Very well placed hotel, next from Euston Station. Nice rooms, nice staff. We enjoyed a lot our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A business travelers necessity”
Reviews.Author: intheairLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This tolerable hotel has very small rooms equipped with typical amenities. My room smelled of mildew when I checked in. On complaining to the front desk and receiving no follow up,I chased down a maid who replaced the shower curtain. The smell also came from the air conditioner and was improved after turning on the system. The tv cable was disconnected and once again the front desk promised a colleague would come, I ended up discovering and fixing it myself. This Orel also has one of the most unusual elevator systems I have ever encountered. You select the floor from a kiosk in the lobby and it directs you to car that has no controls in it. The breakfast room is also unusual, for 30 pounds you get an ok buffet but they also have made to order eggs and can deliver espresso. But they check you in at the door, leading to a wait line and confusion getting a table. Once I was given a table they then gave it to someone else while I was away at the buffet. All in all, it is an inefficiently run modest business hotel with small rooms. It is Ina good location and london is expensive so it may be acceptable for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “London Vacay”
Reviews.Author: babygryl72
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was awesome! I stayed here for 14 nights on Vacation and I started out in a Standard room which was small but good for one person. The staff was very nice and cordial and always willing to help, and doing it with a smile. I enjoyed my stay there very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed Long Time customer”
Reviews.Author: JetLagPete
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the White House for some 20 years even prior to being acquired by the Melia Group. So regularly each year I book in at the White house. This year I was extremely disappointed. You would think that they would make a special effort toward regular customers; however at the White House you now are simply a number.
