Despite having booked an executive floor room, the first room given for the night was small, old, tired, torn wall paper and broken fittings. They had no other rooms available. The next night they transferred us to another room which was still well below par. Iâ€™m disappointed, service is impersonal, the reception staff have a â€œcouldnâ€™t care lessâ€� attitude and quite frankly I will not be going back to the White House again.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Guest”
Reviews.Author: Eddybotil
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel on business and now return often on leisure trips with my partner when visiting London. It is one of the few hotels that I have stayed at in London that has shown consistency every time I visit. The rooms are always kept to a very high standard (for London) and the prices ensure that we get a quiet night as the other guests in the hotel show the same courteous respect as one would hope for. Breakfast is always a pleasure as the choices on offer should meet everyone's fancy. The staff throughout are wonderful and nothing is too much trouble nor is there any 'lip service' as can be experienced in the metropolis at other hotels. The best recommendadtion is that when colleagues take my advice and stay at this hotel they too come back with the same satisfaction of a worthwhile stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our annual weekend to London”
Reviews.Author: pippadog
Reviews.Content: We are one of 5 couples and booked 5 rooms for a long weekend. We wanted somewhere quite central, with breakfast, can park the car nearby and doesn't cost the earth. The Melia ticks all the boxes. We upgraded to a superior room side facing and it was great. The bed was really comfortable and the service for our group was exemplary. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice, an egg station and to top it all, the waitress brought over a bottle of cava so that we can celebrate our weekend. Great Hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms v small”
Reviews.Author: ljrNLincs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on an expenses-paid business trip. Art deco-type building outside with a greco-roman influence internally. Huge foyer with attractive looking bars off to one side. Friendly reception staff, hotel generally v well decorated. Room was comfortable, king sized good bed with excellent mattress, limited TV, usual tea and coffee facilities. Air con was effective and reasonably quiet, the window was openable although traffic noise on the 4th floor precluded leaving it open. Bathroom was v clean, well appointed, superb shower ( in terms of power and stable heat, not space). The standard room supplied was tight for space, if I stayed again I would consider an upgrade, tip - a colleague just asked for an upgrade and got it, so it's worth a pop.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: micheleRichardson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a family weekend away. Booked a suite for my son, his wife and 2 young children and a double for me and my husband. Rooms were clean, nicely furnished the beds very comfy, the suite was plenty big enough for my sons requirements. Hotel is near to Regents Park which is good for families. We booked executive rooms called The Level for this you get access to a private lounge, snacks and soft drinks during the day and beer and tapas in the evening. We definitely got value for money as my husband and son spent the early evening there with our youngest granddaughter whilst the rest of our group visited the theatre. Again during the day nipping in and out of the hotel the lounge was very a comfortable place to meet and the drinks and snacks very welcome. Our return train wasn't until late Sunday but although we'd left our room the private lounge was available until we left to go home

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Juan H
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel eventually for business trips and have been always happy with it. In fact, I have never had an issue in my stays with the exception of a minor one on my last stay. It appeared that there was a noise in the bathroom so I called Reception to let them know. In less than five minutes I had the problem fixed. But not only this, I received later on the apologies of the Manager on duty, Cristina Iniesta, for the inconvenience together with a basket of fruits in my room. This is to me what it makes the difference in hotel's quality and it is a quick response when a problem arises. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel in London - met our needs but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: BecPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the end of our holiday. We wanted somewhere clean, comfortable and not too expensive, and we got all of that. On the plus side, we had a king size bed and the room was relatively quiet. We paid for the upgrade at reception (30GBP for breakfast for 2 people plus room upgrade was worthwhile for us). However internet was wired (no wifi) and they wanted to charge 25 pounds for movies and internet on the TV - no thanks! Bathroom had some loose tiles and bath was quite strange, but for one night it was more than fine. Breakfast was a buffet with egg station, quite nice but can get very busy! The best thing about the hotel is that there are three underground stations within a short walk so perfect if you will be using public transport. Overall, the hotel is fine for short stays, but certainly not a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrissiePaulo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia White House in early October on a business trip. The foyer is modern and welcoming as were the reception staff. We upgraded to a superior room which was comfortable , spacious , well equipped with a very funky bathroom! It was much better than many five star bedrooms that we've used in London. Breakfast was plentiful with a great selection. There were lots of Spanish guests which created a really nice atmosphere and buzz in the hotel. Will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in need of an identity”
Reviews.Author: Ace_Coco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia White House for 4 nights on business. There were some pro's, but also a lot of con's, all in all, it seems like the hotel is in need of re-training. From the get go, reception was poorly managed - we stood in line for 20minutes behind 3 people registering - how is this possible? Especially when you have 3 people working the registration desk. As we were there as a team, we were booked via corporate travel, unfortunately, somewhere in the system some of us had "level" rooms, which granted access to the level lounge (Free wifi, breakfast, snacks, drinks in the evening), which costs at least +30L each night.. Some of us were in a standard room with breakfast and no internet and vice versa.. Trying to sort that out with reception we were told "reservations handles this". Which is absolutely silly. We had to ask for a manager. The elevators are odd - you have to go to a central console, press your desired floor number, then you are directed to one of four elevators. Is that really necessary for a 9 floor hotel? Regarding facilities, aesthetically, this isn't the most pleasing hotel - you enter the lobby to a lot of columns and a small set of stairs (6), which you drag your bags down, and limited seating space near registration (you can't need that many columns for structural support); the rooms are small (narrow doors), sadly the desk space didn't have a desk lamp (only an overhead desk lamp attached to the wall - making it very difficult (dim) to work on a laptop when you had to be connected via wired internet); the bathroom was small - not only was the tub unfit for an adult (only a small child could fit in it), the only light in the bathroom was above the sink, so when you showered, no light filtered in (wall separating the shower from the sink), and the water pressure was terrible! If you increased the temperature of the water, the pressure reduced, and regardless of where you set the temperature it would shift during use. The walls were terribly thin - one evening, the next door neighbor took calls from their bed, and I could hear every word! And why is the iron attached to the ironing board? at 190L/night, your clientele should be self-selected. Some of the staff were very nice and accommodating, and others less so. Unfortunately, much of our frustration occurred around our room rates, amenities for our rooms (internet, breakfast), all of which could be solved with process flow efficiency (no one should ever stand in line that long); empowerment of staff to address customer needs without management. The location of the Melia is very convenient. You're able to hop on a number of tube lines, Regent's Park is next door, walking distance to King's Cross/St Pancras, Soho etc. However, despite it's location, it's unlikely that I will ever stay or recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: DavidArendal_Norway
Reviews.Content: Good food - but a little more expensive than I liked.It was clean and well maintained both in public areas and in the rooms. Positive with air condition, so I could have the window closed, and it was quiet at night. Positive and smiling employees, and good help all the time. Good athmosphere in the lobby bar, nice live music, and quick and good service from the bartender (perhaps he saw I was thursty?). I have no problems recomending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave1408
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Tube right outside, handy for trains and some shops and bars around. Apart from that the hotel is nothing special typically for London relies on location. Room was dated, bathroom teeny and dated. Lobby nice and staff attentive. Nice gym. I was happy overall but room could have been nicer for Â£120 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Service, Lousy Room”
Reviews.Author: chikimo
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. It is well located - close to a tube station and to Regent Park, BUT our room was noisy, the A/C didn't work and the bathroom had broken floor tiles - not what we expected for the money we spent. Front desk staff were not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Jaysez
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and it was perfect. Two tube stops from Kings Cross and 100yds from Great Portland Street Station. We checked in slightly early however there was no problem and we had our room key within 5 minutes. Slight drawback is they try and sell you upgrades while you are checking in. Room good, on the mall side but that's what you should expect when booking a standard room in a central hotel. Everything was clean together with a nice bathroom. We didn't eat at the hotel deciding it would be nicer to get get breakfast from Pret next to the station and have it on Regents Park. We also noticed couple of nice restaurants along Great Portland Street as we were walking to Oxford Street (15 Mins) By the way we were lucky to have temps at 20 degrees and rising at 9am in October so Regents park was lovely. Together with a good deal from last minute we had a great stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “KRI”
Reviews.Author: Heikki T
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good location near Regents park and tube stations, clean rooms and delious breakfast. No smoking in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lainie32
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when in London at a conference The hotel is in a good location / underground is close by very good standard of hotel which is extremely comfortable food is very good with a wide range of choice staff were very helpful with directions around London and getting taxis, etc Watch for offers as it makes a stay more affordable !!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: OppidanCardiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. The foyer is being refurbished and one might say it looks like a palatial hall, open and bare with no atmosphere. My room was supposed to be a 'classic' twin/double. Whatever does classic mean? In this case it meant there was just 12" from the end of the bed to the wall, the TV must have been one of those invented by John Logie Baird, the bedside furniture had the once fashionable "distressed" look but the piece de resistance was the bathroom. The bath was about 3 feet deep but was tiny in all modern respects. There was barely just enough room to sit in it. If you are over 5' 7" tall, then getting in would be easy but sitting down might not be comfortable. It is not a good example of a comfortable bath in which you can relax after a day walking in london or after a long journey. But, the story does not end there - arising from the throne is not comfortable - there is less than 12 inches from your nose to the wall when you get up from the toilet! The wash hand basin is tiny and altogether, if there are 2 of you, with 2 suitcases, plus hand baggage, I wonder how you will get on in the main room. Then there is the soundproofing, I was able to hear the mighty roar of London's traffic and the conversation, admittedly a little loud, in the next room! My buffet breakfast in a small and very busy dining room was only warm and, at Â£23, is another expensive outlay. You can get it at half price if you take out a loyalty card, which I did. But, I was so appalled at the bathroom that I asked for the price of the breakfast to be taken off the bill. The manager had to be consulted but customer care here extends to saying 'No!' The hotel is run by a Spanish company and at Â£168 is just not worth the money. I wonder what room I would have been given if I was Spanish. We are reminded of their need to conserve water (like many other places) and they grow herbs on the roof top.............Oh, they also give money to charity. I would suggest to them that charity might begin at home and, for the not cheap price of Â£168, they improve the facilities in their 'Classic' room. It would appear the hotel is very busy, but what does that say about the hotel industry in London in particular? To me it says I will look to see if there are better hotels for that price for I will not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pete&GlorQld”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Service excellent, especially the concierge whose knowledge of sightseeing and local bus & train services, was most helpful. Enjoyed the very good entertainment every night in the lounge bar...guitar, harp, piano, solos etc. Lounge area top class. Good location near Regents Park & very handy to local shops, cafes & restaurants. Room a good standard but smaller than some we have used.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: WaterlilliesNY
Reviews.Content: From previous experiences traveling in Europe, I knew hotel room sizes are generally not palatial. No surprises here then if you book the standard Classic room with twin beds. The space is clean, but it felt dark and stuffy because of the furniture, decor and questionable air conditioning/heating unit (it seemed to have trouble maintaining a stable room temperature). The room and bathroom are narrow, so be warned. Front desk service was competent, as was the concierge and room service. I did not make use of the gym or hotel restaurant. The hotel's location is decent. Great Portland Street tube stop is across the street, and Regents Park is close by. All tourist attractions are easily reachable using public transport or walking (it took me about an hour to walk from the hotel to St. Paul's). There are much better hotels in London, but it was the best option I could find at under $200.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willgui
Reviews.Content: Was there during London fashion week and as there was no place in my usual hotels, I stayed at the Melia White House for a night. Location is great, right next to Regents Park and within walking distance of most of central london attractions. The entrance is really welcoming, with a large lobby and a luminous hall and the personal, at forst glance, seemed pleasant enough. The room, however, was old, dirty and tiny. The wooden furniture was so old that the top layer had started to warp, the bathroom windows were so unclean that you could not see out of them and finally there was hardly any space in the room to walk around the bed. As it was only for a night, I didnt complain, but whilst checking out, I guess out of courtesy, the Reception asked if I had a nice stay. When I replied 'no', giving the reasons, there was absolutely no reaction. The lady really didnt care at all and just gave me my bill and said goodbye. Scratch this hotel off my London list!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelbug060
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week and had bad experience with the staff. Upon checking in the staff entered our room four times while we were sleeping. When I asked what they needed they responded "Just checking" Checking for what? I asked, no response. When we checked out I was surprised with a $450 phone bill for local calls. I purchased a tesco international calling as I do every time I travel abroad (and NEVER have been charged more than 20 pence a minute) and was charged one pound and twenty five pence for each minute. I made some phone calls but the phone was knocked off the hook while we went out for dinner and I was also charged this ridiculous rate for that as well. I tried to explain what happened to the man working the check out counter and his manager and was treated poorly. I was thinking we could make a compromise and perhaps they would take off the minutes that phone was knocked off the hook. The night manager was ignorant and I paid the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Pyro100
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 week and the service was the worst I have ever experienced. Unhelpful staff unwilling to assist. The room was tiny compared with the price and was missing internal decor which left marks on wall. Plug socket to kettle came from wall and exposed wires tried to report and was just told I will report it no apologies. Woke up at 7 am to maid and maintenance man to start drilling was told I have to leave the room. Not very impressed I went downstairs for the overpriced breakfast. My advise stay away

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: HungerfordSharky
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is really classy. We got a great deal through Hotels.com and were a bit concerned about what it would be like, but were very pleasantly surprised. The bed is huge and yes the bathroom is quite small but as I don't plan on spending much time in there it really is NOT an issue. The room is a reasonable size and you won't be dissappointed. It is ideally located across the road from Great Portland Street tube station and right next to Regent's Park. Would recommend you take a stroll through the Gardens, there are a huge variety of beautiful Roses. Also ideally located for a visit to London Zoo as it is within walking distance (located in Regents Park). The bar is a little on the pricey side but no worse than any of the other top hotels in London! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia while in London and felt that this was a great choice! We got an excellent price by booking on Hotels.com and this was definitely a good value! The hotel is perfectly located near Regents Park and close to two Underground stations. It is also a quick walk to many great restaurants and Oxford Street for shopping! We enjoyed quite a few meals at The Albany, which is located just minutes from the hotel. They had great food and also a fun atmosphere! Our room was extremely small but very clean and nicely updated. All rooms in London are small, so we weren't excepting anything different. The staff and service at the hotel were great. Everyone was helpful and fun to deal with! We would definitely return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tonywdw93
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well situated 75 meters from the underground and bus services (the 88 to go to the west end and the 22 to go to Camden lock market). We upgraded from a standard room for Â£30 per night and it was worth it, large rooms with an enormous bed but as a previous previewer said a bit tricky getting into the shower/bath with the glass door touching your stomach as you open and close it. It must be a good standard hotel as when we stayed there the Swansea football team then the German side Bayer Leverkusen also stayed. A small tip , when we booked we did not take the breakfast as it was Â£23 pppn but when we got there they offered it for half price at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Shame the bathroom was so small”
Reviews.Author: Onion2
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a nice hotel and reasonably well situated for central London. The staff are helpful and very pleasant, although the service in the lounge one evening left much to be desired. The ambiance is good, especially the lounge for that late night coffee/drink. The real let down for this hotel is the bathroom size. Not only is it tiny, but because you have to squeeze through a tiny gap to get into the bathtub (and out of it), it is an accident waiting to happen; one foot on soapy bath and one on floor is you get the drift.

Reviews.Title: “A Spanish Experience In London”
Reviews.Author: NeilRafferty
Reviews.Content: Just had another night at the Melia White House in London and thought it was time to pass my experience onto potential future guests. Firstly, this is a quality hotel with most things being of a high standard. The restaurants and bar are of a high quality and the general feeling is of a Mediterranean hotel in the middle of London. However, there is a but! - The Rooms. The standard single rooms are like cupboards with the doubles not much bigger and if you are unlucky and get one without sound proofing then you could be in trouble. Melia do an upgrade scheme which costs about 30 GBP per night; very worth taking the option if you can afford it you get more luxury with space. They also have a business lounge which is not up to the standards of other London Hotels. All in all a good place to stay , location good etc but watch out for the rooms and maybe query before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: traveller201088
Reviews.Content: This was pretty much exactly what we expected it to be - a nice hotel convenient to public transport. There were no surprises and I would be happy enough to return if I could get a good rate like the one I had from hotels.com during one of their sales.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Naussannes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days at the Melia White House and we were very impressed by the quality of the hotel, the location and the friendliness of the staff. The room we had was very well equipped (including an iron and ironing board, tea and coffee, internet, etc ), spatious and quiet (it was a first floor room fronting the street). The bathroom is excellent with a good and ample range of complimentary toiletries. The buffet breakfast is very good and although quite expensive (GBP 23) there is a 50% reduction if you join the Melia "MAS" rewards programme (do it when you register) which makes it very good value (GBP 11.50). Great location - Regent's Park is almost "next door" and Oxford Circus a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katstar7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a business trip to London. Check in took maybe a little longer than usual, but I was informed I had been upgraded free of charge, so I wasn't too bothered about the wait! My room wasn't the biggest, but that wasn't a problem. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was excellent and complimentary toiletries, tea and coffee etc were more than adequate. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice. I loved the feel and character of the hotel. Location is great, close to Great Portland Street tube and within walking distance of St Pancras/Euston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but small bathtub”
Reviews.Author: extacy2508
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and without hassle. The room was clean and we both liked the decoration of the room. Beds were comfortable and temperature in the room was ok. Only gripe was that the bathtub was very small and only suitable for people who are petite. Hotel did not provide free wifi as with many other hotels in London. Location was pretty close to the subway but the subway was not on the main line hence if you're going to the main attractions you will have to change to a different line. It was about a 25 minutes walk from oxford street when we decided to take a stroll back to the hotel one winter evening. Booked this hotel through agoda.com and got a good rate hence we felt it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Find a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie F
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to stay in while I was attending my sister in laws wedding in London. When myself and my husband arrived we were informed that the double room that we had booked and paid for was not available so they had given us a queen size room. When we went to the room we discoverd a very small room with a single bed. When we went back to the receptionist to complain she explained that this was all that was available and when we asked to see the duty manager he said he had nothing else to offer us either. It wasn't until we escalated the matter to the general manager that the matter was resolved - one hour later. This also happened to the man standing beside us and another couple had had their room canceled on arrival which they said they hadn't done. Also, on another note if you book a double room and need a bath please be aware that the bath is tiny, you cannot sit down straight in it. The service was slow and the prices outragous so we didn't eat there. The location is quite good, but overall a very bad experience, I would NOT recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Spain in London”
Reviews.Author: jonathan9999
Reviews.Content: Had a suite for the family. Clean but smoking room hence there was a rather stale smell. Air con was poor. Restaurant too expensive. Staff nearly all Spanish. If you want to practice English look for something else. Snacks in club lounge worthwhile, especially after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: BornToRock
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for a work stay in London. The hotel is ideally situated a couple of minutes walk from Great Portland St tube station. It's a short walk into Central London and is not far from Euston, St Pancras and Kings Cross stations. Reception service was very slow and could be improved. Rooms are small at the entry price level - I stayed in room 131 - and as other reviews have noted, are noisy near the lifts. Breakfast had been included when booking but I was not on the list when I went and hadn't time to argue. Would recommend the traditional pubs that you'll find as you walk down the side streets off Great Portland - The Crown and Sceptre has good food and is a lot cheaper than hotel prices! Rooms are nicely presented although small at the entry price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for work trip and leisure”
Reviews.Author: lautal
Reviews.Content: I was on a work trip on Septemper, and shared a standard room with my colleague for 2 nights. Hotel was fancy and clean, and the staff welcoming and attentive. Breakfast was tasty with a large variety.

Reviews.Title: “An Excelent weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: Angaz
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed in a Suite at this hotel for our 10th Anniversary. I can honestly say that we have rated this hotel as exelent because every aspect of our stay was made special by the most fantastic and attentive staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them! The room was extremely clean and comfortable, but we did not imagine it would be otherwise as the hotel itself was very well looked after. On the first night of our stay we made a reservation at the L'Albufera. All I can say is "WOW". The food was out of this world and of michelin star quality! We made use of the Level lounge and were impressed by the free drinks and nibbles. We had cocktails at Longfords Bar and they have a great table service also. My Husband and I will most deffinitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very high service & very clean”
Reviews.Author: finnsdo
Reviews.Content: I stay here on business frequently, this week again for one night. Hotel is extraordinarly clean and staff are always bright , fresh and alert. breakfast buffet is very good. great value for London and no bad surprizes.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience. To be repeated soon!”
Reviews.Author: SimonettaRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: As our first visit to London, we were extremely lucky to find such a great hospitality at the Melia White House, starting with a cocktail at The Level and following with a daily caring from all staff. Concierge extremely prepared and perfect in giving us suggestions and directions; smiling and fast staff at The Level for both breakfast and snacks; professional staff at the Reception as well as for the room cleaning. My husband had also the opportunity to use the gym and was satisfied. The Hotel location is simply perfect. What to add? We're already planning our next visit to London - at the White House, of course :) Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyOldDBA
Reviews.Content: At last I've found a good medium priced hotel to stay when visiting shows and such. Booked through late rooms and was offered room upgrade and breakfast for an extra Â£40 when arriving at the hotel, I hadn't booked breakfast as it was an extra Â£23 each with laterooms. Excellent breakfast spread although the orange juice was a little warm. Great room, very comfitable nights sleep - so handy for the underground into town.

Reviews.Title: “'small but perfect'”
Reviews.Author: clangenorthwest
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nigths at this hotel in october 2010. We got this at a bargin price, we just wanted a nice hotel in a part of London that we knew. The Hotel itself is a fantastic art deco building and looks very smart from outside.The reception area isnt very welcoming its dark and dingy but the staff are lovely and very helpful they couldnt help us enough when we asked about bus stops etc. Our room was very very small but very smart and clean it was on the 3rd floor over looking a bus stop at the side of the hotel. it had twin beds with just enough room to move around and sliding mirror wardrobe the bathroom was green and black marble very luxurious.All in all we were very happy with the accomodation we did not eat any meals at this hotel not even breakfast as this was an extra Â£15 which we thought far too expensive. The hotel is within walking distance of euston station and right by portland street tube and also a bus stop just by portland st hospital that will take you to trafalgar sq from where you can walk to most of the sights you would want to see. We had a great stay and would reccommend but only if you get it at a good price like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Okay except policy keeps guests from checking in on time”
Reviews.Author: lee3nan
Reviews.Content: I liked almost everything about The White House until it came time to check in on our return to London. At 3 pm (check-in time) our room wasn't ready. "Come back in an hour". Waited an hour which is really awkward when you have things planned. Not ready. Will call housekeeping (again). Left me standing there another half-hour whilst making me feel as though I was the one creating a problem, not them. The issue is that they allow late check-out for loyalty customers; in turn this keeps confirmed guests from checking in. I was beside someone who'd be on a plane for 12 hours and was exhausted--and very upset. Staff were "apologetic" but did not go out of their way to accommodate any of us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my London Marathon”
Reviews.Author: SDH71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my London Marathon as the location was ideal, very spacious comfortable rooms & lots of friendly staff to cater for everything. Room service was prompt & delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Em H
Reviews.Content: As an executive assistant for my company's VP of Human Resources I have frequently booked the Melia White House Hotel for his business trips in London. Occasionally there were misshaps with missing credit card authorization forms or transactions, and not until recently have I been I truely unimpressed and displeased with the hotel's reservation department. Upon checking in on August 23rd, 2011 our VP gave the Front Desk his personal credit card for the room's deposit. When checking out the Front Desk charged our company card (mind you after losing the credit card authorization form twice) as planned. Just now we realized that despite charging our company credit card for the full cost- the VP's personal credit card STILL has the deposit held against it. And on top of that? The deposit was OVER charged by HUNDREDS of pounds. The Front Desk informed me this cannot be reversed until a week from now. This is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “modest luxury in good location”
Reviews.Author: davidpatricia21
Reviews.Content: Opposite Great Portland St. tube station ( and near to Warren St. ) the Melia White House is a consistently good hotel at a reasonable price. Part of a big Spanish group it is run very professionally but has a friendly style too. I am an MAS loyalty card customer and they gave my wife and I a free upgrade to a Superior room when we last stayed. The standard rooms are a bit on the small side but nicely decorated and good value if you book in advance taking advantage of the occasional special offers as we did.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time, great place to stay and visit London”
Reviews.Author: southozcop
Reviews.Content: The hotel was more than we expected for the price, it was well appointed, beautifully presented and the staff we more than helpful. The locations is fantastic for sightseeing in London, just a short walk to the Underground station. The pub to the rear of the hotel does the best roast beef dinner in London, highly recommend a visit, the price is good as is the beer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: fedupguest
Reviews.Content: Stay here quite reagularly when in London as it is very close to mainline stations. Very good location with friendly service (mainly Spanish staff), good bar, and well equipped rooms. Only problem is you need to upgrade your room - the standard room they will be pitch you into if you are a single traveller is tiny. Pay the small upgrade fee as it is worth it- particularly to a room on the Level where there is free Tapas, drinks breakfast etc

Reviews.Title: “convinient location is the key”
Reviews.Author: cherryluvjin
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard double room about 2days before the visit, later read the reviews on tripadvisor about how dirty/worn down this type of room is, so I rang up the morning I was supposed to check in, the reservation team was helpful and arranged to change my room to a superior king double, of course with additional charge. but I received the confirmation email in spanish! luckily some key points was close enough to english! upon arrival i was pleased with the convinient location of the hotel, i got off the train at Euston, a short bus/taxi drive will take upto 10 mins. The Concierge was helpful carrying my luggage downstairs for me, and the receptionist was very nice, smiling every single second i was there! she offered to upgrade me to The Level with 30 pounds/day, I have to say it definitely worth the money just for the quiet dinner area alone! for the 2 days i stayed there, i saw massive queues for breakfast in the regular dining area, the second day with about 40ppl waiting....also you get reception dedicated to The Level which allow you to speed up check-in and check-out, another tip from tripadvisor! of course the free snacks and drinks was good too, but if you have a busy schedule like mine, by the time i finished shopping and dinner it was 11 oclock and all that have finished. another thing i have to say is the service i received at The Level was amazing! one of the waitress at the lounge was such a sweatheart with excellent service and bright smile on her face all the time, i think she deserves a bonus for making customers happy all the time! forgave me not getting her name, but i remember she's from Maxico and speaks v good english and spanish. The superior double room is quite nice too, of course you can tell this is a relatively aged hotel with cracked corner/wall papers, but i had a massive king bed with clean sheets, bathroom was clean to standard, and enough space to put my luggage/shopping/clothes, couldn't complaint! the only thing i was concerned was the noise, my window was directly above the main entrance of the hotel, the traffic from main streets and the clubs across the street was too bad, luckily after reading the reviews here, i brought ear plugs with me! my other friends who stayed in standard room complaint their room was too small and too aged boundary to dirty, but it was quiet as the window faces the back of the building so summary it up, if you just want a good room to sleep in, go for a superior one possibilly need earplugs, but if you want good/speed up service and dont have to queue for breakfastm go for The Level upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, dingy noisy room”
Reviews.Author: GordonR_11
Reviews.Content: Good location and pleasant public areas were marred by a very small room, right by the lift/elevator shaft. This meant the lift/elevator was heard whenever it stopped on our floor. When asked for another room the manager was disinterested, saying the hotel was full. He made no offer of a discount or some other form of compensation. The bathroom was tiny and the shower required you to practically climb over the side of the bath. Decor in the room was outdated - not what would be expected of a fashion conscious Spanish chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4* city hotel, adequate for a short city trip”
Reviews.Author: KubaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very central location but in a very quiet area, close to the Regent Park, with a good metro and bus connection. The service was very friendly, fast check-in/check-out, nice and helpfull front desk staff. The rooms (standard class) are a little bit to small, in the bathroom the shower area has the very limited space. The room was clean and had everything we needed for short stay. The hotel offer the full breakfast buffet with great choice of fresh juices. The price was fair for London, so it's a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: AvivLeshem
Reviews.Content: Great room, great decor, great service. highly recommend using the business lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room & service”
Reviews.Author: panamacruiser
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in London and were satisfied with the Melia's accommodations. The hotel is a block from a good tube stop and only a few blocks from another tube stop--between the two of them, you have most of the central London lines covered. There's also a number of cute restaurants/cafes nearby, which is a plus. The hotel room was pretty small, but enough room for travelers on the go. We stayed here for a week and unfortunately booking through Hotels.com didn't give us the option to specify a double bed rather than a pair of twin beds. We ended up having to spend the first night in twin beds and then move the next day into another room. This was an inconvenience and should be remedied with booking agencies. Otherwise, all in all, I'd recommend the hotel for clean, comfortable, and convenient accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: stone2
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little worry but it really was very nice. Hotel must be totally sound proofed because we heard no noise. Room was nicely sized, bed comfy, and everything seemed to work. I cannot go to 5 stars because check in is very slow. We actually stayed twice with a ten day vacation and both times was slow. Also, the charge for thee internet is unconscionable but, then again, you do not have to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great service in a top location!”
Reviews.Author: maago070873
Reviews.Content: As a regular customer of Melia hotels in Europe, this was my first stay in the London subsidiary. And I must say that my stay was really extraordinary! The hotel is situated at about 150 m from the Great Portland Street underground station. A bus (205) stops right in front of the hotel, which brings you to Oxford Street in less than 15 minutes. St Pancras, King's Cross and Euston Stations are only a few tube stops away. I upgraded to a Level room, and I strongly recommend to do so! The room was spacious and very comfortable. The Level gives you access to a dedicated area where you can enjoy free beverages (tea, coffee, softs) all day long, free light snacks and tapas in the evening and free alcoholic beverages from 6.30 pm to 22 pm. Moreover, a delicious breakfast is included. If you are a member of the free Melia has loyalty program, you'll even get a discount on the upgrade. The hotel staff was very polite and friendly. The bar and the restaurant seemed great but I did not visit them personally. All by all, the Melia White House hotel in London is an exquisite address for couples enjoying a romantic weekend, families and business men alike.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: GTman19
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - friendly staff and clean, stylish decor. Great for a couples-y break. Well situated too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for clean and quiet stay in London.”
Reviews.Author: NCworkingMom
Reviews.Content: Two adults and two teens visiting for a week. The double room would have been too small for any two of us and we would have been disappointed. But we had an idea that was the case so also booked the junior suite which was well worth it! Only problem was soft mattress but very nice room. Breakfast at this hotel is fabulous and saved us $$ on other meals. Very nice staff all around. Had to tube to all sights but two convenient stations nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krystle0819
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my cousin for 5 nights in May for a vacation to London. The hotel was fairly close to all the sights. The Great Portland Street Tube Station was almost right across the street. This was really nice as we didn't have to walk very far. Warning - Great Portland Street station does not have elevators so when we arrived and left, we had to lug our luggage up and down the steps. Our room was nice - 2 double beds, tv, a press for slacks. They also had access to pay phones downstairs by the lobby where I could call home using my phone card. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: krautgrrl
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our European trip. The hotel is ugly and modern on the outside, but inside and rooms have an old world charm. The neighborhood is dodgy with street people, but the Great Portland Street tube was a block away, a pub was a block away, and a Tesco. They provided a very "mini" frig for our use, which was able to hold two cans of soda, or beer. Only 30 minutes free wifi per day, otherwise it is Â£16/day, so we used wifi at the local pub. The bathroom was wonderful, housekeeping did their job, excellent eider down duvet and a choice of synthetic or down pillows. Our only complaint was the majority of people from Eastern Bloc countries which predicated the breakfast. This means you had wonky cheeses and meats that most Americans don't eat, but otherwise the free daily breakfast was nicely done. (Head sausage, blood sausage and the like...) Staff was courteous and brought us ice every evening without complaint, and no service charge. Most of the time they didn't even want to be tipped! The hotel bar however, did not have any of the four tap beers working, and the Spanish man behind the counter didn't understand English or South American Spanish. Other than that a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location but within 15 minutes walk from Oxford Street”
Reviews.Author: tabitha67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as we were attending a family event at One Marylebone, which is located in front of the hotel. We managed to obtain a very good rate for the hotel, as at the time we booked the hotel would price match, and add a 10% discount. As a result we were very pleased with the hotel, for the price we paid. We were given a lovely large room with a super king bed, at the front of the hotel, with a view of One Marylebone. Bedding was of good quality, and bed was comfortable. Room was clean, and surprisingly quiet for a London Hotel. We found the shops on Oxford St within a 15 minute walk, and plenty of cafes, and restaurants within the area. We stayed on a room only basis, so I can't comment on the breakfast. However the Turkish Cafe by the underground entrance across the road does a good breakfast. I'd certainly stay again if in London, as it was a short walk from our train station, and nicely located for Regents Park and Oxford St.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: 1freqtraveler
Reviews.Content: Spanish owned and operated which gives it a different kind of feel. In a very good location, close to underground, walking distance to good restaurants, oxford street, regents park etc. Rooms can sometimes be surprisingly large. Great hotel bar to just sit and read, frequently a piano player. Great steak sandwich. Pretty good value for money and has always been very clean and hospitable. Have stayed there many times.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, comfortable but too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Zelf
Reviews.Content: I visited the Melia on various occasions and have also enjoyed my stays. Admittedly, I was always there on business trips and the location is just right for my needs but, if I am on personal trips, I find the value for the money you pay, just not worth it. There is a loyalty system that could make it slightly less painful I suppose but I don;t think I visit it enough to make that worth my while. A great disadvantage I find the breakfast - as such there is nothing wrong with it, but, it is often so busy, that you have to wait in the lobby for 20 minutes before you get a seat. I find that unacceptable - especially in view of the 25GBP extra you pay for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pokey rooms”
Reviews.Author: AusPete
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for business. The location is excellent and restaurant/bars do the job. However, the room are very small and the internet charges are a RIP OFF - go to the pub across the road for free wifi. I also got caught by the laundry charges. Beware that same day costs 50% extra. Breakfast was extremely expensive at GBP23 for a guest. Cleanliness ok - staff adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel & Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: ladiesel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the London part of our trip. Hotel is beautiful, the lobby, bar, restaurants and the rooms as well. Food at the restaurant/bar/room service was delicious! Check in does take a little bit of time, in fact, out of all the hotels we stayed at...the check in at this hotel was the longest. We requested a room far from the lifts, based on the reviews I've read on trip advisor. Our request was granted and we were put in a junior suite corner room. Room was pretty big and very well decorated. My father in law however, had a double & that room was very tiny. I suggest booking only their suites if you want a big room. The breakfast that came with the room was also very good and worth adding to your room package. They had a lot of selection and made to order omelets. Coffee wasn't great but it wasn't too bad either. The only thing that went wrong with our room is that the air con vent in our ceiling was leaking and maintenance had to come out twice to fix it. Other than that, everything else was pretty good at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better in the same area at this sort of price”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: The room was very large but the decor was dated and in my view tacky. The bathroom was absolutelu tiny given the size of the bedroom there is no room for two people at a time. A small single sink with no place to put toiletries, a bath/shower and a toilet all set around about a square meter of standing space. Never mind swinging the proverbial cat, make sure that you pack a small enough toothbrush! The food was also dissapointingly poor but predictably expensive. Despite its location this is very much a Spanish hotel with English as a second or third language for almost all employees and despite being well travelled it would be nice in London to have people who spoke the language well (I had to repeat everything several times to be understood). The check in and check out service was particularly terrible, with long lines and completely dissinterested and non-appologetic staff on both occasions. Long lines seem to be the norm and the managers standing around watching seem completely unconcerned despite several people making complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend theatre trip”
Reviews.Author: Hestar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a weekend break with my girlfriend as I thought it looked great, was in a good location and included a breakfast buffet, and I must say it easily surpassed my expectations! The reception lobby was beautifully decorated, and the reception staff was really helpful and even gave us a free room upgrade! The bedroom was also very nice and the bed very comfortable. Equally the bathroom was lovely. They could however invest in some nicer, flat-screen TVs as I do feel it brings down the value of the room a little bit. The hotel is right opposite Great Portland Street tube station and there is a nearby Tesco if you haven't got the money to spend on a plush dinner :) The breakfast buffet was amazing and everything I hope it was plus more. If I ever plan another weekend break in London I would definitely be back to book at this hotel (via Otel.com for an extra discount though).

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and great position”
Reviews.Author: michaelgould
Reviews.Content: spent a couple of nights here with my wife and friends.....got a great deal at Â£125/ night ......small but spotlessly clean room......hotel staff are friendly and excellent and its difficult to find a hotel in a better central London position. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not if I can help it”
Reviews.Author: dblesq
Reviews.Content: Melia White House is one of our corporate preferred hotels in London. I expected the room to be small, but not THAT small. When I walked into my room on the 4th floor, it smelled like cigarette smoke, which causes allergic like reactions for me. I immediately called the front desk, who assured me they would take care of it (they really shoudl have offered me another room). I left for dinner, and returned only to discover their way of "taking care of it" was to open a window. Since the windows had no screens, I wasn't comfortable sleeping with it open. When I closed the window, the smell was still there. The room had both American and European outlets. I'd left my converter at home, so was happy to use the American outlet, as I needed to do some work and my laptop battery had died. Neither of the 2 outlets worked, and I called downstairs for servicing. the service technician did come up, opened a box and said "it should be working, there's nothing wrong in the box." I demonstrated to him on both outlets that it wasn't working, and he kept reiterating that it should be. Not helpful, given that it wasn't. An electrician had to be sent the next day, which was no use to me, since I was only there for one night. On my way out, I was asked about my stay, and shared both of these. The front desk employee helping me said I should have reported both items. When I indicated I did, he was surprised that my room wasn't moved when I reported the cigarette smell. This was my first time to our UK offices, but I travel a lot. This was one of the worst business stays I've ever had, and, though I plan to be back in London in a couple months, I do not plan to stay at the Melia White House.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MalteseAdonis
Reviews.Content: A good, welcoming hotel with above-average staff who are friendly and attentive. The front desk and cenceierge staff were universally welcoming and friendly. The room was large with a huge bed and a nice view of London from the 7th floor. Food was, again, above average and room service was plentiful. The only downsides were the seating arrangements for singles at breakfast - the tables are virtually up against each other so, because I was travelling alone on business, I was virtually sharing breakfast tables with strangers. I was also allocated a smoking room which, as I don't smoke, was a bit smelly. If you want a laugh, try working out how the baffling lift works and also read the in-hotel magazine that is translated from the Spanish and has some interesting English! Overall, though, a really nice place to be for a couple days, superior to many of its competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location but not in the hot spot”
Reviews.Author: LarryTheVisitor
Reviews.Content: It was a good value to me being very close to central london's westend but not being held in a crazy street of Soho or else, so I try this area that I never been there before, close to Regents Park and close to some ot the best areas in the cities such as Bloomsbury, Marylebone or Fitzrovia just a 5 minutes walking. Also you can reach Westend, Soho, Covent Garde, Mayfair, Hyde Park, in 10 minutes bus trip, and the tube station is very glose in Great Porltand Street. The hotel is above the Melia quality standars, so I mean clean, safe, healthy, not noisy, and with good restaurants, and breakfast, so thats all I can ask and that is was I as given. I would do an observation for those travellers that want to be in a mor inner an hot location, this area is close to the hot spot was is not there, so I mean if you are a first time London traveller that want to be in the hot sport day and night and coming back your hotel walking from the theatre or soho pubs, or regents street shops this is a good area for coming back by bus up to 12 in the night but is not as close to get out of the bed and get down the center of life and night in West End. I mean is more residential and its main throughfare street is Euston Road that has nothing to see and is more a kind of business hub in norther central london. Another good thing you should know is a direct by connect the hotel with Victoria Station and the trip takes 30 minutes up to 1 hour in rush hour, but is cheap and easy. The location is also good to visit areas of northern inner London where do live the rich and famous, and enjoy dramatic views of London from the top of Parliament Hill Fields as well as you can stop at Camden in your way up there in C2 bus. Once in the hills you can try a walk around the Heath and try the exit in the Hamsptead Village side and enjoy a wonderful charming area of London where do live the rich and famous and nothing has to do with massive touristic areas in Central London but worth the visit. A negative about the hotel, I cant undestand how a hotel on this rates and on the days we are now, 2011, still has no free connection to the internet in your rooms, if even Sturbuck has it.....I cant stand how with a thing that now is a vital thing they try also to make additional business more than they do with the rates from the room......I would not go more to a hotel where has to pay for the internet separate from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Room / Dirty / No Refund”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerzzzz
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked two rooms at the Melia White House from July 13 to the 16th 2011. The rooms were extremely small and bathrooms had a foul odor. I asked the front desk to move my family on the day we arrived, but I was told that there were no other available rooms (even though I offered to pay more for an upgrade if necessary). We stayed there the night we arrived and the next night because we had no time to change hotels. But the 3rd night we did not stay there. The hotel refused to refund our money because the reservation was "non-refundable." Does non-refundable mean that the room can be dirty and the customer has no recourse? Does the customer lose all rights to what he is paying for because the cost is non-refundable? I asked Thomas the manager if this was fair and he blamed Expedia for not allowing him to refund the third night's cost. When I spoke to Expedia, I was told that the Hotel has control over the refund. I don't care who has control, I am the customer and I should not have to be inconvenienced like this on a vacation, and certainly should not have to work this hard to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Painfully slow checkin/out process.”
Reviews.Author: fullglass
Reviews.Content: Good location, average room; tiny bathroom and generally in need of updating fixtures and decoration. Checkin and out is tortuous; seems to be no system of queuing and the staff are in slowmotion.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you like a Spanish flavour”
Reviews.Author: rjmacf
Reviews.Content: Convenient location on Euston Road (virtually) and remarkably well insulated from the Euston Road traffic (side room). Melia Group hotel. Partially refurbished. Comfortable beds with reasonable rooms for London, i.e not great size for anywhere else. Very close to the main shops on Oxford street (0.5 mile straight down Great Portland Street across the road). Great for Regents Park so running or walking or trip to zoo is fine. Nice boating lake and just walking past the huge villas and trying to think which country the owners come from is a fun game. Not likely to be UK tax payers for sure. Gym is very small indeed and a bit prone to over heating. Breakfast is a bit over crowded on the 7-9am slot. Did not use the hotel to eat in as it is mostly Spanish flavour dishes. There are handy branches of EAT on Euston Road. I ate at the many restaurants within a stones throw in the Marylebone Road area. Avoid the bland Pizza Express as there are so many better alternatives. Just wander and see what you fancy. If stuck or tired try the gastro pub (Artichoke and Lettuce) behind which has a nice but occasionally rowdy (with loud office party types) dining room on first floor. Melia are a reliable chain and have taken over this palace in the last cou0pl of years. They are working on refurbishments progressively. This is a good example of their standard. Lots of Santander bank visitors and Spanish tourists accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - needs to something about the elevator system”
Reviews.Author: tmody
Reviews.Content: I was here with my husband who was on a business trip. As hotels go in London, this was a good hotel - decent size room, comfortable king size bed, good amenities. The bar was very nice, since we were there during the US Open weekend, we basically spent the evening on the couch across one of their TVs and watched Rory McLroy win with a commanding lead! The one thing that was extremely annoying about the hotel were its elevators. Its got a system where the elevator cars dont have floor number buttons in them. You have to enter the floor you want to go to when you call for the elevator and the system selects which car will take you there. I guess its meant to energy efficient etc, but was a pain getting a car to get you to the floor. On my departure date, I waited by the elevator for more than 15 mins for a car to take me downstairs, before I eventually gave up and took the stairs down with my luggage. Thankfully I was only on the 1st floor and didnt have to carry my suitcase down for more than a couple flight of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Rev58
Reviews.Content: Very smart hotel, bit of a queue to check in, but they had all the desks working. The room was fine, only staying one night but had everything in it you would need. Tea/Coffee most important. After a show we went back to hotel and listened to the music they had on, there was actually two bars paying music. Very relaxing. The bed was a little harder than mine, so didn't sleep so well, but we do have a soft bed at home. Breakfast was fine, again everything you need, staff very attentive, so all in all, really couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for London business trips”
Reviews.Author: Big_Al_65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of eight people and was impressed with the overall service. The conference facilities and assistance provided during our event were excellent. My room was a little small but was clean and quiet. The restaurant provided exclellent food. The location is good as there are plenty of restauranuts nearby, a tube station a few minutes walk away and Regents Park on the doorstep (good for running).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel bad plumbing”
Reviews.Author: johandl
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying in the hotel for 7 nights. The staff are professional, friendly and very good. The rooms are beautiful and spacious by London standards. The position of the hotel is excellent and overall it would be my preferred hotel in the future. The experience would have been bliss but for it's poor plumbing. My initial introduction to this was the lobby toilets (day 1 hot and very smelly, day 2 toilets blocked...). In my room (604) the drainage is so poor that I was standing in water from the previous day whilst showering, and the noise from the drains would wake me up from time to time. Shower door does not seal leaving water all over the floor. It's unfortunately something all older hotels battle with in London and bar keeping the lobby washrooms clean every day, there is not much they can do about it I think. I'm in London in one of the busiest times of the year so rooms are pricy (over $550 a night). However this is not the case for the greater part of the year. Something that did concern me at check-in was a double charge on my card that were both wrong. Mistakes happen, but the booking system they use should not have allowed two extra incorrectly charged transactions. Btw my bank alerted me to this problem whilst I was checking in. I believe this was reversed though I have not yet checked. Should you consider them? Absolutely, the staff alone make it worthwhile. Their service has been brilliant, room service always arrived on time, and the food is perfect for my palate!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: xGinax
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel inside and out!! The room was spacious with everything you could need inc a nice comfy bed! :) Good location for a visit to Madame Tussauds and a stroll around Regents park, with plenty more to do in the immediate area! (Restaurants, etc) The only (minor) problem we experienced was on arrival.. we struggled to find the hotel, as there wasnt a tube station nearby but other than that i cannot fault our stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Clover25
Reviews.Content: We've just experienced another enjoyable weekend at the White House. Asked for a quiet room when we checked and was given one well away from the lifts and lobby area. No noise from adjoining rooms either, which was a bonus. This time we got a standard room but it included one of Melias gi-normous beds. Air con was very efficient - it was 30 degrees outside. Breakfast not included but got lovely coffee and pastries at a cafe across the road at the tube station. Enjoyed the live entertainment in the bar at night. Good concierge service - looking after cases, flagging taxis etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: njr117
Reviews.Content: Hi, i organised a Theatre trip to London for a group of friends, very good friends, and needed a Hotel for a one night stay. I chose the Melia White House, and it turned out to be the right choice. I booked through a travel company (alpha rooms), so i rang up the hotel the previous day to the trip to check if all was ok, was good i rang as the travel company had booked all double rooms, when i wanted all twin, the Hotel reservation desk couldnt have been more helpful, they sorted this out there and then. My party arrived in the morning and where shown where to leave there bags and advised to book in now as this would save time when they returned at 3pm, good idea. After reading previous comments about the room sizes i was a tad apprehensive about what the rooms would be like, but my party said the rooms where very good,very clean and more than enough space, i must conclude that some people are probably just too fussy,or too large for these rooms. They all had a good nights sleep and where very impressed with the breakfast. I will be visting London very soon and after my friends comments i am looking forward to staying at the Meila White House. Well done, and thank you for making my friends stay a very enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “"We were angry, because the noise of the elevator 24 hours a day."”
Reviews.Author: christianeDrammen
Reviews.Content: Have a daughter studying 2 years in London. Our first visit. Our room was not suitable for use, as we were disturbed by noise from the elevators. This fact must have been known from before. After 4 days stay, we were informed in the afternoon that there was problems with the sewerage system in all rooms in that section. We had to remove the luggage to another room the last day of our stay. We are now returning to London, and are trying to be guests this july from 3rd to 7rd, as it was hard to believe this Melia hotel could be so poor. We are now giving the hotel the last chance to function better! We are also visiting London in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice acquaintance.”
Reviews.Author: GUMOslo
Reviews.Content: We highly enjoyed our stay at this London hotel. You are met by a very attentive and friendly front desk staff. Our room was well equipped and clean although a bit small, but that is commonly for most London hotels. Close to almost everything and surrounded by some nice restaurants: for English food in a more modern style: try the nearby Albany. Try the `stir of the day` at Villandrys and for breakfast try some of the fresh newcomers just around the corner. Our daily breakfasts at home are healthy but limited. Hotel breakfasts are sumptuous but nowadays rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, nice bar and good staff”
Reviews.Author: buttercupnottingham
Reviews.Content: The 'level' rooms are very comfortable, with decent bathrooms. Some traffic noise if you have a room with a view but I am not a light sleeper. Excellent 'intelligent' lift system which stops huge numbers of 'stops'. For a bar predominantly occupied by business guests, when I visited it had plenty of ambience, particularly helped by the live entertainment. The 'level' lounge with free drinks has no atmosphere (although nice tapas) but that's often the case with executive lounges. Very helpful reception and concierge staff. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst part of my trip...”
Reviews.Author: monkeygirl90068
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice when walking into the lobby of Melia White House is the horrible cologne smell that is pumped in. It smells like cheap, old-man cologne. Gave me a headache every time I walked thru the lobby. Disgusting. WIFI is not available in the rooms. You have to pay 10 GBP for 2 hours if you want to sit in the lobby and use their wifi. I was also told that I could go in the bar and it would be free if I continued to purchase drinks. It's so loud in the bar with their cheesy lounge singer that it was impossible to make a phone call in there. The showers in the bathroom are poorly designed. There is absolutely no way of taking a shower without water getting all over the floor. We notified the front desk of the problem and all they did was bring us more towels. Since electrical appliances (other than shavers) aren't allowed to be plugged in the bathroom, I had to plug my curling iron into the outlet near the desk, but there's no mirror there. The only mirror was around the corner on the closet. Horrible design. The front desk personnel, concierge and housekeeping staff do not communicate. After my umbrella was stolen at a cafe, I called down to the front desk to see if the hotel had umbrellas available for guests. I was told that they would send housekeeping up with the umbrella. As I was heading out, I said I would pick the umbrella up from the front desk on my way down. When I got to the front desk, I was told the hotel didn't carry umbrellas. After explaining that I had just called down and was told they DID have umbrellas, I was told to talk to the Concierge. The Conciege also told me they don't have umbrellas and after again explaining that I had called down and told otherwise, I was told that housekeeping would bring an umbrella up to my room. Anyway, I had to wait 20 minutes to get an umbrella... so frustrating! I stayed at multiple hotels during my trip to London and all had impeccable guest services and a very high level of room quality. Melia, however, is not one of them. The room may be a decent rate for London, but not for the horrible experience I had. One of the worst hotel experiences I've had anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettRowe
Reviews.Content: The Melia White House has a nice feel as walk in. Very tasteful. Cool hi-tech lift system. The rooms were comfortable, and the staff fairly helpful. I loved the location, very close to the tube and quite a few restaurants and pubs. My main issue was we could hear everybody that walked by in the hallway, the floors creak and you can hear everything they are saying through the walls (from the hall). Overall a nice experience though.

Reviews.Title: “High standards at this price for London”
Reviews.Author: LUISF
Reviews.Content: Although the decor is really too "royal" for my taste, the rooms are really clean, with crispy white sheets, comfy beds and not too large but clean and well appointed bathrooms. As for room size, they are a bit bigger than usual in London, but small for Spanish standards. The staff is really helpful and friendly, breakfast is quite good, in quality and variety. The location is good enough, withing walking distance from may atractions, close to two underground stations and really convenient bus heading for Oxford Street, Green Park and Victoria stations stops in front of the hotel. It's a good option, specially if you get a 2x1 offer as I did with my Melia membership card.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VernonBirdman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year. This was our first trip to London. We had heard how small the rooms could be in Europe and we were pleasantly surprised. The room was about the size of a typical North American room. Service was excellent however the elevators were sometimes slow. We had booked including the buffet breakfasts and were were quite satisfied with it. The hotel is close to beautiful park, within walking distance to the zoo and near a subway station. We would often walk downtown and it would take rough 30 minutes to get to Pickadilly Square We will be returning to London next year and we plan on booking this hotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: cpfc1984
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times on business over the past few years and this hotel always offers a good standard. Rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast has a varied amount of options and is of the standard of most city center hotels wordwide. Fitness centre could be better for a hotel of this standard to be honest as its sparsly equipt. Staff are extreamly welcoming and the real Gem is the Bar area that is a real treat after a hard days work

Reviews.Title: “Equally nice Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: basicallybrian
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in June 2011. The hotel was very nice and so is the location. The common areas of the hotel are particular nice. The lifts are fitted with a system that reducing the waiting time. once you get to your room you should also be pleased. We stayed in a standard room which was bigger than most hotel I have stayed in London, and a very large bed. There was some nice touches, such as a TV speaker in the bathroom and generously stocked tea & coffee facilities. There were a few facilities that usually would be free that were charged extra, and quite expensive! This was a big drawback. Breakfast at Â£23 could hardly be worth it, there is plenty of nice cafes near by (I recommend Vallandry on Great Portland Street). Wifi was Â£8 for just two hours!! And to use the minibar for personal use was Â£15 per day. Dont rely on the concierge for local information. Like all of the staff in this hotel they were all Spanish. He was unable to recommend a bar that was showing a particular football match, and could only recommend one restaurant in the vicinity. The local area is a nice part of London. There are three Tube stops nearby giving access to a number different lines. There are a number of cafes with for breakfast and lunch. The Queen's Head and Artichoke is a nice gastropub less than a minute walk away. Finally the hotel is only 15 minutes walk from Oxford St.!

Reviews.Title: “nice and confortable”
Reviews.Author: ianst75
Reviews.Content: I highly recommended it for a very pleasent stay in London. Very confortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tvordlj
Reviews.Content: We got a pretty good rate for the Melia from the Air Canada hotel booking site or we probably wouldn't have chose this hotel judging from the website prices. It's a bit above our usual London accommodation budget. Our rate as prepaid (about 90 pounds i think), however, did not include breakfast. The location was very good with transportation handy and close to the train station. The lobby is gleaming with marble and quite large. There is a bar and a couple of restaurants and a fitness centre as well. There are a few steps into the lobby but the concierge has a luggage lift if you have problems with stairs. It's a very large hotel, too. We arrived too early for the room but they were more than happy to keep our bags for us. When we returned and checked in, it was late (past 11 p.m.) and were given an upgraded room which was nice. It was decorated in gold and red with a large king size bed, big desk, and large cabinet containing the television, tea tray and a mini bar which we didn't use. The bathroom is small but gleaming in black and chrome. The tub is a bit high to get into but the shower is lovely. They give you some very nice gels and shampoos and also a dental, sewing and shaving kits. The windows open and the room has air conditioning controls which are turned on by a switch by one side of the bed. The room power is triggered by the room swipe key card. The staff couldn't be nicer and more helpful. We had breakfast there one morning as the little cafe on Warren Street that we used on Saturday morning was closed on Sundays. Be aware that though it's a nice full breakfast buffet, it's very expensive at 23 pounds per person! That's probably not out of the ordinary for a good hotel in London but still a bit of a shock! We had one complaint, our room was next to one of the elevators so there was a rattling and clattering in the walls but it was mostly quiet at night and we got used to it so didn't bother changing. I doubt there's much they can do about that. We would have changed if it kept us awake but we were usually so worn out from being on the go every day that we didn't notice. Your mileage may vary. Overall, a very good hotel, good staff. We didn't eat in the restaurant other than the one breakfast and we didn't drink in the bar or use the health facility so can't speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Hotel However.....”
Reviews.Author: patrickselle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, we stayed here over the easter period on a europe trip. We enjoyed the room and the beds were confortable, however the resteraunt which severes breakfest gave myself and my partner dramas when checking out. We paid the half price breakfest for being a loyal member, however as we were first into the resteraunt, the lady took our cash as if preferred to pay cash instead of having the cost charged to the room. When we checked out the wanted to charge us breakfest that we allready paid. (Make sure you get a reciept if you pay cash!!) Otherwise you will have to argue the point at check out. We recomend if paying cash at buffet breakfest, get a tax invoice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, excellent value, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: DebbieW001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, bordering Regent Park. The rooms are a good size, the service excellent and the restaurant is very good quality. Upon check-in, we were given the option to upgrade our room which included a full buffet breakfast, for a reasonable fee. We did this and were pleased with our decision. The breakfast was a great value. Wireless internet is available for a fee in the reception area, but not in the rooms. This was the only inconvenience as we travel with tablets and androids, but not with laptops, wires, etc. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in, ( in London ). We will return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ordav
Reviews.Content: Melia White House is a lovely hotel excellent concierge service and check in very swift. Standard twin room was very compact but very clean, good wardrobe space, safe in room, nice bathroom products, tea/coffee facilities etc. DO NOT BUY A DRINK IN BAR. My mother and I waited 20 mins for bar service which cost Â£21 for 2 drinks. The restaurant looked lovely but there was only one diner at 8pm - no atmosphere and a very expensive menu so we found a fab italian restaurant Trattoria Montebianco down Cleveland St great hospitality, really authentic: italian host / waiter, italian chef, italian food 10/10. Get a cooked breakfast at cafe meze and dine al fresco behind Great Portland St tube station for Â£5 compared to hotel breakfast approx Â£15. Tube stations near hotel: Great Portland St tube - 2 mins from hotel, Regents Pk tube - 3mins away and Warren St tube 5 mins away. A day pass costs Â£6.60 and allows access to both tubes and buses all day. There is a bus stop and taxi rank right outside the hotel.
