Sightseeing - Covent Garden is a must for lunch with fabulous live music, Kensington Palace 'Enchanted Palace' tour was very disappointing was like walking through a ghost train, not worth it, the outside and gardens are very impressive and free! We went to Pygmalion at Garrick Theatre starring Rupert Everett, Kara Tointon and Diana Rigg sat on 4th row excellent view, very impressive theatre loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Super but look out for room 285”
Reviews.Author: ThomasPetersen
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. Nice surroundings and close to 3 underground stations. But take care not to get room 285, it is just next to the ventilation shaft. The hotel staff kindly helped us when we asked for a move to a more quiet room. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mybluejazz
Reviews.Content: Best location for the price! Staff very kind and professional Room was very clean... just a bit small as we were travelling with lot of luggage. I would strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “The worst value hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: howard_nash
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the White House by our company through Lastminute.com on the day of stay. The price was Â£360 per room breakfast not included. We arrived to two rooms that were so small you could only erect the ironing board by climbing over the bed. Given the price, I was horrfied. I was woken at 5,00 am by by next door neighbours chatting on the phone and to each other - it was so clear they may well have been in the same room the walls were that thin. When I tried to get into breakfast I queued for 10 minutes with people pushing into the line to gain access to the restaurant - eventually I gave in as I was not prepared to pay Â£23 for a cup of tea and croissant which was all I could have managed in the time available. While trying to check out, low and behold the system wasn't working so we couldn't get a receipt. We stay in hotels on average 2 to 3 times a week. In all my many years of hotel dwelling, the price paid for this visit was the single biggest rip-off I have ever encountered!

Reviews.Title: “do not miss the chance to stay here”
Reviews.Author: TnNinSK
Reviews.Content: from arrival to departure a thoroughly excellent experience. we don't work for the company, but you might think so from this. we recently married in central london at another excellent hotel, but this experience was even better than that. it is the small attention to detail, the staff at every contact were interested in providing a good experience, and did so. it is sadly exceedingly rare to have such a positive experience, but you will here. take the upgrade and enjoy all that comes with the level. If you are a light sleeper and take a suite then ensure the adjoining rooms are inhabited by non nocturnal guests!! hardly the hotels fault, but the only blip on the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ella91
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times, in a level room and only once I've had to complain about the room but otherwise it's a good hotel. The reception staff do not speak good English and the service is bad at reception. The level desk reception service was ok, though. I enjoyed very much the breakfast and the evening tapas. The level lounge is also very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Elsaheti
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel, could never afford full price... Location is great for a leisure trip, 10 min walk to Oxford Street, 1-5 min walk to lots of bars and restaurants (walk down to Charlotte Street, lots of nice restaurants!), 1 min to tube station and Tesco. Rooms are nice, not very large, but what can you expect in central London?? Both room and bathroom was very clean. The bed was a bit hard, but good enough for us. My biggest concern about this hotel is the extra charges for breakfast, internet (wired!) etc... Avoid if you can, there's just a few meters to Tesco/bars, so buy your breakfast there... Melia is a Spanish hotel chain, so many of the guests and the personnel is Spanish. Great for the Spanish guests, but I found the receptionists a bit difficult to understand sometimes (their English was excellent, but with a strong accent). Service was lovely though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good location if travelling on tube, price a bit steep. Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JuzAGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my husband on 18th/19th April, checking out on the 20th. Upon checking in I was made to feel very welcome - had booked it all online and they had my details. The room was very clean - a bit on the small side - we had the classic double room on the 4th floor (room 428) - but suited us both fine. There was tea/coffee/hot chocolate in the room. They gave me two cards upon check in - one to get in and out of the room, and one to fit into an area on the wall to make the electricity work. There was an ac/heating which you could adjust to get the room as hot or cold as you wanted (took me a little bit to figure out that one even after asking one of the maids about it). The first night I didn't sleep very well although i'd only travelled from Manchester, I'm pretty sure it was the bed/pillows, the second night I asked for an extra pillow and slept okay. The concierge on the desk was very helpful (I think he was called Henry), he knew the area well so helped us out with where to go and how best to get there. I got Travel Cards for each of the 3 days I was in London (as opposed to oyster cards) which made travelling around very easy. The nearest tube station to the hotel was Great Portland Street - literally a 2 minute walk. Regent's Park tube station was about a 7 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly, they allowed me to store my bags after i'd checked out until that evening when I picked them up. My room was cleaned on the morning of my second day there and I was asked if I wanted the room cleaned on the 3rd morning, the maid was still cleaning when I got back to the room to check out about 2.30pm. As I was a member of the MAS scheme (the hotels loyalty programme) I was allowed a late check out - 2pm as opposed to 12pm. However, I'd gotten caught up in a 3.5 hour queue at Madame Tussauds, so I rang the hotel twice to let them know I would be a little late. Reception was quite friendly and asked what time I would make it for. I ended up checking out about 40 mins later (10 minutes after I had initially told them) but they were quite understanding about it. Overall, although I didn't experience the hotel restaurant or bar, and was out for the majority of the 3 days experiencing the London tourist spots, the hotel was beautiful and I enjoyed my stay there. I would stay there again if I was treating myself, but I do feel the price was a bit too steep - Â£354 for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've stayed in for a long time!”
Reviews.Author: JodieDevon
Reviews.Content: Checkin took 25 minutes despite the room being prepaid. This caused my mother much distress as she didn't understand what the hold up was. I was charged Â£45 extra to upgrade to a superior room but was still allocated a standard room where there was only one chair so one of us had to stand all the time we were in the room. The staff at breakfast were surley and unhelpful, the breakfast was poor, I asked for a pot of hot water and it came in a white china teapot covered in old tea stains, the salt and pepper pots were filthy and in general the hotel could do with a good clean. The staff are in desperate need of customer training. The whole experience was terrible from beginning to end. I felt as if I must hve been in a nihgtmare. Couldn't wait to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Reception area is deceiving - beware of shoe box rooms!”
Reviews.Author: dandylion77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on business. Was really impressed when I first arrived. Reception is plush and the service was friendly and prompt. This good start didn't last for long..... My room was on the 4th floor and had a small separate kitchen hidden behind a door. The entrance into the room was a pokey corridor with kitchen and shower room off it. I was hoping for better things as I opened yet another door into the bedroom. I had booked a classic double room so was expecting, unsurprisingly, to find a double bed in the room. No.... What I did find was a fold down bed that extended across the entire room meaning the only way to the desk and window was the clamber over the bed - which was just bigger than a standard single bed. What else went wrong.... No mini bar although they swiped my card for use with the mini bar, tv not working, shower nearly put me in an ambulance to A&E due to the extreme temperature changes! On check out, I mentioned that the room was not up to the standard I expected from a Â£120 a night room. Suddenly the staff appeared to have very bad English and failed to acknowlede my issues. Needless to say I will not be staying here again and suggest you stay away too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice big hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Vidar1
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies in a really good location, close to Regents Park and Great Portland Street Underground station. The hotel is not really cheap, but nice enough value for money. They want 25 pounds for breakfast! What a joke, buy your breakfast in one of the nearby shops and eat it in the beautiful Regents Park. Very friendly and polite staff, but all seemed to be from Spain? Some of them donÂ´t really speak very good english, but they manage... Why hotels still want you to pay for internet I really canÂ´t understand, that was disapointing with this hotel. Just go to the nice nearby pub "The Green Man" and get free wifi. Also they want 15 pounds if you put something into the minibar fridge, what a joke.. I had to drink warm bottle water the whole stay... The regular rooms are quite small, but not too small. Some noise from traffic when the window was open, and also some noise that I am not sure what was, maybe the elevators? But slept allright. All in all a nice clean hotel with great staff located REALLY good in London.

Reviews.Title: “second visit: still wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: scrutineer44
Reviews.Content: March 2011 was my second visit to this hotel. Was in London on business, this time I did not have "the level" access; just a standard room with breakfast included. The location is beyond compare, with easy walking distance to either the regent's park or great Portland street station. Oxford and Regent street are 15 minutes away by foot, and you can reach Piccadilly after a 25 minute walk. Not having access to "the level" means that I had to pay for internet access this time, and at a whopping 15 pounds per 24 hours for wired (in room only) access to boot. The breakfast buffet was nice no problem, i did have dinner at the Spanish restaurant in the hotel; the food was very good but it was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ashio
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the Melia as we spent two nights there over Paddy's weekend. We arrived around 11.30 am and the reception staff were great and got a room ready for us. The reception area and bar look impressive and staff are very helpful! Granted we stayed in a standard room and yes they are compact but not to the extent of some of the reviews- the bed was huge! The bathroom is the only issue we had-stepping over the bath (which is quite high) to get into the shower could be a potential health hazard, especially if your small!!! Location could not be better, two mins walk from Great Portland Street tube. Will be staying in the Melia for future trips to London and would without hesitation recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hobbiton”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_Matthew
Reviews.Content: The Melia White Hotel is a perfectly adequate hotel. However, quite where it manages to get its four stars is beyond the mental capacities of this author for he is not up to date with the latest rules and regulations governing such decisions. One can only surmise that it is down to the cleanliness of the rooms and, they are, to be sure, spotless. The service is excellent too, even if it does, on first instincts, speak Spanish. However, beyond these two factors, I cannot fathom how a hotel that, apparently, caters exclusively for dwarfs, imps, and other small peoples, can possibly deserve its fourth star. Let me elucidate. The bedroom was, according to the website, a double. Not a chance! At best it was a single that had eaten too much and was slightly overweight. Whilst I enjoyed the close contact with my girlfriend that this situation thrust upon me, I regularly woke during the night to find myself hanging off the bed or, worse still, taking up too much room. And the pillows! They must have been filled by a miserly fellow for they were about as bulky as a poor man's wallet. Needless to say, the support they provided was almost nonexistent. So, in addition to waking up without any room, I also woke up with a stiff neck. Onto the bathroom, for here, if nowhere else, is further proof that I was in the hobbit's quarters. The bath was three feet long. Granted, it was quite deep but three feet long? If the hotel is trying to recreate the good old days when one would take a bath in a tin tub, it's doing a fine job. The toilet, also , caused much confusion. There was no space to sit on it. Anybody over five feet (and I am 6,2) is required to place their knees up the wall just to sit down. This position places one's rear far deeper into the toilet than one might desire. On some occasions youâ€™d have the impression that you had accidentally sat down on a bidet. Thereâ€™s no wardrobe either, or any cupboards or draws of a decent size into which a person of average weight might want to place their clothes. All the cupboards and draws are tiny. The one closet in the room houses the safe, an ironing board (incidentally, the room had a trouser press â€“ oooh!), and the kettle. There is no plug in the closet to use said items; one has to transport them around the room. Finding space to use the ironing board is impossible. The hotelâ€™s great saving grace is its location. Itâ€™s right next to Great Portland Street tube station from where one can easily transport oneself to all the sights and sounds of the capital. It is also round the corner from Regentâ€™s Park, which is a great place to take a walk and find some much sought after fresh air, and to stretch the aching muscles you will have from a poor nightâ€™s sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Room 278 - Pokey Room Rock Hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Diskdr
Reviews.Content: Having booked a junior suite, you might expect it to be bright and airey - not so. The position of lights, the small bathroom, with the joke bath and shower on the wall - and the none slip mat - that slips (beware), send a statement that the room is a suite only because they have made the bathroom smaller to fit in a settee and table in what might have been a standard bedroom.. (shame) My wife's request for another room was met with 'being fully booked' The bed now rates as being the most uncomfortable, it has been my wife and I misfortune to not sleep in. We are seasoned travellers and even Spanish bed are no as bad as the one in room 278 At 3am my wife moved to the settee and chair, The mattress was rock hard - a good night sleep was impossible. The bed was king size, yet had the smallest pillows, even with the two from the cupboard. For the price, Â£214.99 via late rooms, try else where, or do not waste you money on the suite - In was our last visit to this hotel - next time we visit london, th Crown Plazza - will be getting our custom. Yes we informed the reception of the terrible night sleep - and we met with 'silence'.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, close to kings cross & easy access to Oxford st.”
Reviews.Author: Carolinexbx
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Staff friendly and helpful. Great location with 2 tube stations close by. Very easy to access other areas of London. Within 5 mins drive of kings cross station. Only downside was that we had a room with a door adjoining the next room, which had no soundproofing. Otherwise very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: talljen
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice. Room good size & worth upgrading to The Level. Would recommend this hotel if you wish to be close to shops (Oxford Street, Theatre, London Zoo & Camden Market all within easy walking distance) I have stayed here on 3 ocassions now & always been pleased.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service, noices at night, expensive, not worth the value”
Reviews.Author: cj19110101
Reviews.Content: company booked the trip for my stay and i arrived at night. by next morning i check with the front desk over the phone if my package includeds breakfast or not, the lady checked and confirmed with me the breakfast is included but she said the breakfast is over the the day. i went down the next day to have a breakfast and being asked to sign on the bill, so as the next couple of days till I asked them where i have to sign it everytime. with the comminication with front desk on the mis-informed, they did nothing, and blamed on my signing on the bills. they dont' trust you. with the 4 nights stay so far, 2 nights have big noises coming down from upstairs at midnight waking you up. minimum serives here and you dont expect much. if you have choice, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “expensive, noisy, couldn't get shower to work,”
Reviews.Author: notanothernortherner
Reviews.Content: asked for total cost per night on booking in and was told rates that were without 20% VAT so very surprised to be charged 20% extra on departure. had to wait 20 minutes to check in. couldn't make shower work (nor could one of the hotel staff from whom I asked help) this was fixed for the second day of a 2 day stay but the baths are so small that availability of a shower is important. complete lack of concern shown by staff about the disparity in the rates I had been told at booking in and the additional 20% charged. noisy room as next to a busy road, room varied between being too hot and too cold. Cleaning staff were courteous and greeted passing hotel customers which was nice, but I will try never to stay there again although it is a hotel that my company uses unfortunately

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: robclifford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel while away on Business and it provided everything that was needed, very good location, two minuets walk from the tube station, extremely clean and tidy inside, rooms very cozy and the hotel was right for what I needed. Yes I would stay there in the future if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, comfortable, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Richiev2009
Reviews.Content: Good location, next to regents park, 1 minute from Great portland street, very welcoming, warm friendly staff, comfortable rooms, clean, tidy, efficient housekeeping. I would recommend this hotel for your stay in London for both Leisure and Business.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs/Terrible”
Reviews.Author: majesticgiraffe09
Reviews.Content: I have had to stay at this hotel 6 times because my company puts me here. It has been terrible. The attitude of the staff is distant and confrontational and unhelpful. They apologize and give lip service but don't help you or care to help you. This is so different than staying at a Hyatt. The rooms are ultra noisy and this is because the windows are in terrible shape. They are single pane or some have double pane that are not properly sealed. The room to room noise is horrific.Also housekeeping when cleaning the room next to or in the hall makes so much noise that one cannot rest. This is at 7 30 am.(not their fault..just that the walls are paer thin. You can hear people sneeze or talking next to you.) Calls to management and duty manager give you lip service but they are not able to remedy the situation. The hotel is busy/ does not care and is just about getting the next room ready to disappoint the next guest. The curtains in the room don't fit/close properly and are in terrible shape. They don't keep out the light. The chair they give you does not allow you to sit at desk and place your legs under the desk. The air conditioning/heat is inconsistent. It is hot then cold and on and on. The thermostat is ineffective. Watch the front desk as they overcharge and you see so many guests arguing and discussing charges with them. In one short sentence this property is a nightmare and a problem oasis. I don't know why anybody would ever choose to stay here and pay. It attracts a lot of Spanish cleints who must think that just because it is a Melia property it must be good. That is the furthest thing from the truth at this location. Save yourself trouble and disappointment and skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Spanish charm with English class”
Reviews.Author: Rogas
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for the welcoming atmosphere, for the spaciousness and style of my room (superior type), for breakfast and for the relaxing and posh atmosphere of the â€œVIP Loungeâ€� (worth having if you can). And of course for the location. The main restaurant is expensive but up to the standard of other Michelin rated restaurants I went to in the neighborhood. On the minus side, the bathroom and the cupboard were atrociously small, in stark contrast with the size of the room. I did not have any problems with credit card charge as somebody else has complained about. I had prepaid, I did not want to put up a deposit and I was happy to have my fridge blocked and my television set on the free channels only.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad service”
Reviews.Author: Johnny690401
Reviews.Content: Dreadful - the staff working there are so rude, unfriendly, and unhelpful, especially the concierge manager. Totally ruined our holidays in London. Never ever stay there again or regret for life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jadie35
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend booked the hotel a couple of months ago online and were looking forward to the stay. We were not disappointed. The hotel is literally 2 minutes walk from Great Portland Street tube station and near main attractions like Madame Taussauds and Oxford St. The hotel was very elegent and clean and the receptation staff were very professional and nice. We were pleased on arrival to have been upgraded to a superior room for free which was something we didn't expect. The room was fairly large with a kingsize bed which a favorite of my boyfriend. However, the bathroom was very small although beautifully furnished. The room provided everything we needed for leisurely trip to London. Me and my boyfriend did not eat in the hotel so it would be unfair to judge these services but we found the maid service to be through. The only problem I found with the hotel was that the room did not seem to soundproofed as advertised and that a lift seemed to making a squeeking sound which we heard in our room which was at least 40ft from the lift. However this was infrequant and did not distrub us too much. We would definately go to this hotel again as it may be a little on the expenisve side but is worth it for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Just a base, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ladiesbridge
Reviews.Content: The location and its cleanliness are the best points of this hotel. Situated directly opposite Gt Portland Tube (2 mins walk) and 15 minute walk from Oxford Street this was a good base for a weekend stay as all the sights are within reasonable distance. The rooms are extremely small but exceptionally clean as too are the general areas. Breakfast was not included but there are plenty of cafe's near Gt Portland tube. We had a problem with traffic noise at night as the windows as not newly double glazed. Secondary glazing has been added due to the building being listed but that does not help the noise therefore we did not sleep well (ask to be put on the non-main road side of the hotel). The hotel isn't modern with traditional decor and dark wood interiors, and a longer stay in our room may have depressed us (we stayed 2 nights). This hotel is fit for purpose but nothing more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: YBNORMEL
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel and flight as a package. Was impressed with the hotel and the size of the room compared to our other European stay in Paris. My only complaints was the charges for the internet and local calls 15 pounds a day for internet seemed very high and charging 5 pounds for a local call was over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...........But”
Reviews.Author: ShaunDMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate, the only issues that I have are...... The site advertises two bars, but if you book a basic room you are not able to access the bar called the Level. If you are spanish or speak spanish then this hotel is the one for you, when they put you on hold you get information regarding the hotel "IN SPANISH" if you do not speak spanish like me....... I tried to book an extra night whilst in the hotel, around 7:30pm and was unable to because reservations where closed, however I did book the original room around 10:30 at night from Middlesbrough, surely you should be able to book a room when your actually in the hotel??? Also it is very expensive and they autmatically add gratuity to your bill. Â£9.40 for 2 cups of tea, they did provide shortcake biscuits which were soft an off. They ony serve spanish cuisine in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: DrDavidHampshire
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on previous reviews and the special rate offered. We had a Classic room and yes it was small but other than that there are no issues. As we only used it for sleeping in then the size was irrelevant. It is in a great location, convenient to the tube if you want, but we walked everywhere - 20 minute stroll to Oxford Street. Didn't use the restaurant - breakfast is expensive and besides there' a Pret a Manger 2 minutes walk away. Staff always polite, room 633 spotless including bathroom, dated tv but....... If you want a quality hotel at a reasonable rate for London Â£200 for 2 nights Fri & Sat then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but tiny rooms and mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: Pamanda
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to London with my boyfriend who had a business meeting at his London branch. We chose this hotel for our last night because his company uses this hotel when arranging client meetings, etc, and it is within a 5 minute walk to the office. Overall the hotel is very nice, the lobby is clean and elegant, and the staff at the front desk were very friendly, (the concierge on the other hand could have tried to be a little nicer considering it is his job to help lost or confused guests find there way around...minus the attitude!) The downside to this hotel was truly the size of the rooms. For about 180 pounds a night, (and that's on a corporate rate,) the room was miniscule. There was a kind sized bed which essentially took up the entire room, and a desk where you couldn't even fit your legs under in the chair they provided you. The bathroom was literally the smallest thing I had ever seen in my life. Your knees can touch the sink from the toilet, and you have to step up into a corner shower/tub which you are fearful you might fall in the process just to take a cramped shower. I know London hotels are small, and real estate is precious, etc - but I really think this was pushing it. It is a nice enough hotel, but the value for the price does NOT add up, (unless of course you have business purposes within walking distance since it is in a business area). I definitely would not recommend this hotel for leisure and if you are paying your own way. Oh also, a tip, if you order internet to the room (not sure if this is common in Europe or not) but you can only hook up ONE COMPUTER'S IP Address! I would have assumed if you pay for internet you paid for the room, but when I hooked up my laptop, my boyfriend couldn't log in to his own work computer to finalize some things for his meeting the following morning. Luckily, they offer free WiFi in the lobby, but I still think internet should be per room, not per guest!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, out of the many we have stayed in by far the best.”
Reviews.Author: Jen-Neefa
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Regents Park & Warren street station, hotel was clean and tidy and staff were friendly and smiled without being intrusive. I was really impressed with the room with a huge comfortable bed and the room was clean. Breakfast was fantastic and eat as much as you can ensured that I set off into London without the need for lunch. I stay in a London Hotel about twice a year and this was the best hotel I have stayed in so far.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same”
Reviews.Author: BristolGezzer
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we have stayed at this hotel many times,and if available always stay at Melia hotels around the world.Our visit was to celebrate my birthday and we had a free night on the hotel.We always upgrade to the Level service(you get what you pay for).However this time our room had a very damp musty smell,when we brought this to the Level receptions attention,they apologised and said they would have the room "refreshed",this consisted of somebody opening the window! I was also promised a bottle of wine which never appeared(despite a reminder)On checking out I asked if the management had changed?and was told it had.Perhaps that explains why our favorite hotel in London has slipped this time

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. But.......expensive!”
Reviews.Author: MariannaBoz
Reviews.Content: The service was reaaly good and the people were polite and helpfull. All the reviews I have read in Trip Advisor were saying that the rooms was really small, and I was afraid of that, but the room was ok. Not a comfort room that you have lods of free space, but not so small that you can not walk and things like that. The location is ok because the hotel is exactly next to 3 train stations. So you can go everywhere with the underground. I t is center and you can walk to Regent street and Oxford easily.. I really liked the smell of the fresh flowers in the lobby, the clean and quiet rooms and the bar of the hotel that was open untill late. In London all the pubs serves untill 23:00... It was nicwe that you can return at the hotel and have a place to sit and drink a beer.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is tired & needs an urgent re vamp”
Reviews.Author: DaytripperExeter
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here two years ago, but in an up graded room, we chose a standard room & were very dissapointed. We booked two rooms as my sister was travelling with me. We were stayed for two nights. We had two adjacent rooms but in one the air con was SO noisy you couldnt hear yourself think. A call was made & a man dispatched but he never arrived. 1 1/2 hrs later after another call to reception he arrived, turned the fan down & siad not to touch! I said I could smell a burning smell which he denied. The room also smelt damp. Complained to reception & they moved us to another floor. The air con was fine but the rooms are so small & very tired just like the ones we had left. Ripped curtains, the headboard in one room wasnt fixed to the wall..the raw plugs were visible. The bathrooms tiny & grubby. In fact it all felt grubby, walls, carpet, tables. The wardrobe door was off its guide & if you try to hang something on the hangers it rests on the tea tray! A great differenc from what you see in front of house as reception is beautiful. On a positive note the staff are very good, breakfast good with plenty of choice but the bar prices are way over the top, even for central london. Come on Melia, you can do much better than this. I wont return again as I feel that I have been taken for a ride here. What you see on the web site isnt what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Wakeywarrior
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights whilst attending a trial at Central London County Court which (for solicitors reading this) is just across the road. So for CLCC it is ideally placed and the closest hotel. In fact the location generally is 5 star- top of Great Portland Street, 10 mins walk from Oxford Street and adjacent to Regent's park. I also have to say that the staff I encountered were top notch. Special thanks to the excellent commissionaire who spent ages trying to get a fax for me, and the manager who sorted movement of my room (more below). Now the not so good. First, the rooms are generally very small- yes, expected in London but this was small. They also looked a little tired, and I have seen cleaner rooms. Next, the first night I was in a room adjacent to the lift and got virtually zero sleep, due to the cables pulling the lifts sort of hitting the other side of the wall behind my head. I complained the next day, and the manager kindly arranged for my things to be shifted across to another room. As I say the staff I encountered were good. However, the first night in my new room was also not great. It was one of those with a connecting door to the next room for families. Unfortunately there was little sound insulation in this door, in fact you could hear everything next door. You can probably imagine it was an interesting night when an amorous couple with a penchant for what sounded like spanking started next door. I will say no more save to say that by the fourth 'session' at 4am it had gone from amusing to tiresome. Fortunately the following night there was a nice Scottish lady in the adjacent room who was very quiet. I never met her, but heard her entire telephone conversation to her friend so I knew she was nice.... and Scottish. Bar prices were also very expensive. My client and I indulged in a 'few' G&Ts in the bar, but I was surprised to receive a Â£200 bill- it had been over Â£9 per G&T and then they had put service charge on. So in summary, I nearly gave this four stars, but the small rooms, 'noise' and prices just ruled it out. However, due to its convenience and general location, I would probably stop here again if at the local County Court. Oh and gym not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “All business...”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Rusty_Nails
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia as part of a business meeting nearby. The hotel staff on reception were welcoming, and explained the rather odd system of lifts that take you to your floor. The decor was pleasant, with the room being fine as an overnight stop, but not somewhere to spend a great deal of time. It was fairly small, but was well fitted with features and a comfy bed. The bathroom was nice, but small, and the bath itself was extremely small. Breakfast in the morning was an almost industrial experience, but I suppose this is only to be expected in a hotel with so many guests. The food was of a good standard, and there was plenty of it. Overall, the stay at this hotel was a pleasant experience, but fairly expensive for what was on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Englandmn
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with clean and nice rooms. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Functional accommodation in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: brgkamp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and again didn't make much use of the hotel's facilities. The room was dissapointingly small, similarly the bathroom. I was surprised by the price of the Internet connectivity, especially when the speed was so slow. The receptionists seemed genuinely friendy and efficient. No real complaints and reasonable value for money for London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: sydney_chick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights this week for work. Rooms are lovely and very clean - could not fault them. Breakfast is a massive buffet with everything you could want. No noise from the street despite being in central London near to Euston Road. Peaceful sleep on nice beds. Book here with confidence, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: torchello
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night - 31st December and felt the rate was very good. On arrival we left our luggage (a few hours before checking in time) and we were asked if we wanted to pay for an upgrade as only a twin bedded room would be available to us. We decided not to so were extremely pleased when ,on our return, we were upgraded anyway ! The room was spacious, clean and very well decorated with an enormous bed - LOVELY! We spent most of the evening in a fairly local 1950s bowling alley but decided to return to the hotel just before midnight . Thank goodness we did as we discovered that we could actually see the New Year fireworks out of the hotel bedroom window ! o.k. - through the building opposite but still - what a bonus! The breakfast was good but not exceptional.The service was always prompt and friendly. We also enjoyed walking in the area - including through Regents Park - and would stay again and certainly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sashamoyo
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am not one to wriite reviews but I felt I should write about this hotel. I was forced to look for a hotel due to flight cancellations. So I went online and booked my hotel based on price and 4-star rating. I have travelled extensively glabally and stay at minimum of 4 star hotels. I must say I liked the Melia White House because of it's decor, size not being too large and a constant feeling of being at home. The staff were very polite and went out of their way to make all our needs met. I would stay here again anytime. I would give this hotel a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KateG_AUS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on last minute.com as one of the Secret hotel deals which claim to be up to 50% off the hotel price. When we found out the hotel it was only Â£20 cheaper. When we checked in for 2pm a room wasn't ready, we came back at 3pm and a room still wasn't ready so after complaining we eventually got a room. We asked for a double room and instead we got 2 single beds pushed together, with separate duvets. The room was tiny and not that impressive. Overall, we thought this hotel was overpriced and would not stay again. Think there are plenty of nicer hotels and this hotel, although well located, is not worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star!!”
Reviews.Author: Zanna8
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and as a chef I cannot believe the very poor breakfast .The sausages were undercooked and the bacon overcooked and hard.We could not drink the orange juice as it tasted stale.They apparently try to charge Â£22.50 each for this max 99p breakfast.!It should be a waiter service breakfast in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: pixietess
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a room as a surprise and we both absolutely loved it! What an AMAZING bed! The service in the bar and reception was fab and although we didn't get to eat in the restaurant, the food looked lovely! It was really close to the tube and right next to Regents Park so I have no qualms about the location! We will definitely stay again - he proposed while we were in London and we will be coming back on our anniversary : )

Reviews.Title: “True Elegance at Regent's Park”
Reviews.Author: YFCtravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I am a Canadian travel agent and I stayed at the Melia White House in London, UK the night of November 12th, 2010. I was very impressed with this hotel and would not hesitate to book my clients there. I was first impressed by being met at the door by a doorman who helped me down the stairs with my luggage. (Although I was not impressed that there wasn't a ramp and please keep this in mind if you are physically challenged.) Check-in was very smooth. The lobby is grand looking as was the red and gold decor of the hallways on my floor. My room was beautifully appointed and very rich in decor - again red and gold decor with dark wood furniture, flat-screen TV, marble bathroom. The location is not what I could call "central" but with the underground you can get anywhere. Great Portland Street station is just a 2-minute walk from the hotel. The breakfast buffet, which was included in my rate, provided many choices. Everything was fresh and tasty and the service was great. Because I was only there for 1 night I did not get to take advantage of all of the ammenities offered. But I will definitely be going back and will be recommending this property to both my corporate and leisure clients.

Reviews.Title: “Do not honor offers, false advertising of hotel stays”
Reviews.Author: ladeeda1
Reviews.Content: We were sent a birthday voucher via email from the sol melia office and told to present it at check in for one free nite and free bottle of wine. On check in they took the voucher and stapled it to the reservation card. They then took it off the reservation card to give to food and beverage for the bottle of wine to be accounted for. They assured us it would be placed back in our res.file. On check out they said they could not find the voucher and would not honor the free nite offer. Then they told us WE made an incorrect reservation and had to pay the 3 nites instead of 2. Oh, and no one knew who checked us in and told us the voucher was good. I work in hotels..the check in clerk has an ID # that they need to access computer reservation..GM knows exactly who made what res and when. Total lie and rip off of customers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in February 2010 as we were due in London to watch a friend's band play their last gig; unfortunately the date of the show was the 13th so we knew we would have a hard time getting a good place to stay for a reasonable price. As we were arriving into London at Euston, any hotel within that vincinity would be ideal. Unfortunately due to the date of our stay co-inciding with Valentine weekend the Premier Inn, Novotel, Travelodge et al were all fully booked or wanting astronomical prices (for the standard of the room) to stay there. And, having stayed in some of the flea pits around King's Cross I thought I'd check out some other options and chanced upon the Melia on lastminute.com. The price was around Â£130, which I didn't mind too much paying (at the time of booking) as the so-called cheap hotels were around this price and the flea-pits asking for around Â£90, so I bit the bullet and booked it thinking that at least it is a four-star and will be a comfortable place to stay. I wasn't wrong per-se, but I had a very under-whelming feeling whilst staying there. The decor is definitely old-fashioned; it would suit American tourists down to a T and it reminded me a lot of the Hotel Grisham in Dublin. The bed was comfortable enough, but what surprised me was the lack of a mini-bar. Not that we would be daft enough to use it of course, but one would expect there to be one there to store your own beverages. When I equired about this at the reception desk I was told we could pay a deposit for a fridge to be brought to our room - not very professional in my eyes! I feel a little mean giving this Hotel a '2', as it isn't *that* bad, but for an alleged four-star you expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: northwestkildare
Reviews.Content: I stay here on a weekly basis but am considering moving elsewhere. Internet access is expensive. Despite requesting a quiet room I am repeatedly given a room facing traffic so it feels like every bus is going through the room. SolMelia request feedback which I think is a good thing but none of the basic improvements I pointed out have been made. They seem to prioritize families here so if you are a business traveller I would check it out thoroughly first.

Reviews.Title: “Capt”
Reviews.Author: Bulentince
Reviews.Content: Horrible staff-Especially the front desk supervisor-Mercedes.. Rooms are very small-even for London, Furniture is old, TV is a 19 inch old tube type that doesn't work half the time, A/C did not work-due to filter not being replaced in ages- The chair was broken, could not use it. What is worse is, when you mention any of these issues they give you the run around, and you end up talking to this sorry excuse for supervisor-Mercedes, who gives you a speech and an advice. They won't give you a critique form, could not even file an official complaint with the hotel's website-Sol Melia. I guess they don;t care about customer satisfaction. Would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I never ever experience anything more friendly and professional.”
Reviews.Author: Zliuka
Reviews.Content: We were invited to business meeting in this hotel. We spend there all day. At evening had a dinner at they restaurant. Hotel's lobby look very clean and pretty, Service was efficient, quick, precise and friendly. Food like at home. Would like to say special thank you to Senior Corporate Sales Manager Helen Polyanska for her effort Ñ‚Ð¾ Ð¼Ð°ÐºÐµ that day perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been so much better!”
Reviews.Author: skib0
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location of the hotel is, without doubt, a plus, the offset is extremely poor service and dirty rooms which are both tiny and poorly maintained. The lobby of the hotel is lovely, as are the restaurants and bars but I would advise that that is as far as you venture into this hotel. The rest rooms in the lobby were filthy with two of the three toilets blocked and the third with the toilet seat hanging off. The bedrooms are incredibly small with outdated facilities and a poor standard of cleanliness. We found rubbish in the wardrobes, drawers, window ledge and in the bins, the bath was also very dirty. The sheets were unpleasant and the room (despite being a non smoking room) stank of smoke. Despite repeated calls and requests to both reception and the duty manager nothing was done about any of the concerns we raised and we left the hotel after two days with a suitcase of clothes which now stank of smoke. Light switches in the room didn't work and neither did the tv remote (not that that was too much of a problem as you could pretty much reach the tv from the bed to switch channels!) This should be a truly lovely hotel but the team working there need a swift course in effective customer service (even trying to look like they cared would have placated us to some extent!). I would highly recommend stopping in at this hotel for a drink and then hotfooting it somewhere else where they might care that you enjoyed your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Extremley Kind!”
Reviews.Author: justin234
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Melia White House Hotel exceeded my expectations. With superior guest services as well as kind and knowledgable front desk and concierge the Melia White House is one my top picks for a stay in London. Each lounge was well decorated and clean and the wait staff was kind and prompt when it came to ordering in the lounge at the cafe and as well at the resturant in the Morning. The housekeeping was superior as well as room service. This hotel made our stay in London the complete London vacation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: bardot70
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived at your hotel from the USA for a deluxe double room. It was sugested by the receptionist , whose English needed help in expressing the details, that the room be changed for a regular double in exchange for breakfast during our three day stay. It was not made clear that the breakfast was only for one day. Why would anyone want to spend the remaining two days in a smaller room, where you could not open the door without knocking the suitcase off its stand, where the broken light bulb was never changed during the stay, where towels were only provided for one guest, and where the wardrobe door took multiple requests to get it fixed, so that that we could access the interior. Apologies at the front desk were nice, but they did not solve the problem. Judging by the double-thief-proof tie from the iron to the ironing board, this must demonstate a high risk of robbery in your hotel.There was no way that my sister and I could negotiate the reattachment of the iron to the board, and replacement back into the cupboard. Obviously it was beyond the skill of your staff too, because in spite of several requests for cleaning staff to return it to the cupboard, it remained outside, taking up further valuable space. LET ME ASSURE YOU, YOUR AMBIENCE COUNTED FOR NOTHING IN THE LIGHT OF A COMFORTABLE BED, ADEQUATE LIGHTING AND SPACE. However I would like to say how much i enjoyed the dinner that we had at the hotel for the 50th annivesary of graduation from Royal Free Medical School. Judith I Hegarty, MBBS, DLFAPA

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Z1GSTER
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms and the breakfast. Slighty spoilt by some difficult staff, but would still go again. We upgraded to the level and it was worth the extra as you have your own checkin that avoids the queues plus your own lounge and breakfast area.The main breakfast area had large queues and was packed.

Reviews.Title: “BAD”
Reviews.Author: mfilarent
Reviews.Content: very small and dirty room. Nice bed. Poor TV. Very expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Just Something About This Place...”
Reviews.Author: OlongapoSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the wife's birthday for 2 nights. OK, it's a central London hotel, so it wasn't exactly cheap, but fair value for the money. Our room was a junior suite, which was very tastefully furnished, though the sofa was in completely the wrong place for any meaningful use (except as a sofa-bed). Still, a very comfortable room and nice bathroom. TV was a big old cathode ray model with limited channels for this grade of hotel. We really enjoyed having drinks in the cocktail bar, where I would recommend actually sitting at the bar if possible, as the cocktail waiters are both friendly and fun to watch when they are busy! We ate one night in the restaurant and we were totally overwhelmed by the quality of the seafood dishes that we chose. We had not chosen the White House specifically for its food, but this really is a very fine restaurant and well worth trying. Breakfast was served in their club room (The Level) and was a very good buffet selection served in very comfortable surroundings. The only problem we had (and it was a very minor one) was that, being slightly "off the beaten track", there was not always a taxi waiting outside! Mind you, we never had to wait more than 5 minutes or so for one to turn up! Overall, a very enjoyable stay and now ranks as one of my favourite London hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest rooms in the world, and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: LEMarchingo
Reviews.Content: Although nicely decorated, these rooms are ridiculously small for the money they charge. There isn't really anything else going for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deeshay
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and our 9 yr old son stayed at the Melia White House Hotel in October 2010 We have stayed in many hotels but I have to say this has got to be the very best you could get in the uk.The rooms were beautifully clean the beds crisp clean linen,the staff extreamly well mannered it made you humble.When we checked in at Reception we was met with a very well mannered french gentleman,he informed us that we were chosen in a draw to go into their VIP lounge called The Level,drinks on the house for the evening including some very lovely Cava Champagne,free nibbles buffet and free bed and breakfast. We decided to eat in their restaurant called 'The Place' the waiting staff had impecable manners and the food was a delightful. I would be more than happy to recommend this hotel to anyone,this hotel really is trying so very hard to make your stay a very enjoyable one and they suceed.These kind of hotels are worth supporting,we will stay again on our next visit to London

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, Terrible Service - And Don't Expect To Get Any Sleep”
Reviews.Author: rosiesiman
Reviews.Content: Checking in at Melia was fine, a bit slow considering only one person was in front of me, but I didn't think the hotel was off to a terrible start. THE ROOM ITSELF When I got to my room, I was surprised to find that my "Queen"-sized bed was actually two twin beds pushed together. They were even made separately, with two sets of twin sheets so it wasn't even made to look like a single bed. The room was tiny and hard to squeeze into - And I'm a New Yorker, so used to small rooms! INTERNET CONNECTION Since Internet was included in my room, and this was a business trip, I attempted to sign on to check email. When I couldn't find a WiFi network for my iPad to connect to, I called downstairs and the front desk let me know there wasn't actually a WiFi connection, that I had to use a hard-wire. [This would have been helpful to know in advance!] When I tried to use the hard-wire for the Internet connection, I also had no luck. I called downstairs again and asked if they could reset the connection. 25 minutes later they were able to get it to work. TV However, whilst making the Internet connection work, my TV somehow was changed from English to German. [Grrr!!] While I'm not a big TV watcher myself, it should also be noted that there were approximately 7 channels to choose from, so not a large selection by any standards. SLEEP/NOISE My first night at the hotel, I was exhausted from traveling, and while it was noisy when I went to sleep, I was able to get a decent amount of sleep. The second night, the noises got worse. It sounded like there was construction happening right behind my head. At 11p, it was still quite loud, so I called downstairs asking if they could please make sure that any workers held off on noisy construction until the morning. They denied any sort of construction or workers, and were very defensive. In the end they agreed to bring me ear plugs, but only because I specifically requested them. Again, being a New Yorker, I'm used to ambient noise of the streets of NYC, but the level of noise at Melia was way beyond this. Despite the fact that I mentioned I had been trying to sleep for an hour and a half, they took a half an hour to bring me ear plugs. BREAKFAST Skip breakfast if you're in a hurry. Instead of using your room-key to check-in or pay for breakfast, there is a gentleman who checks your name against your room number. It isn't quick or efficient, especially when there are 20+ people in line to get into the breakfast hall. CHECKING OUT Again, a huge lack of efficiency. Instead of getting the bill under the door, or just being able to turn your room key into a box, you have to wait in line to check out. It took 30 minutes for me to check out. OVERALL While Reagents Park may be a great location, I will never revisit Melia. In fact, even if I had to travel for work and my company would only pay for Melia, I would go to the extent of booking a hotel and paying for it with my own money to not have to deal with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not care what you say you do not have a problem & we will not check on it”
Reviews.Author: amfedup1
Reviews.Content: Checked in to this hotel on Nov 3 after long day when trying to go to sleep loud pipelike banging was occuring behind my bed called the front desk they said they would send someone up no one showed up called again got the run around finally told to come down & speak to manager was told maitenance stood in hall heard no sound so there was no sound will not change your room go back to bed or leave pretty good for L185 a night

Reviews.Title: “Really great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luckygirl66
Reviews.Content: The Melia is in an excellent location, once you step out of the Great Portland Street, just across the street and your there. Upon arrival the Melia is a nice place, easy to settle in, the rooms are ok, they need to be a bit renovated, but they do have most of what you need right in the room. The size was a bit on the smaller side and the beds that we slept on were not that great. The location made up for it all. The Tube can take you anywhere. We tried to have breakfast at the hotel and when they told us the price, it was goign to be close to $30 dollars per person for the buffet.... I laughed and left. We had a perfectly great breakfast on the opposite side of the Great Portland Street tube entrance, same circular building, for a fraction of the price. The Green Man also has amazing pub food which is very close by. It was a great place to start from ...very quiet at night as well, which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the White House”
Reviews.Author: Cdntraveller060
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the White House - part of an Air Transat vacation holiday. We had a very pleasant week - check in was smooth, and they were able to give us an early check in, which after an overnight flight was great! The hotel caters to mainly a Spanish clientele, and most of the staff spoke Spanish as their first language. We didn't encounter any problems with language, and all of the staff were eager to assist us. Our room was small by North American Standards, but larger than other London hotels that I've stayed in. The bathroom was compact, but efficient - the only drawback was the height of the tub - which would be a challenge to get into if you weren't able to lift your legs fairly high. The elevator call system is a bit different, but easy to get used to. The location of the hotel is on the edge of Regent's Park, and is within walking distance of several subway stops. We faced a subway strike during our stay, but were able to get around on the buses which also are close to the hotel. The concierge was very capable, and able to advise us on several matters. We took a couple of tours, and were picked up at the hotel, which was convenient. The concierge sells tickets to the hop on hop off bus tour, and we were able to charge them to our room. We ate breakfast every morning in the hotel as it was part of our package - it is a buffet style service, not unlike the all inclusive resorts in the Caribbean. The breakfast was good - my sister enjoyed the made to order omlettes, and there was alot to choose from. We didn't eat any other meals at the hotel, preferring to see what else London had to offer. There are a couple of pubs virtually across the street (Okay but not great) - as well as a 24 hr mini grocery store, and we ate several good meals at a Pizza Express restaurant also very near the hotel. All in all an enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & worth the upgrade to a larger room”
Reviews.Author: KathiToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my Mom for a Mother/daughter trip, for 8 nights. We picked it because of it's location to the tube options (one just across the street, and one just down the block). It is 1 mile due north from Oxford street and all the fantastic shopping. Having said that, we did take a lot of taxi's and found, that even in rush hour, coming from the other end of town, by the Tate Modern, our most expensive taxi was 20 pounds. I had read a lot on here that the staff were unhelpful, but I found the opposite to be true. The concierge was helpful for us day after day, from confirming tours and taxi pick-ups, to suggesting restaurants and tube routes. We dealt with all three shifts of the concierge staff, and they were all most helpful, but, particularly the day and evening shifts. The front desk too was helpful when there was a dispute over our final bill regarding phone calls. All was resolved, with patience on all sides. The breakfast buffet is large and varied, and yes, overpriced, but it is London, and consider it you big meal till mid afternoon. We each had our own coffee and tea pots, which saved for having to have it always topped up. Have breakfast early, when the business crowd is in and out quickly, or you will be inundated with large Spanish families crowding out the room. We did upgrade from a basic double to a deluxe double, simply because we were going to be there 8 nights. This is still not a huge room by any standards, but pretty comparable to what you would find in downtown New York city. The TV had many channel options in English & Spanish and one radio station, and movies and games. We had fluffy duvets, which I always find cleaner than comforters which get cleaned who knows when. The beds were single in size, but there was enough room to manoeuvre around, even with luggage and shopping bags. Maids were friendly and cleaned and topped up supplies each day, including the shortbread biscuits (cookies). The lifts (elevators) had a strange system, but, it seemed to work. It is a Spanish owned chain, therefore seemed to attract a mostly Spanish clientele. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It wasn't in the heart of the city, but then you didn't have the price or noise that goes along with that

Reviews.Title: “Well Placed, Reasonably Priced, Rooms a bit cramped and 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: Melsm57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days early Sept - very close to Gt Portland Street Station - pity there was a tube strike during our stay. Room showed signs of tiredness (footprint on the wall where someone had obviously put their foot to tie their shoelace) kettle leaked and fused the power in the room - despite explaining the issue to the front desk they sent someone who just reset the breakers which meant it happened again the next time we used the kettle - as it was late at night they 'couldn't find another kettle' but did at least bring us a pot of tea when we asked. It's very Spanish - and most front desk do not speak very good English - but mostly they understood what we were saying. Declined expensive breakfast - little cafe tucked behind the tube station was way cheaper. Lack of free internet a major hassle - so every night we ended up at the Green Man pub (1 minute walk away) where for the same price as paying the hotel's outrageous internet charges we could have a meal and a drink and get free internet - duh when will London Hotels get it????? Overall hotel was very nice - US power points a nice touch. 15 minutes walk to Oxford Circus (walking slowly) - 5 or 6 minutes to Euston. Got a very good price - about 90 CDN $ a night for a double room - lack of a chest of drawers a negative - tv mediocre - restaurant expensive (tapas snack plus soft drinks 25 UK pounds but would def stay again if i could get the same price

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel nicely located by Regent's Park”
Reviews.Author: TheConfusedone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our European vacation, and it was the best hotel of the three we stayed at. The hotel room was a little small but had a comfortable bed, a nice bathroom, and some nice treats like tea provided. The room was also clean. The one annoying thing was that the fridge/minibar had a 15-pound/day fee to refrigerate your own food or drinks; they recommended guests rent a fridge from them instead. Also the wireless internet was very pricey, although 1 pound for 20 minutes in their business center seemed like a decent price for convenient internet. The location was nice by Regent's Park and it was a short ride on the Tube for all the attractions. There were some nice pubs in the area but our hotel was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “OK but slightly overpriced and service below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Eddiecreagh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at 'The Level' which is supposed to be a sort of VIP floor. This is because we had booked a Junior Suite. The room was the smallest Junior Suite I have seen i my life, it was clean and fine but bathroom was too tiny for what you paying. Even for London sizes (always small rooms). Service was ok, there was a dedicated breakfast and lounge for The Level guests. Nothing impressive but keeps you out of the main areas which are much more crowded. Check in at dedicated desk was ok. It looked like the main check in and concierge areas are well overcrowded, not what you expect from a hotel of this category. I am a frequent Melia customer but this time I was slightly dissapointed. Location is superb thought, at least for me. Breakfast was very good, usual Spanish buffet. Be aware normal customers have to pay a pretty crazy fare for internet connection. Is not free even in public areas.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not worth the price -- everything extra”
Reviews.Author: jts1948
Reviews.Content: accessible room -- very small could not turn scooter around. first room the TV did not work, was told engineering working on it, called back 2 hours later and told the same thing -- told them that what I was told 2 hours ago they offered to move us, 1 hour later we were moved across the hall., by that time it was 11pm and all we did was go to bed. internet was 5 pound an hour!! and could not get it to work the second night. everything was extra and expensive, hot chocolate 5 pounds, room service pizza came without plates or cutlery (could have got the same thing across the street for half the price) -- and not much worked, TV, phone on desk, internet, towel heater, accessible chair, the bed was the worst, could feel every spring! breakfast was excellent and location was excellent too but overall not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: bootscooter55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 weeks ago for 3 nights and found the hotel very good. We booked the Club lounge, which I fuly recommend as you get full buffet breakfast with lots of south american delicacies like dulce de membrillo, quesillo etc... and you get coffee, drinks, wines etc all included. The receptionist very helpful. HOtel was very comfortable, room a bit small but adequate. The lcoation was great, I recommend using the buses as the stop is right outside in the square. The tube station is also right outside, Great portland road but not as convenient as you had to change for connecting trains all the time. There is a Pret a manger and a Pizza Express right near buy where we had dinner the first night and lunch. Really enjoyed the staff at hotel. WOuld stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sinead1990
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and have a very mixed view. The hotel its self was beyond fabulous! Absolutely gorgeous and a truly fabulous location and our room was lovely. However the staff really put me off going back. When arriving at the hotel I was told we couldnâ€™t check in as the room as it wasnâ€™t ready, although we were informed we could check in from 3.00, I explained to the woman I was not happy about this at all as my partner and I wanted to freshen up as we were going out and insisted something had to be done, she then rang someone to tell me it would be 45 minutes. Therefore I asked to see a manager; she then rang again and told me I could go to my room straight away, as you can imagine I wasnâ€™t very impressed with the service. From then I was hoping to check in straight away, however, I was told to go sit down for 20 minutes as the system wasnâ€™t working. (While other people were checking in without a problem.) Within 5 minutes we went and checked in with someone else, however from my previous experience with the first woman, I chose to stay out of the hotel as much as possible as Iâ€™m a big believer in customer service and didnâ€™t want anything to ruin my weekend. As I stated above I chose not to spend a lot of time in the hotel due to this incident, however, when we checked out, we were told we had to pay Â£9 for putting our own bottles of water in the mini bar, I was furious. When I opened the mini bar there was a sticker stating â€œuse this for your own personal space,â€� not once did I see anything about being charged or I obviously wouldnâ€™t have used it! I explained to the woman, there was no sticker on my fridge about paying and for her to go and check she simply gave me my bill to sign, I told her I wasnâ€™t very happy about it and was quite reluctant to signing it, I simply got a shrugged face and bluntly ignored. From that point on I signed the bill, so I could get out of there! It is such a shame because the hotel and location is fabulous, however maybe some new staff or extra training should take place simple customer service skills go a long way in the hospitality trade!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: KingMaximus
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wkend theatre break in London,Stayed at this hotel and thought it was very nice. Our original room was a standard double which we were in to start with but upgraded to a superior double, was much bigger and worth the offer of an extra Â£20 to upgrade to it.The Hotel wasn't perfect but hey where is, what one likes another does not. Personally i thought this hotel was nice. Couldn't fault cleanliness of rooms, lobby was very nicely decorated, decor of rooms bit dull but still of good taste. Bathroom was lovely, big bath to relax in but have to say the bed was just wonderful, huge and very comfortable. Seen other reviews written, complaining of noise, but wasn't disturbed by noise once. The downsides were the breakfast, sausages like rubber and fried eggs not cooked fully, big selection though, the general hotel service was also very slow, ordered food via room service, it seemed to take rather a long time to get to us and when it did it wasn't particularly hot, not great when it cost approx Â£26 for a burger with fries and a large sandwich.The front reception can be quite slow, and waited 2 hrs for someone to look at tv as it was playing up, but by the time we had to depart the room still no one had come up to look at it.. The prices of the items in the mini bar were rather steep Â£4 for a can of drink, Â£8 for a small bottle of alcohol etc. Anyway they are quite minor moans and wouldn't put me off staying there again. Would recommend :-)

Reviews.Title: “If you dont enjoy feeling like you are an ATM stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: alpappy
Reviews.Content: Room booked was a triple with a so called king and double bed The double bed turned out to be a poor sofa bed looking into the bathroom! Everything and I mean everything is extra Internet 15 pounds even wifi id the lobby is 6 pounds Use the mini bar fridge yes you guessed it 15 pounds per day extra Have a meal downstairs tap water charged as an'open refreshment' 50 p( not sure if that is legal) All meals DO NOT Include VAT nor a hidden service charge .As this is not made clear I am not sure if this is legal either. In summary find somewhere else that is better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay in Heaven”
Reviews.Author: ModelgirlUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the Apartments for 3 months in 2008 ( Apt 452) I was in the middle of immergrating from the UK to the USA to marry my husband Mark. I needed to be in London for American Embassy Interviews and Medicals and the Melia gave me the most cost saving way of doing this, I paid only 30 pounds per night and the Service/Food/Staff were wonderful indeed, my husband and I will be returning from the USA in 2011 for career interviews as we are re-locating back to London and we will once again stay in a Melia-Whitehouse Apt... Try it.......and you WILL NEVER want to saty anywhere else! Yvonne Marie Miller USA

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and very dated”
Reviews.Author: DaveInPH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Melia White House twice - the first time 8 years ago and on a recent business trip to London. Between the two visits nothing has changed: the same dull decor (lots of dark marble and dark wood) and shabby furnishings. I saw 2 coach loads of tourists entering the hotel, so it is visibly going downmarket and away from business traveller. Great location, but the hotel needs a huge investment to keep pace with the competition.

Reviews.Title: “A bad soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: gemmarce
Reviews.Content: We coudn't sleep the 1st night because there was a party to the next-door neighbors. I complained many times to the Serviexpress phone but he didn't do NOTHING. Just said: "It is not our fault". My advice is the following: request a room without a doorm between your room an the next door room. As a good review I have to admit that the day after the receptionist change our room. They were really helpful. But unfortunateley we couldn't sleep one night....

Reviews.Title: “Very bad soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: gemmarce
Reviews.Content: The room's soundproofing are really BAD. We couldn't sleep the first night cause our neightbours had a part inside their room....This is unacceptable for such a good Hotel. I compalined many times to Serviexpress phone and teh person who attended to us did NOTHING: Just said: "I am so sorry but is not our fault". I m sure that if the soundproofing was good (as other similar hotels) we didn't listen to the music as if it was in our own room. My advice: Is a good hotel but try to request a room without a door between your room and the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: dennisg
Reviews.Content: My company places me in the Melia 3-4 times every month on business. Anything less than the "executive level room" will be very small by American standards. Regardless of the room size, there is very little to no insulation in the room walls, so the noise level is intolerable. You will hear the telephone ringing, television, even normal levels of conversation in the adjacent room. A room with a door leading to the adjacent room is even worse. In addition, rooms facing the front of the hotel suffer from outside noise. I have also changed rooms on several occasions because of inadequate air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “No bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: novembre1965
Reviews.Content: Booked a junior suite. Found out that it has a smallest bathroom ever seen in my entire "hotel life". Hotel toiletries and the bathrobe were, by contrast, OK. Breakfast was average (quality of coffee very poor) and the staff not particularly nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Values Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: Although I had booked a room for 4 nights, I checked out after the first night because I was very disappointed by the size of the room I was given at the Sol MeliÃ¡ White House. I had booked the room based on the description and photos of what I presumed was a representative room shown on the Sol MeliÃ¡ website. The layout of the room I was assigned was different from that shown on the website, and it seemed smaller. There was also a strong cigarette odor in the nominally-nonsmoking room, and the room was not adequately soundproofed - it was possible to hear the housekeeping staff right outside the door early each morning, as well as the bedroom doings of the neighbors at night. The public areas of the hotel are very nice, the room was clean and attractively decorated, and the presence of a tube station a short block away was convenient (although that particular station would have been closed had I stayed the full number of days I had originally booked); but given the other factors outlined above, I felt the room was really overpriced (I had been watching prices for about 6 months from before my stay). Other cons: - bed was too firm (and I am usually comfortable on firm as well as on softer mattresses) - not enough space for your belongings around the bathroom sink - weak shower pressure - sluggish flow out the bathroom sink and shower drains - unpleasant smell in the hallway (not masked by the potpourri that was placed there) - faint moldy smell in the bathroom - the added cost for internet access (I believe I paid Â£4.99 plus tax for 24 hours) is always annoying in hotels of this caliber

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nuttytart770223
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed every aspect of our stay at the Melia, the location is perfect....a short tube ride to the west end/shops etc, while being next door to Regents Park. The rrom was spotless, the bed was huge and very comfy, double glazed so no traffic noise and air conditioned, all the staff were polite and friendly. We didnt eat in the hotel as the prices for food were very expensive (especially breakfast) but there is a lovely cafe by the tube station for a cheap breakfast. All in all we loved the hotel and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: bigtim116
Reviews.Content: The White House was a nice place to stay for business travel- we had A/C and since we stayed on The Level we had access to their lounge with free wireless, good breakfast, and free drinks in the afternoon. Regent's park is just down the road and was a great place to walk and eat dinner. Easy access to public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheesyedam
Reviews.Content: Booked as a 'top-secret' hotel, and this was a pleasant suprise. Whilst check-in was not speedy, we were soon direct up to our room (upgraded for free - possibly because we were offered a paid upgrade and refused). High quality fittings and appearance, beautiful views toward Regents Park and north London. Room overlooked Albany St, but was not too noisy at night. Curtains aided a good lie-in. Room was in good condition with large comfy king-size bed, clean and well-stocked bathroom. Did not stay for food or drinks. Avoid touching the mini-bar-the signs on the door warn you that you will be charged to store your own products here. Would recommend the hotel for a good value place to stay in central London (its opposite Great Portland St Tube)

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in a cupboard”
Reviews.Author: alanwm
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights at the White House, booked by company. If one suffers from claustrophobia then the room I had would be a nightmare! I now know what it must be like to sleep in a cupboard! Tiniest bathroom I've ever seen. All I can say is that if one is allocated Room 331 plead insanity and run!! Very clean everywhere, polite staff, but all negated by the tiniest of bedrooms

Reviews.Title: “after a hard days sightseeing, a lovely relaxing evening”
Reviews.Author: pobs
