Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel. we booked into the v rooms. with that you get a breakfast which is fantastic, you can go in there anytime of the day and get snacks and drinks and from 6pm you can get tapas and any soft drinks and alchehol. it wasnt till the last night that i realised i could order a vodka of the waiting on staff. the staff were fantastic right through the hotel. the rooms were fantastic, with the biggest bed i have ever seen. loved this hotel and will be staying there again. afther a days sightseeing and you just dont fancy going back out, it was fantastic sitting in the lovely comfy longue and not having to put your hands in your pocket. this is just what you want. book the v room. you wont be sorry i would also like to add that we took the tour bus which at Â£25 we thought was quite expensive. but what we did was we bought the ticket about about 1.30 pm, then the next morning we got on the free boat ride that you get with the tour bus. you can get one for 1 hour or 1 for 3 hours. we took the 3 hours which took us to greenwhich, that made me feel i was getting my monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but poor staff”
Reviews.Author: pjones82
Reviews.Content: After not having a twin room for me and my friend and keeping us an hour at the check in desk they upgraded us to an executive suite that had a sofa bed in them bought us in another bed which seemed pointless, however the room was large and had everything from a microwave to a dvd player and the bathroom was big enough to easily hold its two showers so after a non to promising start cant recommend this place enough,

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat spoiled”
Reviews.Author: BinkaLeics
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed for shopping in nearby Oxford Street. We had booked to stay overnight as a birthday treat, do shopping and see a show (Wicked, highly recommended) The hotel entrance is impressive, marble floors, beautiful flower arrangements and smiling staff in the reception area. We completed the registration forms at 11am , left our bags with the concierge and returned at 4pm. Between 11am and 4pm the hotel had allocated all twin rooms to other guests. There followed the most interesting conversation with a member of staff on reception who stated that we would be allocated two rooms, both of which would have a double bed. We pointed out our children were young adults. He then went on to say "The hotel was not obliged to give us a twin room ( which we had pre booked and pre paid) it was only obliged to provide us with a room with a bed that would sleep two people in each room! "Not a good response as our children are teens of the opposite sex! After he was told this was unacceptable, he consulted another staff member for about 10-12mins, and eventually told us the teens would be upgraded to a junior suite room. Sounds good, what it meant was one bed, one sofa bed - which was eventually made up as a bed following two requests at 11pm. My daughter subsequently told us it was like sleepng on our put up bed in a hallway of the room. Not the 4 star experience she was expecting. On a positive note my room whilst small was clean and the bed comfortable,the staff at breakfast were efficient and the food was varied, both cooked and continental options. I would like to say to the managment of the hotel who may think it is acceptable to do this to customers, I am sorry on this occassion it was not, upgrade to two beds - ok - the bed settee was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigEast55
Reviews.Content: The gateway into the hotel was most excellent, the hotel is set off of a major street, but it is only a block from the underground station which is fairly well connected with the rest of the tourist sites in London. This is not the hotel to stay at if you want to be right next to the major sites though its not really close to anything of note, but it is in a very nice neighborhood. The elevator system was a bit strange but it worked out, we stayed in a suite so we had access to the Level which was really superb, really well executed, a nice place to relax that isn't your room so you feel like you can get out a little more. Free alcohol and other quality beverages, nice snacks, decent breakfast, but beware they may try and charge you. Room was fantastic, huge for London size, nice bed, nice pillows, nice everything, quality all around. It was rather expensive, but this is London after all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nursetired
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced and had a luxurious atmosphere. Very clean, nice decor, great breakfast. Close to Tube and walking distance from Oxford Street. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BDGALL
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Melia White House and it wont be the last. As with our previous stay, we booked a room on The Level which I would highly recommend. The rooms are large, very comfortable and the access to The Level lounge tops it all off - complimentary hot buffet breakfast, tea and coffee throughout the day and alcoholic/non-alcoholic drinks and tapas in the evening, all in a peaceful environment. We tried both hotel restaurants during this stay and both were excellent with lovely food and fast, efficient service. The location of the hotel is great, right beside Regents Park, a 2 min walk to a tube station and around a 15/20 min walk to Oxford Street. Overall, a hotel which isn't necessarily cheap, but provides good sized rooms and facilities near the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad hair day? I will give them the benefit of the doubt!”
Reviews.Author: stevewed
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed staying here on numerous occasions before I was really disappointed by most recent experience. My single room was so small that I struggled to navigate my way between bed and bathroom, needing to lean back against the wall, as if I was maneuvering along a narrow ledge, to access the ensuite. Although I have quite long legs, I was unable to sit comfortably upon the loo, having to contort my body in order to gain the necessary leg room. After waiting fifteen minutes to check out (at round about 10.45am) my patience snapped when three air crew (Iberia, I think) swanned in, in front of me to receive instant service. Having expressed my disatisfaction in not unreasonable terms I did eventually receive an apology for the delay. I was also informed that my room was a standard single, whereas on previous visits I had been upgraded to a double, due to availability. A reaasonable explanation, although I cannot stress that claustrophobics should stay well clear. However, later on, hoping to retrieve my case, which had been left with the Concierge for the morning, in spite of my numbered collection tag I was advised that I would have to play hunt the suitcase as he couldn't locate the said object himself. This involved me having to search high and low in a roomful of luggage, not what you would expect when staying in a four star hotel. Maybe the Hotel was having a collective bad hair day - I will hesitantly give them the benefit of the doubt, and should my next visit prove to be more agreeable, I will let you all know!!!

Reviews.Title: “Â£25 for Internet??!”
Reviews.Author: shirtee
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'd like to say that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in London however I don't think this was due to the hotel. The location is perfect. A short walk and you're on Oxford street. Perfect for Regents Park and just generally a great location. Staff were lovely and very friendly. We asked for a late check out and this was no problem at all. The hotel looks quite grand with huge wide corridors on each floor. Unfortunately this size does not extend to the rooms. Basic and functional is how I'd describe my room. There was quite literally just enough room to walk round the bed. It was not a functional room at all. But it was nicely decorated and clean so can't really grumble there. What I can grumble about is their penny pinching. In this day and age I fully expect free internet access as a given and most probably free wifi. They actually wanted Â£5 for one hour or something ridiculous like Â£25 for 24 hours access. Also the TVs? Really, old tvs with extremely poor reception. Admittedly it's not what you're there for but if you've got to watch something it might be nice to actually see it. Anyway, these 2 things spoiled the experience for me. If you want location it's pretty good, if you want a modern functional hotel look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you need a Cot!!”
Reviews.Author: DSU854
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from this hotel very disgusted with their organisation. I stayed with my Wife and 8 month old baby. I called before hand to check they could supply a cot or whether I needed to bring my own. They said they could supply one but I would need to upgrade to have enough room for it (this shows how small the rooms are). I agreed to upgrade. I then arrived and the front of house who checked us in said there wasn't a cot in the room yet so he would call to organise. He made a call and when he came of the phone he said in broken English ' we will put a cot if possible as soon as possible'. My father in law and I (also staying) looked at each other and said 'did he say 'if possible'?' We then went out for the evening returning around 9:30pm to find no cot in the room. When I called housekeeping, I had a really rude and unhelpful woman who told me they had no more cots and that she had told reception originally that we wouldn't have one. Obviously reception chose to keep this from us!!! I then complained and she said she would ask 'Quality' to speak to me. An hour later I tracked 'Quality' down in reception and he said he knew nothing about it. He went away to see what he could do. 40 minutes later he returned and said they had no cots and there was nothing he could do. I said this is like booking into a hotel and turning up to find you don't have a bed in your room!! There was no provision for this situation, no way of getting one from somewhere else. They had known all day of the problem, they did nothing!!! They just expected our baby to sleep on the floor on a couple of pillows. OUTRAGEOUS. As it was now 11:15pm there was no choice. They did try to sweeten us by being kind enough to take off the upgrade they had sold to have the cot in the first place and a free round of drinks. Some consolation!! These people had NO idea, some were rude and the ones that showed any interest did nothing to solve the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: goodson1706
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend recently surprised me with a trip to London to celebrate my birthday, he booked us in at the melia white house hotel for one night, and our whole stay couldnt have been more perfect. We arrived at the hotel via the Great Portland Street tube station, which is literally across the road from the hotel making it very central and very convient for all the main tube lines to travel around the city. The staff were extremely welcoming, friendly and very accomodating, allowing us to check into our room early with no extra charge. Just to warn you, they do tend to tell alot of customers that they have booked into a twin room so the beds will have to be pushed together, we were not certain but did think this was maybe a motive to persuade customers to upgrade for an extra charge of Â£45, as when we told the lady we weren't interested we were placed in a king size standard room despite her earlier endevour - so just say no! However regardless of this, our whole stay was one of pure class and luxury, the rooms are lovely and have everything you need - they even provide green tea in the coffee/tea making facilities which completely took me back as this is all I drink! The concierge was also very helpful in advising us on transport around the city, giving us average prices for taxis to several destinations, he also allowed us to store our luggage the next day after checking out so we could enjoy some more of the city without lugging our bags everywhere! All in all wonderful and highly recommended. We will definitely be staying there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough if you like living in asmall box”
Reviews.Author: MCASPETH
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of the trip advisor rating and can only assume that fellow reviewers are very easily pleased. The hotel is nice enough but there is lots of room for improvement. Travelling mostly in the US they know how to look after guests - something the Melia could do well to understand. On checking in there was a mix up with the reservation - one room missing! After some time on the phone and leaving us at the desk without comment the receptionist returned after some three or four minutes and checked us in with no explanation or worse still an apology of any description. NOT GOOD ENOUGH. There are doormen on duty during the day but try finding one fter 5pm!!! I presume the management does not take security or their guests safety seriously. We had a strange encounter late one night with someone knocking on a door attempting to gain entry to a room. A phone call to reception met with little response. Turning to the hotel the standard rooms are small to say the least so upgrade if you can afford it to a superior room. Ask if you get free wi fi thoiugh. At Â£14.99 per night this is an absolute RIP OFF. Cafes can give free wi fi so when you pay the room rate at this place wi fi should be free or say you are with United Airlines - I think their satff get it free. The rooms were comfy but very small and the bathroom suited a contortionist more than an average person. On the plus side the rooms were quiet and the beds comfortable if on the small side. Breakfast is good but pricey unless it is in your package. The restaurants and the bar are overpriced and very very poor value for money. If you want a good meal go to the Forge in Garrick Street - a real gem and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel just don't expect any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: shoelover009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while working in London so my company paid for the rooannoy it was not cheap. The decor is old fashioned and the bed hard but other than that pretty standard. The location is nice - next door to regents park if you fancy some fresh air. However, the noises within the hotel throughout the night meant I did not get any sleep even with ear plugs. This was not simply noisy guests - the hotel itself creaks and bangs and judders loud enough to wake the dead. The old lifts sound like they are about to come through the walls. I could literally feel the vibrations through the bed. I personally would never stay here again. At the money my firm was paying I expect a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced hotel - walls are hollow so you can hear your neighbour”
Reviews.Author: Coolatree
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel ....just located off Great Portland Street and 10 minutes stroll to Regent Street. The rooms are nice if a little small...rooms are clean ....however the walls are paper thin so you may have trouble sleeping as you will definitely be able to hear your neighbours every word. Breakfast was included and nice. Staff were polite however some were unable to speak english at times which frustrated my friend. There is a health spa so book in advance if you want treatments. Mini bar is way over priced do not remove anything as you will be debited immediately at high cost :(

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: Road-King777
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is average for London/Europe. Indifferent staff, small rooms, overpriced restaurant. What sets this hotel apart from others is the fact that they refuse to put any money into the rooms. Bed springs poking thru the mattress make for an unusually bad nights sleep. Furnishings beaten up and broken. TV set from the 1970s. I would not stay here again as there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not good either”
Reviews.Author: acl1495 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reasonable London hotel, although slightly odd in that you'll find English very much a second language here. Rooms are highly variable in size - I've had large almost suites, down to single bed cubbyholes all for the same price. Noisy inside until late in the night - very much recommend you ask for a room away from the elevators. These whirr and 'ping' all night. Also insist on a genuinely non-smoking room if you want one. Their definition of non-smoking seems to be that if the previous occupant hasn't smoked then its a non-smoking room. Unusual quirk of the hotel is that it will take you at least 30 mins to escape in the morning. The bizarre elevator system can take ages to get to your floor, and once you've got over that you have to content with some of the slowest desk staff I've ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, cramped and poor service”
Reviews.Author: QueenofSlaithwaite
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here over the Bank Holiday weekend. I booked the room in February requesting a QUIET room in writing. Reception was very slow and seemed to have difficulty in finding a room for us. We were eventually allocated #137 -which looks onto the street, overlooks the outdoor patio and turned out to be immediately over the bar where rather loud 'background' music thumped through the floor of our room. I returned to Reception and asked for a move to a quieter location. The same receptionist then began another trawl of available rooms, indicating that they were in very short supply and generally making very heavy weather of it. When a group of 20 Spaniards arrived at the desk she turned away from me to deal with them.! I was open-mouthed at this. Seeing my displeasure she then asked a colleague to deal with me and we were given room #282. This is an interconnecting room and EVERY sound made by the occupants can be heard through the door as we discovered later that evening. The twin rooms (classic) are very small and extremely cramped - approx 8 feet wide - so it is just possible to walk around the bottom of the bed. A cappuccino costs Â£4.50 - for 3 tablespoons of liquid and topped with a mountain of froth to the rim of the cup. On the positive side the hotel is very close to Gt Portland Street tube station and Regent's Park. It trades on its location and there are serious issues with Reception.

Reviews.Title: “A Mistake thinking you would get a good nights sleep in a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redthecrow
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel quite late Monday evening after book the room on line we were offered 2 rooms a smoking room and a twin bedded room non smoking we took the twin room non smoker MISTAKE warning room 268 is very noisy as it backs on to the lift shaft and is not Noise proofed. so every time the lifts were called you heard the winding gear and the doors opening. If you stay at this hotel make sure you do not get a room anywhere near the lifts.I found the check in staff not unfriendly but to business like.

Reviews.Title: “We booked this for a bank holiday visit...”
Reviews.Author: Thegeufron
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a bank holiday visit to London. The location couldn't have been better - virtually 2 mins walk from Great Portland St tube station, and 5 mins from Regent's park. With regards to the quality of hotel, I would opine that it it very good value for money. The interior has the feel of somewhere which has had a recent makeover, but that is not to be taken as a criticism. The room featured a very comfy bed with the usual hotel amenities. We enjoyed an uninterrupted night's sleep with little noise from outside. The only slight criticism I would make would be in relation to the older model tv. But that is only a minor criticism. We both agree that we would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: mia59
Reviews.Content: Very nice and friendley hotel. If i go back to London I will book this hotel again! The only thing that th I can complain about was the bathroom, it was very cold. The location was perfect. This hotel was cleanand and beautiful, good service from the stuff, The breakfast was exellent. I loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Lemonmerangue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above our expectations. Thebed room was of an excellent standard and kept beautifully clean . The bathroom too was of a high standard and we really could not fault Melia White House in any way. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant which helps after a long journey. It is handy for several tube stations and is situtated directly in front of Great Portland Street underground, which was ideal as we were travelling in from Stanstead Airport, using the Stanstead Express to Liverpool Street Station. We them got on the tube and arrived at Great Portland Street without any underground line changes. This was great when you have luggage to haul around. It was our wedding anniversary whilst we were there and the hotel sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne which we really did not expect, but a lovely touch. Regent's Park is close by and Regent's Park tube station is also near by and handy to combinate with Great Portland Street for underground line changes. A thoroughly enjoyable time in London and at the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Good London hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: DontpanicNo
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at Melia White House, this time we booked directly with the hotel homepage, and got a better room than we did via lastminute.com. The hotel is nicely located close to Regents Park, in walking distance to Regents Square, and with tube stations and bus stops practically on the door step. The rooms are typical hotel rooms, clean and of an OK size. I recommend skipping the overpriced hotel breakfast and instead have breakfast in the park. You can buy fruit, sandwiches juice etc at the mini-mart across the street from Portland St. station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: StratfordianUk
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from London having spent two nights in this hotel with my 23 year old daughter. I was really impressed by the hotel, very clean and comfortable. We had an executive room which gave us access to something called the Level lounge. This is a lovely room with complementary tea/coffee/soft drinks all day, breakfast in the morning, cake and crisp snacks in the afternoon and alcoholic drinks and tapas in the evening. A real help given London prices. I booked through lastminute.com and although the room was a bit more than some available on the website, the level of comfort, great staff, the use of the lounge and the saving in food and drink costs more than made up for it. It's also a great location for the centre of London. The best thing though was the staff, they were freindly and helpful from the moment we arrived. I would recommend the hotel without reservation and would use this chain elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location..”
Reviews.Author: Sgarn
Reviews.Content: I came for a few days with a friend. The location is brilliant, just a step away from the tube and has shops around it. Only down fall in my opinion is that you could hear everything the people in the next room were saying. very annoying at 1 in the morning. Other than that i would deffinatly recommend and return. Had breakfast every morning as it was included and it was gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a five-star hotel, excellent service for good money”
Reviews.Author: TownsonKowloon
Reviews.Content: After spending four days in Normandy Hotel in Paris ( a terrible hotel experience) , my family and I continued our journey in Europe by visiting London. Melia White House was the hotel we chose. To our great surprise, it turned out to be extrordinary and a truly five-star hotel, quite contrary to our Paris experience. It has wonderful, courteous, friendly and helpful staff and the services rendered are befitting its status - from arrival. check-in, luggage delivery. in-room internet to breakfast. Everything was so meticulously arranged to our total satisfaction. The quality of food is again over and above our expectation. We are very happy with the junior suite we stayed in, very roomy complete with a separate closet room and a spacious bathroom (with a bathtub and a separate shower booth). Unlike Normandy, Melia White House provides everything insitu, commensurate with its five-star standards - absolutely no need to call housekeeping to ask for anything more. What made us feel warm is the helpfulness of its staff at the reception, at the concierge, at the front desk and even in the restaurants. An excellent example is that its concierge staff took the initiative of carrying our lugguage and calling a taxi for us when we departed. I have stayed in many hotels in London before and Melia White House is truly among the very best in service, quality anbd environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but the staff and service are terrible”
Reviews.Author: j8dau
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in terms of decor and rooms. However, the staff and service are terrible. I waited 15 minutes to check in! my room service order was wrong and then when it re appeared it was cold! I think this hotel could be greatly improved if the staffing issues and service was resolved. Great location and large rooms. Shame about the noise too!

Reviews.Title: “I would easily stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: BetoRockfeller
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s interesting to observe such a wide range of experiences and the kind of passionate opinions it generates. I stayed 7 days in London (my first time there) at the end of last October, 2009. I tried to choose a nice inexpensive hotel (with free broadband access and large rooms) near one of the big parks, surrounded by bus and metro stations, but in a quiet neighborhood. Not an easy task, but and I think I succeeded. I got an excellent, airy and large room with a brand new king size mattress. There was a minor problem in the bathroom: the shower hose was spitting some water in the floor. After a quick email to the consierge, they promptly solved the problem in the same evening. I needed free broadband access (itÂ´s pay and expensive in the rooms), so they offered me an upgrade to THE LEVEL LOUNGE, wich is open from 6 do 11 pm, with free internet, snacks and drinks. Considering all, it was a fair price for the services provided and I had a very pleasant stay. Strongly recommend for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good level hotel - nice rooms and location but no care for details”
Reviews.Author: Cibernella
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in a Superior room: room are quite comfortable even if not big, bathroom is clean and overall impression is good. Anyway service is not high level: in my room slippers and bathrobe were missing (while my colleagues found them in their room) and TV remote control seemed not to work well. I went through the service info in the book on the desk to find out about internet connection but there was nothing. On the other side location is nice, close to Regent's Park and in walking distance to 3 tube stops. Restaurant on street side is very good and with a good choice. There's another Spanish restaurant inside but I didn't have the change to try it. Overall judge is: good level hotel but no care for details.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, inefficient staff.”
Reviews.Author: LillyDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. The rooms were fine and the cost quite reasonable if you booked the package including breakfast and evening drinks. All the staff were very unhelpful and rude with the exception of a couple of the breakfast staff. On departure, we asked the concierge to book a cab and we only had credit card. He advised only a few cabs took credit card and rang one for us. We were surprised by this as we had stayed in London many times and has never heard this. After waiting 25 minutes for the taxi he booked (which was obviously a friend of his) we grabbed one from the nearby rank who told us nearly all taxis take credit cards. While we were waiting outside a guest from a room above us threw a cigarette out the window which landed on our 2 year old. I advised the concierge who shrugged.

Reviews.Title: “Wint Be In A Rush Back”
Reviews.Author: IRELAND097
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room to find when we got there there was one double bed and a pull out bed on the floor that folded into a couch. I wasn't impressed by this but was told it would cost extra money to upgrade. The breakfast was also not good. I would recommend this hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: manchesterman2
Reviews.Content: Awful experience with this hotel. Room booked well in advance, but when I arrived they seemed to be unable to find my booking. Was left standing at the reception desk for at least 20 minutes before they eventually found my reservation. No apology or explanation. Was then informed that because of their mistake the only room they had left was a smoking room. The room stank to high heaven. Musty smoke smell from sheets, pillows, everything! Would never go back to this hotel, and would not recommend to anyone, under any circumstances

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: MCB27Northampton
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in London for the weekend and stayed Saturday night at this hotel as part of a show/hotel package. It was in a great location - walking distance from Euston Station, Oxford Street and the West End. The rooms were very nice and clean with comfortable beds and good quality bed linen. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Although the hotel was very busy, the reception staff/concierge were very pleasant and helpful. The only down side was the price of drinks at Â£3.50 for an orange juice and Â£8 for a Bailey's!

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: travelmomGalway
Reviews.Content: On arrival at home after 3pm our rooms were still not ready and the receptionist could not tell us how long rooms would take she didn't even ring housekeeping until I insisted that she would so that we had an idea how long it would be. I booked a twin room and a double room and rang the hotel the day before arrival to request that we would get these room close together and was told no problem, however when we arrived we were told that it was 2 twin rooms that they were preparing for us. They had my request there but was told that the nearest we could get these type of rooms was twin room on 2nd floor and double room on 7th floor (smoking room) but if we wanted to upgrade for Â£30 extra per night (we stayed 4 nights) that the rooms were available immediately! At this stage we said we would accept 2 twin rooms but still didn't know when they would be available. After waiting for an hour we were so tired that we decided that we would upgrade just to get a room we spoke to a different receptionist and she found us a twin and double room on the same floor without upgrading!!!!! As you can imagine that wasn't a great start to our trip. Where the rooms were very clean they were very small, the bed wasn't the most comfortable and the television didn't work very well it kept cutting on and off. We ate in the restaurant one night, the food was nice but nothing exceptional and it was extremely expensive. The bar was also expensive even for tea or coffee. Where the location of the hotel was excellent that was all it had going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlos040
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby, and fast check in. Room was very clean and tidy with a great view. Bathroom was a little "compact and bijou", but did the job. The breakfast is very, very good, and the Breakfast service staff, were efficient and friendly. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, would surely come back again !!!”
Reviews.Author: 1111Alex1111
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for a short break over a week-end. The location is great, next to the Regents park and by the tube station which is very convenient... The place is very warm and welcoming, even thou it was quite busy. We were offered an upgrade on the check in and we took " The Level Executive room" that comes with an access to the Lounge where complimentary breakfast, beverages (including alcohol) are served. As well as nice Tapas in the evening - great snacks with the drinks !! And all for Â£45 only, for 2! Great value! Ask reception if there are deals available.. Room was very nice and the bed was huge! Beautiful bath robes as well that you can actually buy with the hotel logo.. And there is a pillow menu in the room, so you can choose the pillow you sleep on !! Actually, we have really enjoyed it, will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “"Odd, but in a good way"”
Reviews.Author: Clover25
Reviews.Content: The Melia White House is odd, but in a good way. A little piece of Spain in London, owned by a Spanish company, staffed by Spanish speakers and apparently frequented by Spaniards and Latin Americans. We've stayed several times before. Everytime we check in, the receptionist asks if we would like to upgrade, we always say no but we get upgraded anyway. I don't think that they actually have any basic rooms - has anyone ever seen one? Our room was on the second floor overlooking the main entrance. Traffic noise wasn't a problem but the sounds from the next door room was. The guests weren't particularly noisy but we could hear their conversations and some very loud snoring during the night. Maybe we were just unlucky as I don't remember noise being a problem on previous stays. Breakfast is great - we had it included in the price of the room. The guys at the concierge desk are very helpful and good at directions, geting taxis and finding lost gloves. The bar is entertaining. Sadly we didn't see any mice but we did see a Columbian duet doing covers of Shakira songs. The location of the hotel is great, tube station across the road and bus stops near by.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting- full of mice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TTMdots
Reviews.Content: What a shame!... First impression was very good, I was sitting at the bar with friends enjoying nice live music when we saw one little mouse running between our feet! Then another two joined! we were shocked, I complained but it seemed to be quite natural to all the personnel in the hotel. When I checked out, the coordinator at reception did not believe me for the mice and she said she had to check with the bar personnel. I asked for a discount, but I didn't get one penny, as they assured me that the hotel "was taking hygiene very seriously". I told them that if they were doing that they should have shut down the bar. Just think: What if mice were in the kitchen which is on the same level? Would you like to eat, stay there?" So many hotels in London... Just go to another one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: andyellis1993
Reviews.Content: I had never been to London before and stayed for two nights. The location of the hotel is exellent, a short walk to Oxford Street. It has great facilities within the hotel with a cafe,gym,bar and saunas. Staff are helpful and polite and i throughly would recommend to anyone wanting to enjoy a luxurious stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: BB72
Reviews.Content: Minutes from Regents Park, Euston, UCH or Tottenham Court Road. good value, nice rooms, avoid breakfast at a whopping GBP25!!!! Instead go to Cilantro about 5 minutes away on Tottenham Court Rd for delicious breakfast, good variety and floor to ceiling windows so you can watch the world go by!

Reviews.Title: “would stay with them over & over again. amazing hotel & rooms”
Reviews.Author: CamberleyKevlar
Reviews.Content: I treated the Mrs to a theatre break and booked the Melia. Short distance walk from regents street & into the hotels reception which was stunning, NOW the room, the room was OUTSTANDING words cannot describe the bed it really made our stay memorable, it was the a double king size bed well worth paying for. The breakfast which was included was very good standard and service was prompt. I would definately stay with them over and over again when staying in LONDON.

Reviews.Title: “Melia does the job in London for business”
Reviews.Author: kerryboy09
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the business traveller, well located opposite Great Portland st tube station, nice spanish owned chain, gas Irish lady serves breakfast drinks in the morning, shes unique! Great buffet breakfast and loads of Gluten free options as well!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Consignor08
Reviews.Content: The travel agent booked the room so I did not have access to the minibar/fridge in the room. That option was not part of the reservation. The standards of the hotel are quite high. Doormen quite friendly and very helpful on all shifts, come of the concierge staff better than others. Not all spoke English well and didn't seem to want to help. Some of the desk staff seemed to be bothered by any questions, some were quite friendly and welcoming. Rooms very clean, pillows hard, tv ok, house cleaning staff that I came in contact with very friendly and helpful, desk staff did not explain the card for the electric and the cleaning person was quite nice and helpful. Breakfast buffet very good, staff friendly, something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and average”
Reviews.Author: ebws
Reviews.Content: Hotel booked for me due to business and we were upgraded so we had access to the club lounge. Rooms were very noisy - if you're sensitive to noise get ready to try out a few rooms before you unpack. Lots of traffic noise ! The rooms were dated but clean. The club lounge on the ground floor was useful for internet and for complimentary pickings and wine in the evening. I thought the restaurant was pretty good, although pricey (London !) and we had some excellent fish there. Best thing about the hotel is the location - close to Regents Park and next to the tube. We stayed there over a weekend and woke to screaming in the corridors due to a party that had continued past the bar......that could happen in any hotel of course but to their credit the hotel quietened it down. Overall, rooms dated and even in the absence of early hours partying, they need better soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep so noisy”
Reviews.Author: coylet1
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the statements stating totally sound proofed, I have never stayed in a noiser hotel, was glad to get home to get a decent nights sleep. Firstly our room was not on their reservation list, not a fault of the hotel but that of 'superbreaks' so beware. But we recevied a roo that was cojoined to another, luckily the gesuts in teh adjoining room were not noisy cause we could heardv their entire conversations!!!! Alos for the whole duration of teh night there was a constant noise from other parts of the hotel, as the floors in the some of the hotel areas are marble it sounded like there were chairs being pulled across the floors, perhaps teh cleaners i am not sure but it went on all night and what sounded like sliding doors or elevator doors. I did let reception know upon check out and was stared at blankly as if they were well aware of this complaint. I would not recommend this hotel if you wish to get a good nights sleep whcih is a pity cause the rest of the hotel looks lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Vast improvements since l last visited, as charming as in 1969”
Reviews.Author: Traveltime44
Reviews.Content: l very much wanted to return to the Melia White House, where l first stayed in the summer of 69. Gone is the oft renovated Coffee shop, Breakfast room, Portuguese staff with their eager conversation in the Coffee Shop, lrish staff on the ground floor, who were there for many years. l can remember the heat sensitive buttons, pressed to summon the lifts - the first l'd ever seen. The system ls now computerised to summon the lift closest to where one is - unique and very efficient. l found the bar a bit on the dark side, yet very nicely appointed, and staff very willing and cordial. The main restaurant offers an excellent menu and wine list, and in general l'd say that the hotel is not overly expensive, bearing in mind the location, which is excellent, near Regents Park, and one tube station from Oxford Circus. Quiet, yet close enough to main West End streets. l would say perhaps that check-in was a bit slow, and telephone charges seemed a bit high, although that is probably the generality. Also, television set in the room was old generation. Overall, very pleased, and happy to revisit a piece of my childhood!.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden secret ...”
Reviews.Author: HeadhunterUk
Reviews.Content: The Sol Melia White House Hotel is one of the best kept secrets in London. Excellent service and quality rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: LAN64
Reviews.Content: Noisy and unfriendly This place is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in London and Iâ€™m in London 5-8 times per year. At the Melia White House Hotel I ended up in a room next to the lift - this caused terrible bibs and noise the entire night. Then they moved me to a new room just next to the ventilation system - just like sleeping on a ferry next to the engine. Then I was finally moved to a new room - here the internet did not working as â€œunfortunatelyâ€� the WiFI could not reach my room. They promised to send some from maintenance to fix it but they newer showed up. I tried to call the reception - but the phone was constantly â€œbusyâ€� for my entire stay of 4 days. All staff seems to be Italian/Spanish and do not really understand English. All the â€œlook-a-like artâ€� on the walls is fake and the â€œItalian tilesâ€� in the bathroom are all laminate flooring. The internet charge is close to Â£20 per day - awful!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: LondonParis2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, hotel was lovely. It was out first visit to london and the hotel is located right by the tube, very easy to get around. walking distance to oxford circus where they have all the shops & restaurants and tour bus stop. breakfast in the morning was fresh and delicious. the concierge was friendly and gave great direction/suggestions. i highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “pretty average, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: leannie73
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after the hotel we were staying in went on fire! The queue to check in was VERY slow! Our travel agent had arranged for us to be transferred there after the fire however when we arrived they knew nothing about us and were not helpful at all. (Bearing in mind we had had a pretty stressful morning so far). The room was pretty tired looking and dated. The wall paper was peeling off the wall. The bathroom was pretty old fashioned and basic. The restaurant we found very busy, breakfast was nothing much to rave about either. The location was good, just a short walk to a tube station. We will not be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Whateverv
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an individual room at the MeliÃ¡ White House for one night. I found the hotel just ordinary. The decoration and furnishing are pretentious and a bit dated. The staff at the reception desk were nice and both the chek-in and the check-out were fast. The room was small, if not too much for London standards; however there wasn't even one chair and the only "table" in the room was more of a ledge with legs, barely 25cm deep and placed in a narrow, poorly-lit, aisle-like space (which is awkward for a four-star hotel that claims to be ideal for business travelers; but of course with a chair and a desk the room would have appeared crammed). The TV was big and a bit old. The closet looked a bit shabby. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was up-to-date but really tiny; not even a shelf for the toilet bag, just the small counter around the sink. Everything was clean enough. There is a coffee and tea kit (inside the closet, as there is no other place to put it). There is something odd about the use of the in-room minibar: an note advises that if the customer uses the minibar to cool his own stuff then he will be charged 15 pounds. No free internet at any area of the hotel. Rate is 15 pounds per 24h. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel; I don'd remember the price but it was in the region of 20 pounds, so I had a good breakfast somewhere nearby (Great Portland St. is just across the street). The hotel is well located but you can find plenty of well located hotels in London at similar or cheaper rates and this one does't add any special value. In brief, it was just fine but there's nothing special about it. I've stayed at nicer hotels in London and would recommend this one only if you get a cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms small, noisy and too dark”
Reviews.Author: Kerrser
Reviews.Content: I get the impression that if you pay to upgrade to a better room this is an OK place to stay. The upgrade is heavily pushed with notices/adverts in the hotel. There is very little space in the standard room and the walls are paper thin so you can hear everything in the next room. The lighting is very gloomy. Otherwise the hotel seems OK but we won't stay there again because, when one of us was taken ill, 3 hotel staff said a doctor could be called but it would cost Â£175. There was no mention of the NHS until I really pushed them when the nearest hospital A&E was suggested. In the end I called NHS direct myself. We are UK citizens so could work out how to do this but how many foreign visitors end up paying for the "hotel's" doctor because they don't know there could be an alternative? This seems very unfair to me.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BeckyJS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed once before several years ago and the hotel felt opulent and a real treat, but this time it felt like a slightly faded impersonal in your face money making machine. It's got a good location, and the breakfast is immense. The room was tiny, and poky but very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kehan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights over a weekend with my partner and my parents. This hotel was perfect for us. The location is fantastic. Only two minutes walk to Great Portland St. tube station and five minutes walk to Regents Park Tube station. Oxford St. is a 15 minute walk or 5 minutes on the bus which you can catch across the road from the hotel. The hotel itself is very clean and tastefully decorated. Rooms are a wee bit small but that's to be expected for London. Staff were very helpful and anything that we needed it was delivered without a problem. Bar in the evening was very relaxing for a drink after a long day with live music every night. Can be quite expensive but if you can get a deal it's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location, Few niggles.”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouseSussex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on 7th Nov 2009 for the one night and it was very nice. We upgraded our room to a superior double and although the room was slightly on the small side, it was clean, tidy and what is to be expected when staying at a 4 star hotel. On Saturday night we had a night cap in the hotel bar which was again very nice and of 4 star expectations, however it was very dark in there and they need to light it up a bit more so as the customers can read the drinks menu a little easier. I also was a little disappointed that they did not have any ginger wine for my whisky; I think that being a 4 star hotel in London they should have ginger wine. In the morning breakfast was disappointing. The bacon was well over cooked and the rashers were stuck and clumped together; the breakfast was also cold due to lack of adequate hot plates. I would like to stress this hotel is very nice,of 4 star standard, in a great location and a stones throw away from Portland street tube station. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute bargain”
Reviews.Author: jaggyjaggy
Reviews.Content: We booked this through lastminute.com and got a bit of a bargain. The hotel's website pointed out that the rooms have been soundproofed and having had problems with almost every hotel we've been in over the past months that was music to our ears. When we checked in, without our asking, the receptionist rejigged our booking as the room was going to be noisy. And in the end, the room was lovely and quiet. The only problems were that the tv wasn't much use, and the bathroom light wasn't working properly, but apart from that it was a great bargain. We paif Travelodge prices for a proper old-style lush hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for location, budget and quirky bits and bobs”
Reviews.Author: RachelSouthwood
Reviews.Content: It was OK. Just OK. There were highlights - the quirky lift system, the piped-in aromas, spaciousness, a good-sized bathroom, nice lobby... But the biggest downside were the awful (and I mean TERRIBLE!) pillows, the slow laborious check-in and out and the breakfast that tasted like soap or something. Yuk! I booked through 'secret rooms' on laterooms and it was an interesting place to spend a night, but I am not sure if I could suffer those pillows and not too comfortable beds for more than that. We were upgraded to the next one up from standard, all for Â£120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Crown Plaza Group instead, much better value.”
Reviews.Author: SisterNearLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked Executive room. Great location. The special reception for executive rooms wasn't open, so booked in at front desk. The executive level bar was very nice but no music and no telly so not too inviting to stay for more than half an hour. The bar itself was very limited, wines, red, white and fizzy, and beer. Sodas and juices in abundance but no ice! Breakfast was appalling. No fresh fruit except either five grapes or one kiwi. The cooked food wasn't even remotely warm. The fried egg was so over cooked that it could not be cut in half with the knife provided. Had to ask for more hot water for the coffee because it was so strong. The wonderful Spanish restaurant didn't open Sundays, mind you that was probably just as well considering the cost of the drinks in the bar!!! Altogether, Â£200 plus for a quite small room - very bad value for money. As I said above, Crown Plaza much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RedJimNottingham
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night whilst visiting friends in London. There were no queues to check-in; the lifts however are a bit odd as you select your floor prior to getting into the lift, and only have an open/close door button in the lift! The lobby and restaurant are bright and airy; the bar, bedrooms and corridors are perhaps slightly dated - a lot of dark wood and dark coloured furnishing and carpets. The standard double room was quite small and the bathroom was also poky, but on the whole I was fairly happy with it because of the great location (next to Great Portland Street tube), comfy bed, cleanliness and the quality spread available at breakfast - on Sunday morning we sat reading the papers and were spoilt for choice food-wise. The service was attentive and polite. When we came to leave there was an enormous queue at the reception; as I'd paid I just dumped the keycard and left - but it would have been a pain to queue if there had been a bill to pay. Would go back, but wouldn't prioritise this over other London hotels that I've stayed in; it would be dependent on price (we paid Â£140 for double with breakfast, which I thought was fair enough for what we got, but wouldn't pay more I don't think).

Reviews.Title: “A nice 2 star hotel...never again”
Reviews.Author: Boris2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good, just few steps from 2 tube stations and close to the Madame ThussaudÂ´s or London ZOO. We booked the hotel without breakfast - paying more than 20 pounds per person seems rather ridiculous. The check out was very slow, room safe did not work and also the key cards had to be replaced twice in 3 days. The room we had was tiny - smaller than a cabin on a ship, one could barely move in there - IBIS has larger rooms. The bathroom was also very small and one can only wonder how this can be a 4 star hotel? The overall impression of the hotel was OK, but there are nice hotels in London offering better service and space... If you remove anything from the minibar (e.g. if you wish to put your medicaments in there), expect to be charged automatically 15 pounds... When we claimed this charge, we were offered a fridge for the medicaments - it was supposed to come in 15 minutes but has never arrived. The reception seemed tired and not very professional. There was no free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaque_bpc
Reviews.Content: Superior Room was large and comfortable, Efficient lift system, Great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “First stay left something to be desired but The Level was excellent”
Reviews.Author: vix92008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is around 10 minutes walk from Euston station (to the West) and is in a pleasant location close to Regents Park. My first stay was in a Classic Room and I was not impressed at all; no cold water, the iron didn't work and neither did two of the lights. The room was cramped and had old style steel framed windows that were draughty. The bed was not a full size double despite a double room for single occupancy having been paid for. Drinks exorbitant, charged Â£7 for 2 small glasses of still mineral water as the tap water was 17 degrees so not fit to drink. Huge queues for breakfast in the main restaurant and even longer queues to get to reception to check out or report the faulty items. After an e-mail to the hotel an upgrade to The Level was offered by way of an apology at my next stay. Check in was marred as the upgrade had not been delivered as promised, only a Level room had been given and not Level service. After 10 minutes and having to produce the e-mail (thank goodness for mobile phones with internet access), the issue was resolved. The Level rooms were superb. Super king size beds and double glazing, plus the slippers, bathrobe etc. The Level lounge is very pleasant with a soothing atmosphere reminiscent of a club class lounge at an airport and the added bonus of complimentary drinks until 10pm. Breakfast is served in the Level lounge with staff attentive and food is excellent. I used the International restaurant in the evening and the 3 course buffet was excellent value at Â£24 with the ability to return as many times as you liked taking small portions so you are able to sample all of the dishes you would like. All of the dishes I ate were of a really good quality. I cant recommend their profiteroles highly enough! Overall, excellent restaurant and superb accommodation/services if you opt for the upgrade to The Level. I would recommend both.

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely return”
Reviews.Author: humbletraveller18
Reviews.Content: As part of a special birthday treat to my wife, we stayed at the Melia White House during our recent stay in London. Truly a wonderful experience: great breakfasts, clean rooms, terrific shower, friendly staff (special thanks to the concierge!). My wife is especially sensitive to scents and the lodging of nearby smokers made it less than ideal when the fan wasn't on. But that's minor. We'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Cufflinksandtie
Reviews.Content: I arrived with no money, my wallet having been stolen on the plane. They paid my taxi fare and waited two days for me to get a new credit card and funds! Trul y a great relief for my birthday treat to myself!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel8584
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia White House Hotel in the Regents Park area of London. The hotel was so convenient only 1 block away from the Warren St. Tube Stop! We stayed in the Level section of the hotel which included breakfast for free as well as a lounge area where drinks and snacks were always available! It was really perfect for a quick snak in between touring and dinner! The hotel is beautiful, the room spacious, and the food delicious! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishbcn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, could do with a few more staff at checkin and at breakfast but still everything went rapidly. Apart from slightly worn carpet everyhting was in great condition even if the decor was a bit overly Spanish for my liking!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel for money I paid”
Reviews.Author: martinto8
Reviews.Content: Booked this under a secret hotel deal and saved circa Â£100 off normal price and after reading some of the reviews prior to going I have to say that checking in wasn't slow at all. Obviously had to wait about 5 minutes as others was checking in but the checking in process was very quick with the front of house having all my details. Staff were polite and helpful in my opinion. We had Classic Double room which was nice and comfortable however the layout made it appear a little cramped but this wasn't an issue. Overall the place was beautifully presented and clean and the experience was a very pleasant one

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price or the location!”
Reviews.Author: mcharlin
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for easy access to London at an affordable price. Located just steps away from two major tube stops and with easy access to Regent's Park the hotel location is ideal. Service was very good at times (staff helped accommodate thoughtfully helped us at breakfast without request) and acceptable at others (received a smoking room with no other options even though I had requested non-smoking - apologies yes, but solution no). Rooms are typically small for London and don't expect great views but overall the location and price more than made up for this!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: amarabou
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard room, was offered and an upgrade on arrival for Â£20. We took this to get the superior room. The superior room was spacious enough. The room was of a good standard, but not exceptional. Hotel staff where friendly and the service was efficient. The hotel is a large busy hotel and is situated in a good place for access into the city, with 2 tube stations close by. Classed as a 5 star hotel, but would be closer to a good 4 star as although the hotel is Ok it is not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “The Best London Hotel We Have Stayed In...”
Reviews.Author: fionar1303
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at The Level at the Melia White House for the August Bank Holiday. Customer service delivery in this hotel was absolutely fantastic from the moment we arrived at the Level reception; the room was a great size and catered for our every need. We availed of the Level Lounge; complementary papers, drinks and tapas and it was a very relaxing area of the hotel. Breakfast was served here every morning and catered for all tastes and served great coffee!! If I had to point out one problem, it was the height of the bath whilst getting in and out of the shower. Both my husband and I are tall, but we thought it could be dangerous for others maneuvering as the side was extremely high. We will certainly return to the Melia and would certainly recommend it to anyone who wanted to stay near Regent's Park; the tube is across the road; there are taxis readily available and is very quiet at night (if you stay in the Level rooms). Well done Melia White House!

Reviews.Title: “Functional quality in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sully47
Reviews.Content: Just a stones throw across Marylebone Road from Great Portland Street tube this is a popular hotel judging by high occupancy this weekend. We upgraded to a superior room based on previous advice below and am glad we invested in a bit more comfort. However for a superior room surprised how small the rom was and the lack of small touches like bottled water in the room. These are minor gripes. The service and breakfast was very good and I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “basic rooms are . . . well, basic!”
Reviews.Author: twabong
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Melia many times. This was the first time in a standard double - previously stayed in a superior double. The superior rooms were very nice and spacious although the bathroom was small. The standard rooms are basic - comfortable bed but very small room, a little faded and the bathroom was even smaller. Portable TV on the desk, poor room lighting. The lesson - you get what you pay for but for a simple stop over Â£95 plus tax is good value for a great central london position.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: AandEUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great style and service is good but on my two trips I have not enjoyed my stay as much as I expected. The first time (in deep winter) the single glazing on the bathroom windows meant it was freezing. Lack of blinds etc meant I was quite visible to the outside world when showering ( not a pretty sight). On my latest stay, there was a strong smell of drains in the room (although strangely not in the bathroom). Pillows distinctly saggy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Great Portland St Tube - noisy room”
Reviews.Author: slipperyuno
Reviews.Content: We booked an Level Executive Double room which was spacious, nicely furnished and very clean. Reception was was very impressive, as was our welcome. Hotel is very close to the Tube and as we were seeing a concert at Wembley (only 3 tube stops along) this was a perfect location. The bar is open until 1.30 am and the atmosphere was great with snacks available until close. Drinks are very expensive. Our room was close to the lift and extremely noisy which we didn't realise until we went to bed at 1.00am, so I didn't get a good night sleep. I mentioned this to the receptionist at 7am and she advised we should have told them last night and they would have changed the room, too late :-( I asked if we could have a late check out so I could have a siesta but was only allowed to keep the room for an extra hour and was told 1 minute late on check out and we would be charged Â£50.00. Breakfast was in the Level lounge and was buffett, good selection. All in all a great hotel, we will learn to ask for a room not near the lift! BTW No parking available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: cristelCambs
Reviews.Content: after returning from the Melia White House, I would just like to say that the level of service from each and every sector of the hotel was to the highest standard that you would expect of a hotel of this caliber, nothing was to much trouble, every member of staff was attentive and very obliging, and we will certainly stay there again, yes it is a short walk to the likes of piccadilly circus, but is that not why we have legs, buses and taxi's.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Overworked Staff and Bad management.”
Reviews.Author: marija40
Reviews.Content: Located near Regents Park in London, you would expect at least 1 English speaking receptionist. Don't expect that in this Hotel. The breakfast room was full and even thou there was a few empty tables they couldn't be used as they were not cleared. There was only 2 staff who were overloaded with work. This was not a one off but it happened on every single day of my stay. The hotel is not bad but the level of service in the bar and restaurants as well as no English speaking receptionist was disappointing.. I do however recommend the food at the Albufera restaurant..

Reviews.Title: “Okay - nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: 1birdie23
Reviews.Content: Read previous bad reviews about standard room so booked The Level Executive Double Room. Room was exactly as pictured in website photos. The Level rooms include breakfast, free wifi, nibbles and drinks in The Level Lounge. Lounge very comfortable and a good place to chill out. Buffet dinner in The Place Restaurant was horrible so don't waste your money going there. Didn't eat in the Spanish restaurant. Not the best location to see London on foot. Close to underground station though. Can get better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for small room”
Reviews.Author: bikeman_surrey
Reviews.Content: Now I know that London prices are higher than UK norm, but I felt this hotel was poor value for money. The lobby looks great, but rooms are tiny. For Â£160 per night B&B for one person, I did expect a little more. In addition, internet access was charged at Â£5 extra - I did feel was just taking the micky. I refused to pay on principle, and took a 5 min walk to local Starbucks where internet connection was free , with a nice coffee. On the positive, the breakfast was excellent and staff were friendly - but this no more than I would expect anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: GaryAndrew
Reviews.Content: Just back from our second visit to the White House this year, this time celebrating my parents Diamond wedding anniversary, there is nothing that you could want that this hotel does not provide.........but the truly great part is the amazing service that every member of the staff offer. Nothing is too much trouble, every request is met with a smile, Do upgrade to the Level when you stay, it is splendid, and worth the extra And finally prepare to be utterly charmed by this excelent hotel and the delightful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was better than we expected - Beautiful Hotel (hidden)”
Reviews.Author: Dorianne62
Reviews.Content: This stay in march was wonderful, the hotel was very accessable to transport, and walking, with park on one side and a short walk to Oxford street on the other. My husband and nephew will be staying here again in August and my husband and I hope to be back again Sept./Oct 09. I would highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times when in London for the cricket at Lords and generally have a good experience. The last time I was there I was upgraded to a larger room. This time I was in the standard 'classic' room which is really small, although just about OK for one. The furniture is a bit tatty too. Still overall I like this hotel. The bar is a particularly good place to relax and the spectacularly beautiful Regent's Park is over the road. If you are staying here try and avoid the tiny 'classic rooms'.

Reviews.Title: “Box rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: ReshmaBudhia
Reviews.Content: Melia White House close to Regent Street is definitely a good looking hotel, huge, neat and good restaurants. Infact when my partner and me were at the lobby - we were quite impressed and glad at the choice we made......ofcourse we were yet to see our room. That was a huge disappointment - you can stretch out your arms and touch the two walls on opposite sides. The room was so cramped, small and dingy. There was hardly any place to get off - you literally jump hop off the bed to the door or into the bathroom. I would not recommend this to couples, especially if they are in London on a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - top London hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAWAustralia
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews we opted for a 'Level' room. The room was soundproofed, bed great, service and food were terrific - a fabulous start to our Europian holiday. Would highly recommend. We'll be back next time we visit the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4* London hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajn11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business - had a small room - clean and good facilities (very small bath though - just a shower tray really). Nice design and decoration. Public areas clean and well designed. Staff helpful. Location great very close to tube, Marylebone and Euston and Regents park for a walk. Nothing to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Just very average - small rooms - but real good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiversity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia to participate in an event of one of my clients. I arrived early, just before 12 noon, and there was no room available at first. This is unusual as some guests check out early in the morning so there should be some rooms ready at around 11. When I finally got a room (I had to change and wanted to shower), it was really small - smaller than you would expect it from the hotel category or the hotel website. Also, everything on the floor and in the room was very british old-fashioned with dark colours, wood, thick carpets etc. Not at all Melia style but that often happens when a cool hotel chain acquires hotels abroad and just puts its label on them. The good thing with the (new) Spanish owners is the breakfast: It combines the best of several worlds, including Spain. This was really delightful. Also the location is really good: Almost on Regents Park, and just a ten minute walk to Oxford Street / Soho. The area is hugely preferred over the more touristic areas like Russell Sq or Picadilly C. Unfortunately, the bad rooms make it impossible to recommend Melia.

Reviews.Title: “What a very friendly Hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Elanor9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Melia White House last year. Three friends and I booked the Level 7 accomodation. We were very impressed with the friendly, attentive staff and the accomodation itself. The location is excellent, my friends and I were in London for one night. A stones throw from Euston Station, handy to take a stroll in beautiful Regents Park and just three stops on the tube (Tube station over the road from the Hotel) to Wembley where we were attending a concert. Left the concert at 10.30pm and we were sat in the bar enjoying a relaxing drink and snack by 11.15pm. The bar itself tends to have a pleasant ambience. Some public areas have no atmosphere and if you are a solo resident this can be off putting. Pleased to say this was not the case with The Melia White House. Congratulations to the Mangement and staff for all their efforts in making our stay so enjoyable. Will definitely re book when I am in London next and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Small bedrooms but comfortable surroundings”
Reviews.Author: stevejb4u
Reviews.Content: A nice stylish hotel that felt like we were on the Titanic (see photos) which added humour to our stay. The room was a little small and only single beds for a twin room and a small bathroom so not very spacious at all. HOWEVER it was a nice stay, breakfast was buffet style either hot or cold and generous for choice. Friendly & helpfull staff at reception, and at the end of the night theres a nice relaxing piano bar for a night cap after a social evening out.

Reviews.Title: “We really like it...”
Reviews.Author: Adventure_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing.We've been there only for 3 days,but we were very satisfied.The location is perfect near to the underground,to the park. We don't like only the service on the reception,they were very slowly and made that they didn't understand what we talk about.But except that our stay in the hotel was great.The breakfast is good too.And I would go back someday again in Melia.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment!”
Reviews.Author: madolali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at White House 8 years ago and had a great experience so were looking forward to our recent stay. We were very disappointed. Our main complaint is the cleanliness of the rooms: carpet was awfully dirty, sheets were stained, dust everywhere, safe and AC did not work. Service is not high quality anymore. Agree with a previous reviewer who stated the hotel has gone downhill. Only good thing about hotel is its location within walking distance from underground stops and Regent's Park.

Reviews.Title: “Faeces on floor: everything broken or dirty”
Reviews.Author: Fluffalicious
Reviews.Content: Wow - has this place gone downhill. I've stayed here 3 times before and this time was a horror. the first room had paint peeling off the windows, which didn't shut and the roar of the buses was deafening. the mirror in the bathroom was cracked. The next room (which I stayed in) had a plug for the bath 2cm smaller than the plug hole, so that was unusable; the powerpoints in the wall didn't work so you couldn't boil a kettle or charge the phone; the hairdryer was so cracked that the hot air came out of the handle and scalded your hand and there was a pile of dirt behind the bathroom door. The room was so small you couldn't physically sit at the table. I made the mistake of using the toilet in the lobby. There were faeces on the floor. Seriously... there was also a substantial amount of dirt and grime round the edges of the floor. I'm not a clean freak at all and this just revolted me. The queues for check in, check out and breakfast grow ever long. More than 30 people queued in front of me at breakfast as their method of allocating seating was so slow. The staff are pretty curt. Stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy84
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal on booking.com 200 for 2nights the hotel is centrally located on the circle line a couple of stops from Victoria, Liverpool and Paddington stations. nice area with a pret a manger, express tesco, regents park and a couple of pubs and restaurants the reception area is really nice and the staff were very friendly. our room was small enough but very comfortable and warm. we had lots of channels on the tv, good powerful shower, tea and coffee facilities, iron, trouser presser, safe and fluffy towels there is a nice leisure centre, a gym, coffee shop, bar and restaurant with an extensive menu, we tried it one of the nights and enjoyed our meal we would stay here again, central, very comfortable and that little bit away from the noise so you can relax after a day on Oxford St

Reviews.Title: “outside trendy London,inside a wonderfull place to rest...”
Reviews.Author: vbhkaz71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Melia White house for 6 wonderfull days and nights.The Staff was very kind and friendly.The Level room we had was very comfortable.From breakfast to late in the evening ,everything was good served.We'll comeback in december for another great stay in London and the Melia White house hotel...

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE”
Reviews.Author: SICKBOY67
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i have ever stayed in . fantastic sevice ,great location good breakfast and bar ,loverly room ,modernised but with style and class .loved it and when i left they gave me some money wayhay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Claire081
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia White House in London for a few nights in May. On arrival, we upgraded to a deluxe room for an extra 15 pounds â€“ meaning that we paid a total of around 120 pounds inclusive of tax per night. In my view, this represented great value. The hotel is in a prime location near Great Portland Street station, a couple of minutesâ€™ walk from Regentâ€™s Park station and about ten minutes walk from the Baker Street station. The lobby is enormous by London standards â€“ all marble, orchids and chandeliers â€“ with a bustling, pleasingly big-city feel. The rooms are a decent size for London - very clean, secure, and well appointed in typical anonymous four-star hotel style. The bathroom was small but functional. Our only minor concern was the rooms were pretty warm, even if you turned down the thermostat. Lastly, the bar was pricey but quite full with a good atmosphere â€“ and bonus points for the spirits trolley the waiting staff wheeled around the room!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: worthingwanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at a special rate through Expedia. We were attending the Royal National Orthopaedic Hopsital, and chose this hotel as it was 2 minutes walk away. We had booked an executive room on The Level. This included use of The Level check-in, dining room, and lounge, with complimentary drinks in the evening. Although it was just after midday, our room was ready. It was large, with a massive bed and classic style furniture. The bathroom was small, but pleasantly finished, in black marble and gold. We overlooked a building site at the back (where doesn't in this part of London), but experienced little noise, even though we chose to open the windows rather than use the air-conditioning at night. We ate breakfast in the hotel, in The Level Dining Room. It was almost empty, and very comfortable. Service was efficient but relaxed. Some of the cooked food was a little cold, but this was a minor complaint, and the choice was good. We checked out and left our cases in secure storage until later in the day. This had been a very pleasant stay, and was excellent value (cheaper than a chain hotel in Victoria). The hotel was large, but service and the ambience were so good we would love to return if able to take advantage of a special deal in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Like a sauna..............!!!”
Reviews.Author: DEBIDOLITTLE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the Bank Holiday weekend (end of May) for 3 nights. First impressions were good. Hotel is very clean and staff helpful. Breakfast was very good........once you had queued for it. Ate at The Place restaurant and the food was very good as was the service. Rooms were clean and beds very comfy. No problems with noise, despite the roadworks outside. The only gripe we had was it was so hot!!!! I dont know if they had a problem with the air conditioning but at times it was quite unbearable...............................this applied to all communal areas, including restaurant, lobby, bar and corridors on the bedroom floors. Bedrooms were fine but word of advice...you will need to use the air-con if you want to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay but bad breakfast and outside noise”
Reviews.Author: DANANDJONZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a Level Executive Room. We arrived very early and were given a spacious room and great service. The room was a good size, nice bathroom and a lovely bed. The hotel is a lovely hotel and very relaxing where it definitely pays to upgrade having stayed in a standard room before. Room service was excellent with food being hot and very tasty. Location is excellent with shops and the tube very close. Two main negatives would be the lack of soundproofing so you hear a lot of noise from cars or noisy people outside the hotel. The other point was the breakfast. Milk that had curdled, beans, mushrooms and eggs that were rubbery and inedible.Breakfast staff were also very abrupt and nowhere near as professional as you would expect. Overall a very relaxing stay with good and bad points.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms are very very very small”
Reviews.Author: fgbl
Reviews.Content: Some reviewers indicated that standard rooms are small. And that it is ok because it is London. I don't think it is OK.
